original: sems can don ni bcom gyur pas //
analyzed: sems can don ni bcom gyur pas //
translated: Since the welfare of sentient beings is destroyed,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: thus it is.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba rnam par 'joms par byed pa des kyang sems can ma lus pa'i don nyams par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba rnam par 'joms par byed pa des kyang sems can ma lus pa'i don nyams par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that destruction of the bodhisattva’s virtue, the welfare of all sentient beings is destroyed.

original: ji ltar na 'di'i ngan 'gro la mu mtha' med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di'i ngan 'gro la mu mtha' med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that there is no end to his bad migrations?

original: 'di'i 'thad pa ;
analyzed: 'di'i 'thad pa ;
translated: The rationale for that is stated

original: sems can gcig gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can gcig gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: in the line “If one sentient being,” and so on.

original: phan pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: phan pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: “Welfare” is a synecdoche;

original: bde ba la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: “happiness” should also be understood.

original: nyams gyur na ste /
analyzed: nyams gyur na ste /
translated: “If it is destroyed” means

original: bde 'gro nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde 'gro nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: if the happy migrations are destroyed.

original: don 'di yang rab tu zhi ba rnam par gdon mi za ba'i tshe 'phrul gyi mdo las bstan te /
analyzed: don 'di yang rab tu zhi ba rnam par gdon mi za ba'i tshe 'phrul gyi mdo las bstan te /
translated: This point is also taught in the Sūtra of Aśvaghoṣa’s Miracles:

original: 'jam dpal rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i sems can thams cad srog dang phral zhing bdog pa thams cad phral la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i sems can thams cad srog dang phral zhing bdog pa thams cad phral la /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if a son or daughter of good lineage were to kill all the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa and rob them of all their possessions,🔽and

original: 'jam dpal rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gzhan dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i @79b sems kyi bar chad byed de /
analyzed: 'jam dpal rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gzhan dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i @79b sems kyi bar chad byed de /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if other sons or daughters of good family were to create obstacles for the virtuous mind of a bodhisattva,

original: tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa la kham gcig tsam ster ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i bar du gcod na de ni de bas ches grangs med pa'i sdig pa skyed do //
analyzed: tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa la kham gcig tsam ster ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i bar du gcod na de ni de bas ches grangs med pa'i sdig pa skyed do //
translated: even if it were to be an obstacle to the virtue that arises from giving a single morsel of food to an animal, they would create incalculably more nonvirtue than that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de sangs rgyas 'byung ba skyed par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi bar chad byed par gnas par gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas 'byung ba skyed par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi bar chad byed par gnas par gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because they would be standing in the way of the roots of virtue that give rise to the appearance of the Buddha.

original: de lta zhes bya ba ni sngar brjod pa'i rim pas yin te /
analyzed: de lta zhes bya ba ni sngar brjod pa'i rim pas yin te /
translated: In that way means in the sequence that was previously explained.

original: rang gi byed pas ltung ba dang bcas par gyur pa dang / byang chub kyi sems rab tu brten par ma nos pa'i phyir rgyab tu drangs shing slar yang mdun du khrid par byas pa de ltar res kyis 'gre bar byed pas sa thob pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi byed pas ltung ba dang bcas par gyur pa dang / byang chub kyi sems rab tu brten par ma nos pa'i phyir rgyab tu drangs shing slar yang mdun du khrid par byas pa de ltar res kyis 'gre bar byed pas sa thob pa ste /
translated: And because of the fall due to his own action, and because of not taking up the firm intention for enlightenment, he is drawn backward and again led forward. Thus, he is repeatedly made to crawl.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa thob pa la yun rings thogs shing dus ring po 'khor bar yongs su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa thob pa la yun rings thogs shing dus ring po 'khor bar yongs su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He is delayed for a long time in attaining the stages, such as the Joyous, and is born in cyclic existence for a long time.

original: de bas na ji ltar rigs she na /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar rigs she na /
translated: Therefore, how is it proper?

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: ji ltar dam bcas ni sems can thams cad gdon par bya ba'i phyir khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dam bcas ni sems can thams cad gdon par bya ba'i phyir khas blangs pa'o //
translated: As promised is the vow to liberate all beings.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni rdzogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni rdzogs par bya ba'o //
translated: To be accomplished is to be completed.

original: bdag gis brtson par ni dang du blang ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis brtson par ni dang du blang ba'o //
translated: To be striven for is to be undertaken.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni phyi nas bya'o snyam du yid la'ang mi bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni phyi nas bya'o snyam du yid la'ang mi bya'o //
translated: Then is to be done later.

original: 'og nas 'og tu 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gror brgyud nas 'og tu 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'og nas 'og tu 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gror brgyud nas 'og tu 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “They go lower and lower” means that they go lower and lower through the miserable realms.

original: de ltar yin du zin kyang de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' zhig dang phrad pa la brten nas nyes pa thams cad spong ba'i phyir ngan 'gro'i dogs pa ga la yod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar yin du zin kyang de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' zhig dang phrad pa la brten nas nyes pa thams cad spong ba'i phyir ngan 'gro'i dogs pa ga la yod ce na /
translated: Even though this is so, since they rely on encountering some Tathagata, they abandon all faults. So how can they fear the miserable realms?

original: 'dir sems can phan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir sems can phan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, the text states “the benefit of sentient beings,” and so on.

original: grangs med pa ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa bzhin du sangs rgyas 'byung ba la thog ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs med pa ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa bzhin du sangs rgyas 'byung ba la thog ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Innumerable” means that, like the beginningless cyclic existence, the appearance of the Buddhas has no beginning.

original: sems can thams cad tshol mdzad pa ni 'gro ba ma lus pa la phan pa dang bde bar sbyar ba'i phyir rgyun du gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad tshol mdzad pa ni 'gro ba ma lus pa la phan pa dang bde bar sbyar ba'i phyir rgyun du gzigs pa'o //
translated: “Seeking all sentient beings” means that they always see all beings without exception in order to connect them with benefit and happiness.

original: de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi /
translated: Even though this is so,

original: rang gi nyes pas te bdag nyid kyi nyes par spyad pas de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi gso ba'i spyod yul du bdag ma gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi nyes pas te bdag nyid kyi nyes par spyad pas de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi gso ba'i spyod yul du bdag ma gyur te /
translated: “by our own faults,” by our own misdeeds, “we have not become the objects of their healing.”

original: gso bar mi rung ba'i nad kyis btab pa'i nad pa bzhin du sman pa chen po yis kyang gso ba'i skal ba med par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gso bar mi rung ba'i nad kyis btab pa'i nad pa bzhin du sman pa chen po yis kyang gso ba'i skal ba med par gyur pa yin no //
translated: He is like a patient who is afflicted with an incurable disease and is beyond the care of a great physician.

original: gang zhig nam du yang ma byung ba de ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod ce na /🔽da dung zhes bya ba la @80a * //
analyzed: gang zhig nam du yang ma byung ba de ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod ce na / da dung zhes bya ba la @80a * //
translated: What is the reason that something which has never existed will not come to exist?

original: sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says “as long as” and so on.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i sdom pa lhod pa ste mi dge ba las mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i sdom pa lhod pa ste mi dge ba las mi ldog pa'o //
translated: “Just as” refers to the laxity of the vow of training, i.e., not turning away from evil.

original: bcad dang ni rkang lag dang rna ba dang sna la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcad dang ni rkang lag dang rna ba dang sna la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Cutting off” refers to hands, feet, ears, nose, and so on.

original: gshegs pa ni de dag nyid la mdung thung dang / gsal shing dang mda' la sogs pa rnams kyis so ;
analyzed: gshegs pa ni de dag nyid la mdung thung dang / gsal shing dang mda' la sogs pa rnams kyis so ;
translated: “Piercing” refers to those very same limbs with spears, stakes, arrows, and so on.

original: / sogs pa'i sgras ni gsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / brdeg pa la sogs gzung ngo //
analyzed: / sogs pa'i sgras ni gsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / brdeg pa la sogs gzung ngo //
translated: The word “and so on” includes killing, binding, beating, and so on.

original: gzhan yang 'di 'dra'i 'du 'phrod ni shin tu dkon zhes bya ba yin pas de'i phyir ded nas brtson par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di 'dra'i 'du 'phrod ni shin tu dkon zhes bya ba yin pas de'i phyir ded nas brtson par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate that such a coming together is extremely rare, and therefore one should strive for it,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The appearance of a Tathagata, etc.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni brgya la res 'ga' srid pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni brgya la res 'ga' srid pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The appearance of a Tathagata is the appearance of a Buddha, which is possible only once in a hundred million years.

original: dad pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don dad pas sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don dad pas sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Faith is the faith in the mundane and supramundane aims, which attracts.

original: mi zhes bya ba ni mi khom pa spangs pa'i mi'i dngos pa'o //
analyzed: mi zhes bya ba ni mi khom pa spangs pa'i mi'i dngos pa'o //
translated: A human birth is the state of being a human being, which is free from the unfavorable conditions.

original: dge goms rung ba zhes bya ba ni dbang po ma tshang ba med pa dang nyams bde ba'o //
analyzed: dge goms rung ba zhes bya ba ni dbang po ma tshang ba med pa dang nyams bde ba'o //
translated: Suitability for the cultivation of virtue is the absence of a deficiency of the faculties and the presence of well-being.

original: de dag thams cad ni shin tu dkon pa ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni shin tu dkon pa ste /
translated: All of these are extremely rare.

original: bya sla bar rnyed pa ma yin no //🔽gang nam zhig thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bya sla bar rnyed pa ma yin no // gang nam zhig thob par 'gyur te /
translated: They are not easily obtained.🔽When will they be obtained?

original: dus gang gi tshe 'thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe 'thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: At what time will they be obtained?

original: 'di ltar yang myur ba kho nar 'dir bya ba nyid du rigs pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang myur ba kho nar 'dir bya ba nyid du rigs pa /
translated: Thus, it is only proper to act quickly in this way.

original: nad med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nad med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says without disease, etc.

original: nad las rnam par grol ba'i dus so //
analyzed: nad las rnam par grol ba'i dus so //
translated: The time is free from disease.

original: zas bcas zhes bya ba ni zas med pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zas bcas zhes bya ba ni zas med pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: With food means not without food.

original: 'tshe ba med pa ni chom rkun dang / sbrul dang / gcan gzan dang / sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu mchu rings dang / sdig pa la sogs pa'i 'tshe ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med pa ni chom rkun dang / sbrul dang / gcan gzan dang / sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu mchu rings dang / sdig pa la sogs pa'i 'tshe ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: Free from harm means free from the harm of thieves, snakes, wild animals, flies, mosquitoes, scorpions, and so on.

original: lus dang srog la yid ches pa med pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus dang srog la yid ches pa med pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that there is no confidence in body and life, he says:

original: tshe ni skad cig slu ba ste /
analyzed: tshe ni skad cig slu ba ste /
translated: Life is momentary and deceptive.

original: blo bur du thog chen po 'bab pa ltar skad cig nyid la slu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: blo bur du thog chen po 'bab pa ltar skad cig nyid la slu bar byed pa'o //
translated: It deceives in an instant, like a sudden flash of lightning.

original: lus 'di thang cig brnyan po bzhin bdag nyid kyi dbang du ma gyur pa'i phyir pha rol gyi brnyan pa'i rgyan dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: lus 'di thang cig brnyan po bzhin bdag nyid kyi dbang du ma gyur pa'i phyir pha rol gyi brnyan pa'i rgyan dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: This body is like a borrowed ornament, because it is not under one's own control, like a borrowed ornament of another person.

original: glo bur du 'chi bdag gis phral nas 'khyer ba'o //
analyzed: glo bur du 'chi bdag gis phral nas 'khyer ba'o //
translated: Death suddenly snatches it away means that it is suddenly taken away by the Lord of Death.

original: mi lus 'thob pa'i nges pa yang med pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir //🔽bdag gi spyod pa 'di 'dras ni //
analyzed: mi lus 'thob pa'i nges pa yang med pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir // bdag gi spyod pa 'di 'dras ni //
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no certainty of obtaining a human birth,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “By this sort of conduct of mine,” etc.

original: bdag gi spyod pa mi dge ba byed pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: bdag gi spyod pa mi dge ba byed pa rnams kyis te /
translated: By this sort of conduct, i.e., by the unwholesome conduct of mine.

original: slar yang zhes @80b bya ba ni tshe rabs gzhan du ste /
analyzed: slar yang zhes @80b bya ba ni tshe rabs gzhan du ste /
translated: Again means in other lives.

original: de'i tshe ngan 'gro nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe ngan 'gro nyid do //
translated: At that time, there is only the lower realms.

original: ngan 'gror lhung na yang sdig pa 'ba' zhig sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngan 'gror lhung na yang sdig pa 'ba' zhig sogs pa'o //
translated: When one falls into the lower realms, one accumulates only evil.

original: ngan 'gro la dge ba spyod pa'i skal ba yod pa ma yin no zhes /
analyzed: ngan 'gro la dge ba spyod pa'i skal ba yod pa ma yin no zhes /
translated: There is no opportunity to practice virtue in the lower realms.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te dge ba'i nus pa yod kyang ngo //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te dge ba'i nus pa yod kyang ngo //
translated: Even if there were the capacity for virtue, he says, “If, overcome by the suffering of the lower realms,” etc.

original: ngan song sdug bsngal gyis zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i gnod pas kun nas non pas kun nas brgyal ba'am /
analyzed: ngan song sdug bsngal gyis zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i gnod pas kun nas non pas kun nas brgyal ba'am /
translated: Overcome by the suffering of the lower realms means that one is overcome by the torment of the harm of the hells, etc.

original: phan pa dang mi phan pa'i yongs su shes pa med pas bya ba thams cad la las su rung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: phan pa dang mi phan pa'i yongs su shes pa med pas bya ba thams cad la las su rung ba med pa'o //
translated: Or, because one does not know what is beneficial and what is not, one is not fit for any action.

original: de spyad tshe ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'i skabs su'o //
analyzed: de spyad tshe ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'i skabs su'o //
translated: When one practices that, one experiences the suffering of the hells and so on.

original: dge ba zhes bya ba ni spyod par ma gyur la /
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba ni spyod par ma gyur la /
translated: The virtuous is not the practice,🔽May the higher realms arise from me! is not like that.

original: mtho ris ni bdag las 'byung bar shog shig snyam du de lta ma yin no zhes dge ba dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mtho ris ni bdag las 'byung bar shog shig snyam du de lta ma yin no zhes dge ba dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, even the virtuous and so on are said.

original: dge ba mi byed par sdig pa bsags pa la'o //🔽bde 'gro'i sgra yang thos mi 'gyur //
analyzed: dge ba mi byed par sdig pa bsags pa la'o // bde 'gro'i sgra yang thos mi 'gyur //
translated: Not doing the virtuous, accumulating the unvirtuous,🔽One will not even hear the word 'higher rebirth.'

original: zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro'i grag pa tsam yang spangs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro'i grag pa tsam yang spangs pa'o //
translated: The word higher rebirth is abandoned.

original: bde 'gro'i rgyu ni dge ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: bde 'gro'i rgyu ni dge ba nyid yin na /
translated: The cause of higher rebirth is virtue itself.

original: de med par bde 'gro ga las 'byung snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de med par bde 'gro ga las 'byung snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Without that, how can higher rebirth arise? is the thought.

original: bskal pa bye ba brgyar yang ni //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba brgyar yang ni //
translated: For a hundred million eons,

original: zhes bya ba ni ngan song gcig nas ngan song gzhan du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngan song gcig nas ngan song gzhan du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because one goes from one lower realm to another lower realm.

original: de nyid lung las kyang bstan to zhes ;
analyzed: de nyid lung las kyang bstan to zhes ;
translated: That itself is taught in the scriptures, thus

original: de nyid phyir na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid phyir na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: For that very reason and so on is said.

original: mi nyid ces bya ba ni mi khom pa brgyad rnam par spangs pa'i mi'i lus so //
analyzed: mi nyid ces bya ba ni mi khom pa brgyad rnam par spangs pa'i mi'i lus so //
translated: Human existence is a human body that has abandoned the eight conditions that lack opportunity.

original: 'dir dper brjod pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir dper brjod pa bstan pa ni /
translated: Here, the illustration is taught:

original: rgya mtsho cher g-yengs zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rgya mtsho cher g-yengs zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Like a turtle's neck entering the hole of a yoke floating on a great ocean...

original: dper na yongs su brtag pa nye bar bzung ste 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad rgya mtsho chen po'i chu gcig gi gzhir gyur la /
analyzed: dper na yongs su brtag pa nye bar bzung ste 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad rgya mtsho chen po'i chu gcig gi gzhir gyur la /
translated: For example, it is like the following hypothetical case: the entire continent of Jambudvīpa becomes the surface of the water of a great ocean.

original: der yang gnya' shing bug gcig pa yongs su 'phyo ba la shar nas rlung gis nub kyi 'gram du nub nas rlung gis shar gyi 'gram du khyer zhing /
analyzed: der yang gnya' shing bug gcig pa yongs su 'phyo ba la shar nas rlung gis nub kyi 'gram du nub nas rlung gis shar gyi 'gram du khyer zhing /
translated: And on that, a yoke with a single hole is floating around. A wind from the east carries it to the western shore, and a wind from the west carries it to the eastern shore.

original: de bzhin du lho nas byang dang / byang nas lho'i 'gram du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lho nas byang dang / byang nas lho'i 'gram du ste /
translated: Similarly, from the south to the north and from the north to the southern shore.

original: rgya mtsho der rus sbal zhar ba gcig gnas shing /
analyzed: rgya mtsho der rus sbal zhar ba gcig gnas shing /
translated: In that ocean, there is a blind turtle who lives there.

original: de yang lo brgya 'das pa dang / mgrin pa btegs nas lta'o //
analyzed: de yang lo brgya 'das pa dang / mgrin pa btegs nas lta'o //
translated: And after a hundred years have passed, he raises his neck and looks around.

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig tu 'di 'dra ba'i tshogs pa yod par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig tu 'di 'dra ba'i tshogs pa yod par gyur pa ste /
translated: It is like this: If a collection like this exists somewhere,

original: shing gang yin pa mig zhar ba de'i phyogs su song bar gyur pa dang / de la mi lta na yang de'i mgrin pa bu ga @81a * //
analyzed: shing gang yin pa mig zhar ba de'i phyogs su song bar gyur pa dang / de la mi lta na yang de'i mgrin pa bu ga @81a * //
translated: The tree went in the direction of the blind man, and although he did not see it, the tree entered his throat

original: der chud pa bzhin du mi'i lus thob pa yang dpe de bzhin no //
analyzed: der chud pa bzhin du mi'i lus thob pa yang dpe de bzhin no //
translated: and he died. The attainment of a human body is like that example.

original: yang ci'i phyir de lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: skad cig gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: skad cig gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “In one moment,” and so on.

original: gang yang sbyor ba'i skad cig ma mang mod kyi /

original: nyams su myong nas so //

original: de ni zhes bya ba byed pa pos te /

analyzed: @81b bdag nyid kyis kyang bdag nyid la slu ba dge ba'i nor nyams par byed pa 'di las bslus pa chen po gzhan med do //

analyzed: gti mug kyang 'di las che zhing mchog tu gyur pa 'byung ba med de //
translated: There is no greater delusion than this, that one is deluded about the highest truth.

analyzed: gang zhig dge ba'i chos kyi nor lag na gnas pa mthong bzhin du 'phrog pa yin no //

analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni 'di 'dra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /

original: 'di ltar mi dge ba'i phyogs stobs che ba dang / dal ba phun sum tshogs pa mchog tu dkon pa dang / gti mug ni shin tu nus pa dang ldan par rig nas ji skad du bstan pa'i bslab pa sgrub pa'i phyir dang / rang gi sems brtan par bya ba'i phyir /

translated: Having understood that the side of nonvirtue is powerful, that the perfection of leisure and opportunity is extremely rare, and that delusion is very strong, one should generate effort in order to practice the training as it has been taught and in order to stabilize one's mind.

analyzed: gal te bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis bdag nyid kyi tshul 'di brtags nas brtson 'grus bskyed pa ni /

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: de dag brten par spyad par bya'o //

analyzed: dge ba'i las rnams la spro ba med pa'am yid bsad par gyur na'o //

original: ci zhig gis she na /
analyzed: ci zhig gis she na /

original: rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: rmongs pa ste /
translated: By delusion.

original: gal te rmongs pa'i dbang du gyur nas so //
analyzed: gal te rmongs pa'i dbang du gyur nas so //
translated: If one comes under the influence of delusion.

original: de'i tshe mya ngan ldang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mya ngan ldang bar 'gyur te /

original: mya ngan 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: sorrow will arise.

original: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar yun ring du ni dus ring por te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar yun ring du ni dus ring por te /

analyzed: phyir zhing ni ji ltar sngar ma bslabs bas mya ngan dang ldan pa bzhin du slar yang ngo //

analyzed: ci'i phyir khyod kyis sngar 'di lta bu byas zhes brjod cing sngar byas pa'i las rjes su dran pas sam /

original: bag med pa'i 'bras bu gzhan yang yod do zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bag med pa'i 'bras bu gzhan yang yod do zhes bstan pa ni /

original: dmyal me zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te //
analyzed: dmyal me zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te //

analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i me de ni sems can dmyal ba pa rnams bsreg pa'i phyir rab tu spang ba yin pas dmyal ba pa'i'o //

analyzed: bzod dka' ni shin tu sdug bsngal bas bstan par mi nus pa'o //
translated: It is difficult to bear because it cannot be endured due to its extreme suffering.

analyzed: bdag gis de ltar ci ste bya snyam nas phyis gdung ba de nyid me dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: Thinking, Why should I do that? later, that very remorse is like fire,

original: sems sreg par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems sreg par byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ma bslabs zhes bya ba ni bslab pa med pa ste ma bsdams pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word uneducated means without training, that is, undisciplined.

original: yang bdag nyid @82a * //
analyzed: yang bdag nyid @82a * //

original: kyis brtags pa /

analyzed: de dag ni lam dang khams bden pa'i rab tu dbye bas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa'i ni brgya nyi shur 'gyur ba yin no //

analyzed: dpa' ba ste dpa' brtan dang mi ldan pa'o //

original: mdzangs min te yid gzhungs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mdzangs min te yid gzhungs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: He is not wise, that is, he is not intelligent.

original: 'di ni shin tu yang ngo mtshar che ba yin no zhes /

translated: The verse beginning When my mind is based on itself is stated.🔽 The phrase as it wishes means without regard for the world or for what others think.🔽 It is not right to rely on them.🔽 And even if they do, I will not get angry.🔽The verse beginning When my mind is based on itself is stated.🔽 The phrase as it wishes means without regard for the world or for what others think.

analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pas ni gzhan gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa rigs pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: It is not right to rely on them.🔽 And even if they do, I will not get angry.🔽The verse beginning When my mind is based on itself is stated.🔽 The phrase as it wishes means without regard for the world or for what others think.

original: 'dir / gnas min zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir / gnas min zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is not right to rely on them.🔽 And even if they do, I will not get angry.🔽The verse beginning When my mind is based on itself is stated.

original: yul 'di lta bu la bzod pa'i ngang tshul can ni smad pa yin no //
analyzed: yul 'di lta bu la bzod pa'i ngang tshul can ni smad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase as it wishes means without regard for the world or for what others think.🔽 It is not right to rely on them.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar de dag khyod mi bzod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar de dag khyod mi bzod ce na /
translated: And even if they do, I will not get angry.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning When my mind is based on itself is stated.🔽 The

original: de dag gis ji ltar dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa de ltar dgra gzhan dag gis khrid cing spyod par mi nus shing mi lcogs so //
analyzed: de dag gis ji ltar dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa de ltar dgra gzhan dag gis khrid cing spyod par mi nus shing mi lcogs so //
translated: Other enemies cannot lead and employ one in the way that these afflictions lead and employ one to generate the suffering of the hells and so on.

original: mnar med pa'i me ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: mnar med pa'i me ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the fire of Avīci?

original: ri rab kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: ri rab kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is said, “Even Sumeru,” and so on.

original: ri rab kyang zhes bya ba ni gzhan ngan ngon ltar re zhig zhog / ri'i rgyal po dang me phrad na yang thal ba yang mi mngon par byed de /
analyzed: ri rab kyang zhes bya ba ni gzhan ngan ngon ltar re zhig zhog / ri'i rgyal po dang me phrad na yang thal ba yang mi mngon par byed de /
translated: Even Sumeru, the king of mountains, is set aside for the moment, and when it meets with fire, even its ashes do not appear,

original: me drag po'i 'bar ba chen pos sreg par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me drag po'i 'bar ba chen pos sreg par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is burned by the great blazing of intense fire.

original: der bdag skad cig gcig la 'dor te 'di 'dra ba'i mer ro //
analyzed: der bdag skad cig gcig la 'dor te 'di 'dra ba'i mer ro //
translated: In that way, in such a fire, one is cast for a single moment.

original: mtshams med pa'i las kyi rgyu rnams ni stobs can nus pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: mtshams med pa'i las kyi rgyu rnams ni stobs can nus pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The causes of the heinous actions are powerful and effective,

original: gnyen pos kun nas slong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen pos kun nas slong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not motivated by antidotes.

original: 'o na khyod de dag la la ni de ltar 'khon du 'dzin pa dam por byed la dgra gzhan dag la ni ma yin pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na khyod de dag la la ni de ltar 'khon du 'dzin pa dam por byed la dgra gzhan dag la ni ma yin pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, why do you hold grudges against some of them, but not against other enemies?

original: bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: He says “my” and so on.

original: thog mtha' med pa zhes bya ba ni sngon dang phyi ma'i dus te ;
analyzed: thog mtha' med pa zhes bya ba ni sngon dang phyi ma'i dus te ;
translated: “Beginningless and endless” means past and future,

original: 'khor ba mthar thug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba mthar thug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because cyclic existence is not terminated.

original: gzhan dag la ni nyi ma so sor nges par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni nyi ma so sor nges par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But other enemies are not like that, because they are limited to a single day.

original: dgra gzhan kun ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgra gzhan kun ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Other enemies” are gods, humans, and so on.

original: 'o na de dang mthun par spyad na dbang du 'gyur ba dang phan pa dang bde ba sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de dang mthun par spyad na dbang du 'gyur ba dang phan pa dang bde ba sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Well then, if you act in accordance with them, won’t they come under your control and help you and make you happy?

original: @83a * // 'dir mthun par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: @83a * // 'dir mthun par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here he says “in accordance” and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa 'di dag ni de bzhin du rjes su 'brang na mi phan pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal shin tu skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'di dag ni de bzhin du rjes su 'brang na mi phan pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal shin tu skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: Since these afflictions are harmful in that they pursue one in this way, they generate the suffering of the hells and so forth.

original: rang bzhin mi srun pa'i phyir nan gyis gzhom par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi srun pa'i phyir nan gyis gzhom par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: Because they are naturally unruly, they must be forcibly subdued.

original: de bas na nges par 'di dag nyid bdag gis bya bar 'os pa yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na nges par 'di dag nyid bdag gis bya bar 'os pa yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is definitely appropriate for me to do this.

original: de ltar zhes te de bzhin du rgyun chags shing bar med par te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes te de bzhin du rgyun chags shing bar med par te /
translated: Thus means in that way, continuously and uninterruptedly.

original: dus thog mtha' med par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir dang / nye bar 'joms par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dus thog mtha' med par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir dang / nye bar 'joms par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they remain close by and destroy,

original: yun rings dgrar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: yun rings dgrar gyur pa yin no //
translated: they are long-term enemies.

original: glegs bam la lar rgyun zhes 'don pa der ni rgyun bar ma chad par 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: glegs bam la lar rgyun zhes 'don pa der ni rgyun bar ma chad par 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: In some texts, the reading is “continuously,” and in that case, it should be explained that they are long-term enemies because they engage in an uninterrupted continuum.

original: yang khyad par du byed pa ni /
analyzed: yang khyad par du byed pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the qualification is

original: gnod pa zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa zhes pa yin te /
translated: harmful.

original: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gnod pa ji snyed pa rnams te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gnod pa ji snyed pa rnams te /
translated: All the harms of the sufferings of the hells and so on.

original: de skye ba'i rgyu gcig pu kho na'i snying la legs par gnas bcas pa de dag nyid /
analyzed: de skye ba'i rgyu gcig pu kho na'i snying la legs par gnas bcas pa de dag nyid /
translated: The single cause of their arising is well-established in the heart.

original: yod na 'khor bar bdag 'jigs pa med de 'jigs pa dang bral zhing dga' bar ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod na 'khor bar bdag 'jigs pa med de 'jigs pa dang bral zhing dga' bar ga la 'gyur te /
translated: If they exist, how can one be fearless in cyclic existence? How can one be free from fear and joyful?

original: mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not reasonable, is the meaning.

original: yang nyon mongs pa'i dgra bo rnams spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa'i dgra bo rnams spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to abandon the enemies of the afflictions,

original: sha khon zhugs par zhen pa yid la brten par gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sha khon zhugs par zhen pa yid la brten par gzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to establish the mind in the clinging of enmity,

original: 'khor ba'i btson ra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i btson ra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: he says, “In the prison of cyclic existence,” and so on.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i gnas byed pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i gnas byed pa'o //
translated: It is the place of definite emergence.

original: dmyal sogs na'ang gsod byed gshed ma ni gshin rje'i skyes bu de dag yin te /
analyzed: dmyal sogs na'ang gsod byed gshed ma ni gshin rje'i skyes bu de dag yin te /
translated: In the hells and so on, the killers, the executioners, are the beings of Yama.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa la las kyi rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis de dag snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa la las kyi rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis de dag snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they appear by the power of the ripening of karma to those who are under the power of the afflictions.

original: de ltar zhes nyes pa ma lus pa'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa de dag gal te yid kyi khyim du chags pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzeb gang yin pa der gal te gnas par gyur na ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes nyes pa ma lus pa'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa de dag gal te yid kyi khyim du chags pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzeb gang yin pa der gal te gnas par gyur na ste /
translated: Thus, if they, who are the source of all faults, should stay in the cage of the nature of attachment to the house of the mind,

original: rdzod la brten nas gal te 'dug na bdag la ga la bde /
analyzed: rdzod la brten nas gal te 'dug na bdag la ga la bde /
translated: how could I be happy if I were to stay in the cage of the nature of attachment to the house of the mind?

original: de bas na 'dir bdag gi 'di nyid ni rigs pa yin no snyam du bstan par bya ba /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir bdag gi 'di nyid ni rigs pa yin no snyam du bstan par bya ba /
translated: Therefore, I should think that this alone is right for me.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te gang gi phyir de ltar de dag nyes pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te gang gi phyir de ltar de dag nyes pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, etc. means that because they are the cause of all faults,

original: khur zhes bya ba ni glang gi rgyab tu bkal ba'i khal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khur zhes bya ba ni glang gi rgyab tu bkal ba'i khal zhes bya'o //
translated: a load is called a burden that is placed on the back of an elephant.

original: khur dang mtshungs pas na khur te @83b dam bcas pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: khur dang mtshungs pas na khur te @83b dam bcas pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: A burden is similar to a load, i.e., it is a promise to carry.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: This is the nature of the afflictions.

original: mdun na 'dug pa'i phyir mngon sum du sgros btags na 'di zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mdun na 'dug pa'i phyir mngon sum du sgros btags na 'di zhes bstan to //
translated: Since it is in front of one, it is designated as direct perception. This is taught as this.

original: mngon sum du zhes bya ba ni bdag gis mthong ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du zhes bya ba ni bdag gis mthong ba bzhin du'o //
translated: Directly means as if I myself were seeing it.

original: nges par bcom pa ni rtsa ba nas med par ro //
analyzed: nges par bcom pa ni rtsa ba nas med par ro //
translated: Defeated means destroyed from the root.

original: chung du la yang ni gnod pa chung du byed pa la'ang ste pha dang mas byas pa'i 'khon gyi rgyu mtshan la'ang ngo //
analyzed: chung du la yang ni gnod pa chung du byed pa la'ang ste pha dang mas byas pa'i 'khon gyi rgyu mtshan la'ang ngo //
translated: Even for a small thing means even for a small offense, such as a reason for resentment created by one's parents.

original: yang na dngos po rgyu chung du la'o //
analyzed: yang na dngos po rgyu chung du la'o //
translated: Or, for a small cause.

original: khros gyur pa ni snying la dgrar byas pa'i zhen pa brtan po gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: khros gyur pa ni snying la dgrar byas pa'i zhen pa brtan po gzhag pa ste /
translated: Having become angry means having firmly established a grudge in the heart,

original: 'khon du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khon du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: which is the meaning of the term resentment.

original: nga rgyal bdo rnams ni nga rgyal 'bar ba'i nga rgyal can rnams so ;
analyzed: nga rgyal bdo rnams ni nga rgyal 'bar ba'i nga rgyal can rnams so ;
translated: Those who are arrogant are those who are proud, those who are puffed up with pride.

original: / de zhes pa ni gnod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: / de zhes pa ni gnod pa byed pa'o //
translated: The term that refers to the offense.

original: ma bcom pa ni de gzhom par ma byas par ro //
analyzed: ma bcom pa ni de gzhom par ma byas par ro //
translated: Not defeated means not having destroyed it.

original: gnyid mi 'ong ni sems las med pa dang bde ba dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnyid mi 'ong ni sems las med pa dang bde ba dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Sleep will not come means one will not be without mental activity and will not be happy.

original: skabs su bab pa dor nas go bgos pa nyid bstan par bya ba /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa dor nas go bgos pa nyid bstan par bya ba /
translated: Having abandoned what is appropriate, one should don the armor, which is taught:

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse begins with the word nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni ngo bo nyid kyis 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni ngo bo nyid kyis 'chi ba ste /
translated: Death is natural, by its very nature.

original: gson pa'i mtha' ni 'chi ba yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gson pa'i mtha' ni 'chi ba yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the end of life is death.

original: gang la de yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang la de yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: One who has that is so-called.

original: de yang yin la de sdug bsngal ba yin pa'o //🔽de dag skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gzir bar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de yang yin la de sdug bsngal ba yin pa'o // de dag skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gzir bar gyur pa'am /
translated: And that is suffering.🔽They are oppressed by the suffering of birth, etc.

original: des sdug bsngal bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des sdug bsngal bar gyur ba'o //
translated: Or, they are made to suffer by that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nyon mongs pa dag yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nyon mongs pa dag yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are afflictions,

original: snying rje ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje ba'o //
translated: pitiable.

original: g-yul ngor dngar tshe ni g-yul sprad par bya ba'i gnas gtso bo ste /
analyzed: g-yul ngor dngar tshe ni g-yul sprad par bya ba'i gnas gtso bo ste /
translated: In the battle, the field of battle is the principal place of engagement.

original: g-yul gyi sa gzhi'i stobs dang ldan pa'i dpung gang na par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: g-yul gyi sa gzhi'i stobs dang ldan pa'i dpung gang na par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: where the powerful army is on the battlefield.

original: nan gyis zhes bya ba ni btsan thabs su ste /
analyzed: nan gyis zhes bya ba ni btsan thabs su ste /
translated: Forcefully means by force.

original: nus pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nus pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: according to one's ability.

original: gzhom phyir ni srog dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhom phyir ni srog dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of destruction, for the sake of depriving of life.

original: drag shul can ni gzi mdangs can te /
analyzed: drag shul can ni gzi mdangs can te /
translated: The powerful one is the one with splendor.

original: brtson pa brtsams pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtson pa brtsams pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “one who has begun to strive” is as follows.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of person is he?

original: mda' mdung gi mtshon gyis phog pa'i sdug bsngal khyad bsad nas te /
analyzed: mda' mdung gi mtshon gyis phog pa'i sdug bsngal khyad bsad nas te /
translated: He is one who has disregarded the pain of being struck by arrows and spears.

original: g-yul ngor mtshon gyis smas pa mi sems par te /
analyzed: g-yul ngor mtshon gyis smas pa mi sems par te /
translated: He is one who does not think about the wounds inflicted by weapons in battle.

original: skyes bu dpa' bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes bu dpa' bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “heroic person” is as follows.

original: phyir phyogs 'byor bar mi byed na ni kha phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyir phyogs 'byor bar mi byed na ni kha phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If he does not turn away from the battlefield, he will not turn his back on it.

original: don ma grub pa ni mngon par 'dod par grub par ma byas par ro //
analyzed: don ma grub pa ni mngon par 'dod par grub par ma byas par ro //
translated: If he does not abandon the struggle, he will not fail to accomplish his aim.

original: brtan pa rnam pas nyon mongs pa @84a * //🔽lhag par gsungs pa /
analyzed: brtan pa rnam pas nyon mongs pa @84a * // lhag par gsungs pa /
translated: The steadfast one is not perturbed by the afflictions.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Blessed One has stated this point in a different way:🔽He states:

original: rtag tu ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: Constantly, at all times.

original: rang bzhin gyis te gnod pa ma byas shing rgyu med pa'i dgra rnams so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis te gnod pa ma byas shing rgyu med pa'i dgra rnams so //
translated: Naturally, without provocation, and for no reason.

original: brtson pa ni 'bad pa ste /
analyzed: brtson pa ni 'bad pa ste /
translated: Strive means exert oneself.

original: brtson par byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtson par byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “one who has begun to strive” is as follows.

original: deng zhes pa ni dus 'dir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: deng zhes pa ni dus 'dir zhes pa ste /
translated: Now means at this time.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi smra lugs so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi smra lugs so //
translated: This is the worldly way of speaking.

original: sgyid lug pa ni bya bar 'os pa rnams la ni nus so snyam pa'i zhan pa'o //
analyzed: sgyid lug pa ni bya bar 'os pa rnams la ni nus so snyam pa'i zhan pa'o //
translated: Discouragement is the weakness of thinking, “I am not able” with regard to what should be done.

original: yi chad ni sems zhum pa'am /
analyzed: yi chad ni sems zhum pa'am /
translated: Discouragement is a mental depression,

original: dang ba med pa'am /
analyzed: dang ba med pa'am /
translated: or a lack of clarity,

original: bsam pa dman pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dman pa'o //
translated: or a low resolve.

original: 'di ni tshig bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni tshig bsdus pa ste /
translated: This is a concise form.

original: yi chad pa mi 'byung ba sgyid lug pa mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yi chad pa mi 'byung ba sgyid lug pa mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “discouragement does not arise” means “there is no discouragement.”

original: smos ci dgos zhes bya ba ni de bas kyang lhag pa zhes bya ba'o //🔽sdug bsngal brgya phrag ni ngal ba brgya phrag gam /
analyzed: smos ci dgos zhes bya ba ni de bas kyang lhag pa zhes bya ba'o // sdug bsngal brgya phrag ni ngal ba brgya phrag gam /
translated: The phrase “what need is there to speak” means “even more so.”🔽Hundreds of sufferings means hundreds of hardships,

original: sdug bsngal brgya phrag gi'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal brgya phrag gi'o //
translated: or hundreds of sufferings.

original: rgyur gyur pa gang gis kyang zhes pa ni rang gi sems kyi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa gang gis kyang zhes pa ni rang gi sems kyi rtog pa ste /
translated: “By any cause whatsoever” means by any conception in one’s own mind.

original: mi rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not reasonable, is what is meant.

original: ji ltar na mi rigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi rigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not reasonable?

original: don med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: don med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “It is meaningless,” and so on.

original: don med ces bya ba ni 'dir 'jig rten pha rol la sogs par dag par 'gyur ba'i dgos pa gzhan cung zad kyang med pa'o //
analyzed: don med ces bya ba ni 'dir 'jig rten pha rol la sogs par dag par 'gyur ba'i dgos pa gzhan cung zad kyang med pa'o //
translated: “Useless” means that there is no other purpose whatsoever, such as purification in a future world.

original: de lta na yang dgra'i mtshon cha yis smas pa'i rma brla dang / snying ga dang / dpung ba dang / lag pa la sogs pa lus la rgyan dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang dgra'i mtshon cha yis smas pa'i rma brla dang / snying ga dang / dpung ba dang / lag pa la sogs pa lus la rgyan dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Even so, the wounds of the body, such as the thighs, chest, arms, and hands, inflicted by the weapons of enemies, are ornaments of the body.

original: rgyan cha bzhin du yid dga' bas 'chang bar byed na /
analyzed: rgyan cha bzhin du yid dga' bas 'chang bar byed na /
translated: Like ornaments, one should bear them with a joyful mind.

original: 'di bdag la ji ltar mi rigs she na /
analyzed: 'di bdag la ji ltar mi rigs she na /
translated: How is this not proper for me?

original: don chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: don chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The great purpose, etc.

original: don chen ni 'gro ba thams cad sangs rgyas nyid du sgrub pa ste sgrub par byed pa de'i don du'o //
analyzed: don chen ni 'gro ba thams cad sangs rgyas nyid du sgrub pa ste sgrub par byed pa de'i don du'o //
translated: The great purpose is the accomplishment of all beings in Buddhahood; it is for that purpose.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa la ci'i phyir zhes spong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa la ci'i phyir zhes spong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Why do you abandon the undertaking of effort?

original: mchog tu dad pa'i rgyu sdug bsngal de 'dra ba ni ci bdag la rigs pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: mchog tu dad pa'i rgyu sdug bsngal de 'dra ba ni ci bdag la rigs pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not proper for me to have such suffering, the cause of supreme faith?

original: gang 'gro ba'i gdung sel sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: gang 'gro ba'i gdung sel sdug bsngal la /
translated: What suffering is there for one who is engaged in the welfare of the world?

original: dga' ba 'ba' zhig 'dir bya rigs //
analyzed: dga' ba 'ba' zhig 'dir bya rigs //
translated: One should only delight in this.

original: zhes brjod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus it will be said.

original: gal te de ltar brtson par byed pa de lta yin na yang rang gi bde ba dang mi 'gal ba nyid du brtson par bya bar rigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar brtson par byed pa de lta yin na yang rang gi bde ba dang mi 'gal ba nyid du brtson par bya bar rigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If one were to strive in this way, it would be proper to strive in a way that does not contradict one's own happiness.

original: 'dir nya pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir nya pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here he says fisherman, and so on.

original: rang gi chung ma dang bu la sogs pa dgang ba dang gso ba la sogs pa bya @84b ba la sems chags pa'i nya pa ni nya'i dgra ste /
analyzed: rang gi chung ma dang bu la sogs pa dgang ba dang gso ba la sogs pa bya @84b ba la sems chags pa'i nya pa ni nya'i dgra ste /
translated: A fisherman is an enemy of fish, because he is attached to the thought of catching and killing his wife, children, and so on.

original: nya 'tshe ba la yid chags pa'o //
analyzed: nya 'tshe ba la yid chags pa'o //
translated: He is attached to the thought of harming fish.🔽In the winter, he does not care about the cold, the snow, the fear of thieves, tigers, and so on.

original: dgun gyi dus kyi mtshan mo kha ba'i tshigs sdug par 'jug par byed pa dang / chom rkun dang / stag la sogs ba'i 'jigs pa la mi ltos pa dang / de bzhin du shan pa la sogs pa dang / de ltar gdol pa yang rtag tu las ma yin pa la dga' ba /
analyzed: dgun gyi dus kyi mtshan mo kha ba'i tshigs sdug par 'jug par byed pa dang / chom rkun dang / stag la sogs ba'i 'jigs pa la mi ltos pa dang / de bzhin du shan pa la sogs pa dang / de ltar gdol pa yang rtag tu las ma yin pa la dga' ba /
translated: Likewise, butchers and so on, and likewise untouchables, always delight in nonvirtue.

original: gzhan gyi nor 'phrog pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa can ni tsher ma can dang thag thug dang gseg ma can bgrod dka' ba'i sa'i cha 'brog gi lam du rlung dang tshad pa dang / thog dang / char bab pa dang / mun pa dang ldan pa'i mtshan mo sdig sprul la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa'i sdug bsngal rtsis med par 'gro ba na srog la the tshom za ba bya dka' ba'i las la 'jug par byed do //🔽de bzhin du gzhan gyi bud med la spyod pa la sogs pa dang / de ltar zhing pa ste rmod par byed pa po zhing gi las kyis nye bar 'tsho ba zhing rmod pa la sogs pa'i byed pa byas pa rnams kyang nyin mtshan du grang ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor 'phrog pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa can ni tsher ma can dang thag thug dang gseg ma can bgrod dka' ba'i sa'i cha 'brog gi lam du rlung dang tshad pa dang / thog dang / char bab pa dang / mun pa dang ldan pa'i mtshan mo sdig sprul la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa'i sdug bsngal rtsis med par 'gro ba na srog la the tshom za ba bya dka' ba'i las la 'jug par byed do // de bzhin du gzhan gyi bud med la spyod pa la sogs pa dang / de ltar zhing pa ste rmod par byed pa po zhing gi las kyis nye bar 'tsho ba zhing rmod pa la sogs pa'i byed pa byas pa rnams kyang nyin mtshan du grang ba dang /
translated: Those who have the intention to steal others’ wealth and so on, who are on a path in the wilderness, on difficult terrain with thorns, thickets, and gravel, who go at night with no regard for the suffering of fear from wind, heat, lightning, rain, and darkness, and from snakes, scorpions, and so on, who are doubtful of their lives, who engage in difficult activities,

original: tsha ba dang / rlung la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba mthong ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: tsha ba dang / rlung la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba mthong ba nyid yin no //
translated: and likewise those who have intercourse with others’ wives and so on, and those who are farmers, who make a living from farming, who engage in the activities of farming and so on, are seen to experience the suffering of cold, heat, wind, and so on, day and night.

original: de bzhin du bdag gi gdong du lta zhing 'tsho ba zhabs 'bring ba la sogs pa dang / de ltar dman pa'i las la mngon par dga' ba de dag kyang grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa bzod na 'gro ba la phan pa dang bde ba'i don dang skyes bu mchog gi don gyi phyir ji ltar na bdag gis mi bzod /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gi gdong du lta zhing 'tsho ba zhabs 'bring ba la sogs pa dang / de ltar dman pa'i las la mngon par dga' ba de dag kyang grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa bzod na 'gro ba la phan pa dang bde ba'i don dang skyes bu mchog gi don gyi phyir ji ltar na bdag gis mi bzod /
translated: Likewise, if those who delight in lowly activities such as looking at my face and serving me can endure the harm of cold, heat, and so on, then why can't I endure it for the sake of the welfare and happiness of beings and for the sake of the goal of the supreme being?

original: bdag gis slar shin tu yang bsten par bya bar rigs pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis slar shin tu yang bsten par bya bar rigs pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is right that I should serve them instead.

original: 'o na gal te sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub pa'i phyir smon lam btab pa de lta yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub pa'i phyir smon lam btab pa de lta yin na /
translated: Well, if you have made aspirations to accomplish the welfare and happiness of all sentient beings,

original: de'i tshe de nyid la nan tan bya ba'i phyir brtson par bya ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de nyid la nan tan bya ba'i phyir brtson par bya ba nyid yin na /
translated: then you should be striving to practice them.

original: ci'i phyir rang nyid kyi sred pa la sogs pa spong pa gtso bo ma yin zhing dgos pa med pa'i don du brtson 'grus rtsom par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rang nyid kyi sred pa la sogs pa spong pa gtso bo ma yin zhing dgos pa med pa'i don du brtson 'grus rtsom par byed ce na /
translated: Why do you exert yourself in the practice of eliminating your own craving and so on, which is not the main thing and is pointless?

original: de'i phyir / phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the text says, “In the ten directions,” and so forth.

original: phyogs bcu'i nam mkha'i tshad kyi 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal thams cad rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir sems bskyed cing tshig tu yang cher bton nas gzhan dag lta zhog / gang gi tshe bdag nyid kyang sred pa la @85a * //🔽sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ma grol ba de'i tshe rang gi nus pa la ma bltas pa kho nar tshig tu rjod par byed pa ni sems rnam par 'khrugs par gyur pa yin no snyam du bsams nas phyir mi log par dam bcas pa las brtan par
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i nam mkha'i tshad kyi 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal thams cad rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir sems bskyed cing tshig tu yang cher bton nas gzhan dag lta zhog / gang gi tshe bdag nyid kyang sred pa la @85a * // sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ma grol ba de'i tshe rang gi nus pa la ma bltas pa kho nar tshig tu rjod par byed pa ni sems rnam par 'khrugs par gyur pa yin no snyam du bsams nas phyir mi log par dam bcas pa las brtan par
translated: Therefore, he says, “I will generate the thought to liberate all the suffering of the world-realms in the ten directions, which are the extent of space, and I will speak aloud about it.”🔽If I am not liberated from the afflictions such as craving, then, without regard for my own ability, I will speak aloud about it.

original: 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: Thinking that my mind is disturbed, I will not turn back from my promise.

original: 'dir dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention here is as follows.

original: bdag gi nyon mongs pa ma spangs par gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa spang ba zhes bya ba ni mi nus te /
analyzed: bdag gi nyon mongs pa ma spangs par gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa spang ba zhes bya ba ni mi nus te /
translated: It is not possible to say, “I will abandon the afflictions of others without abandoning my own afflictions.”

original: de bas na de'i thabs yin pa'i phyir de nyid dang por nges par nyams su blang bar bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de'i thabs yin pa'i phyir de nyid dang por nges par nyams su blang bar bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, since it is the means for that, it is to be practiced first of all.

original: bdag nyid kyang ma dul bar gzhan gdul bar mi nus par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang ma dul bar gzhan gdul bar mi nus par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And it is not the case that one who is not self-disciplined is unable to discipline others.

original: de lta bas na sdug bsngal thams cad khyad du bsad nas /
analyzed: de lta bas na sdug bsngal thams cad khyad du bsad nas /
translated: Therefore, disregarding all suffering,

original: 'dir zhen bya zhing ste 'dir nyon mongs pa gzhom pa'i don du brtson 'grus brten pa la nan tan du bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhen bya zhing ste 'dir nyon mongs pa gzhom pa'i don du brtson 'grus brten pa la nan tan du bya'o //
translated: one should apply oneself to this, i.e., one should strive to apply effort to this, for the purpose of destroying the afflictions.

original: khon du bzung nas ni khon ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: khon du bzung nas ni khon ma brjed pa'o //
translated: Having taken up the burden, i.e., not forgetting the burden.

original: g-yul sprad ni rtsod pas yid byung ba spangs pa rnam pa thams cad du 'thab mo brtsam pa'o //
analyzed: g-yul sprad ni rtsod pas yid byung ba spangs pa rnam pa thams cad du 'thab mo brtsam pa'o //
translated: Having engaged in battle, i.e., having abandoned discouragement through dispute, one should begin the fight in every way.

original: yang na 'o na gal te thog ma nyid du bdag nyid kyi nyon mongs pa spangs par ma gyur na 'di la mi rigs pa ci zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: yang na 'o na gal te thog ma nyid du bdag nyid kyi nyon mongs pa spangs par ma gyur na 'di la mi rigs pa ci zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: Or else, if one does not first abandon one's own afflictions, what is unreasonable about this?

original: gang gis na gus pa chen pos de nyid la brtson par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis na gus pa chen pos de nyid la brtson par bya zhe na /
translated: By what is one to strive in this with great respect?

original: 'dir phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, the verse states, “The ten directions” and so on.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The condensed meaning of this is as follows.

original: thams cad la'ang gzhan pas rang 'dul ba ni rang la rag pa yin la /
analyzed: thams cad la'ang gzhan pas rang 'dul ba ni rang la rag pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, it is up to each individual to discipline themselves, not others.

original: gang la bdag rang la'ang nus pa med pa de la gzhan gyi rgyud la lta ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la bdag rang la'ang nus pa med pa de la gzhan gyi rgyud la lta ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could one who is not even capable of disciplining themselves be able to discipline the mindstreams of others?

original: 'di ni mi srid pa'i phyir bzhad gang byed par zad de /
analyzed: 'di ni mi srid pa'i phyir bzhad gang byed par zad de /
translated: This is impossible, so it is just laughable.

original: rang gi tshod mi shes par dam 'cha' bar 'gyur ba smyon pa'i tshig lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rang gi tshod mi shes par dam 'cha' bar 'gyur ba smyon pa'i tshig lta bu yin no //
translated: It is like the words of a madman who makes a promise without knowing his own limits.

original: de bas na bdag nyid yongs su spyad pa la dang por 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid yongs su spyad pa la dang por 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should first strive to discipline oneself.

original: gzhan thams cad ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: Everything else is the same as before.

original: 'o na gal te nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad du spang bar 'dod pa de lta yin na ni de'i tshe nyon mongs pa spang ba po mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de yang spang bar bya ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na gal te nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad du spang bar 'dod pa de lta yin na ni de'i tshe nyon mongs pa spang ba po mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de yang spang bar bya ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If one wishes to abandon the afflictions in every way, then at that time, the one who abandons the afflictions, whoever they are, will also become something that must be abandoned.

original: de yang bag la nyal gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang bag la nyal gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of a latent state.

original: ji ste de ltar na yang nyon mongs pa spong ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste de ltar na yang nyon mongs pa spong ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If, even so, there would be no relinquishment of the mental afflictions,

original: 'dir ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says: “apart from that.”

original: nyon mongs pa gang zhig nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed pa'i gnyen po dang @85b 'brel pa rnam pa de 'dra ba ni rnam pa de lta bu ste der snang ba tsam yin gyi de nyid ni nyon mongs pa mtshan nyid bzhi ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang zhig nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed pa'i gnyen po dang @85b 'brel pa rnam pa de 'dra ba ni rnam pa de lta bu ste der snang ba tsam yin gyi de nyid ni nyon mongs pa mtshan nyid bzhi ma yin te /
translated: That which is a mental affliction is a form of the antidote that eradicates the mental afflictions. It is similar in that it has that aspect. It is merely the appearance of that aspect. It is not a mental affliction that has the four characteristics.

original: de dag la gzhan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag la gzhan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “other than that” is in reference to those.

original: de dag gis ni nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam pa thams cad du spangs pas 'khor bar mi skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gis ni nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam pa thams cad du spangs pas 'khor bar mi skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Since all mental afflictions are relinquished in every way by those,🔽one would not attain unsurpassed enlightenment because one would not be reborn in cyclic existence.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i thal bar 'gyur ba 'di yang bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i thal bar 'gyur ba 'di yang bsal ba yin no //
translated: This consequence is also eliminated by that.

original: nyon mongs pa gang dag nges par 'chi ba'i rgyur gyur pa de dag ni 'dir nges par gzhom par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang dag nges par 'chi ba'i rgyur gyur pa de dag ni 'dir nges par gzhom par bya ba yin la /
translated: Those afflictions which are the cause of certain death are to be destroyed here and now.

original: gang yang tshogs sog pa'i rgyu skyed pa de dag ji srid du tshogs rdzogs par ma gyur gyi bar du rta shin tu dul ba bzhin du dul bar byas te gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang tshogs sog pa'i rgyu skyed pa de dag ji srid du tshogs rdzogs par ma gyur gyi bar du rta shin tu dul ba bzhin du dul bar byas te gzhag par bya'o //
translated: And those which are the cause of accumulating the requisites are to be subdued like a well-trained horse, as long as the requisites are not completed.

original: phyis ni de dag kyang gzhom par bya ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: phyis ni de dag kyang gzhom par bya ba kho na yin te /
translated: Later, they are to be destroyed.

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni nyon mongs 'joms pa dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni nyon mongs 'joms pa dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is stated in the verse: “The afflictions are to be destroyed, and the requisites are to be accumulated.”

original: yang nyon mongs ma bsregs rtsva ltar chung zhing yang ba nyid du bya zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yang nyon mongs ma bsregs rtsva ltar chung zhing yang ba nyid du bya zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: And it is said: “The afflictions are to be burned, like grass, and reduced to a small and light amount.”

original: de bas na rnam pa thams cad du thams cad spong bar ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa thams cad du thams cad spong bar ni mi 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, it is not maintained that all afflictions are to be abandoned in every way.

original: don 'di ni bya dka' ba brgya phrag du mas thob par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: don 'di ni bya dka' ba brgya phrag du mas thob par bya ba yin te /
translated: This point is to be attained by hundreds of difficult tasks.

original: der yang sdug bsngal brgya phrag mtha' yas pas 'joms pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: der yang sdug bsngal brgya phrag mtha' yas pas 'joms pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: And there, too, will I not be destroyed by the endless hundreds of sufferings?

original: de bas na de'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid bla ste legs par byas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na de'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid bla ste legs par byas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is better to follow that, and so it will be well done.

original: bdag ni bsrogs  zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag ni bsrogs  zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: I will not burn, etc.

original: shin tu chung ba brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: shin tu chung ba brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is said to be very small.🔽Take hold of this vow of mine as being certain.

original: bdag gi dam bca' 'di nges pa nyid yin par zung shig / rgyu ma zhes bya ba rnams kyang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'og tu lhug la dum bur brul bu brul bu byas pa'am /🔽sha dang khrag zhig cing zags par byas kyang nyon mongs pa'i dgra bo rnams la mgo bo 'dud par byas nas rjes su bsgrub par mi bya ste de'i bka' bzhin byed par mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: bdag gi dam bca' 'di nges pa nyid yin par zung shig / rgyu ma zhes bya ba rnams kyang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'og tu lhug la dum bur brul bu brul bu byas pa'am / sha dang khrag zhig cing zags par byas kyang nyon mongs pa'i dgra bo rnams la mgo bo 'dud par byas nas rjes su bsgrub par mi bya ste de'i bka' bzhin byed par mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: Even if my intestines, etc., are loosened and torn to pieces as desired,

original: // / bam po drug pa /
analyzed: // / bam po drug pa /
translated: and my flesh and blood are destroyed and ooze out, I will not bow my head to the enemies, the afflictions, and will not follow them, i.e., will not do as they say.

original: rnam pa kun tu zhes bya ba ni nam du yang ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa kun tu zhes bya ba ni nam du yang ngo //
translated: In every way means at any time.

original: khyod kyis rang gi gnas las bton yang gal te stobs dang ldan pa'i gnas la brten nas dgra gzhan bzhin du dgra tshar gcod du 'ong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: khyod kyis rang gi gnas las bton yang gal te stobs dang ldan pa'i gnas la brten nas dgra gzhan bzhin du dgra tshar gcod du 'ong ba ma yin nam /
translated: Even if you expel it from its place, if it relies on a powerful place, it will return like another enemy and destroy the enemy, won’t it?

original: de'i tshe 'dir ci ltar slar bcos par bya zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dir ci ltar slar bcos par bya zhes dogs pa la /
translated: At that time, how will it be corrected here?

original: tha mal dgra bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa @86a * //
analyzed: tha mal dgra bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa @86a * //
translated: With respect to that doubt, he said, “Ordinary enemies, etc.”

original: gsungs te / tha mal pa'i dgra bo gzhan dag ni yul nas phyung yang gnas gang zhig nas nus pa brtas shing stobs rnyed nas dgra tshar phyin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gsungs te / tha mal pa'i dgra bo gzhan dag ni yul nas phyung yang gnas gang zhig nas nus pa brtas shing stobs rnyed nas dgra tshar phyin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Other ordinary enemies, even if expelled from the country, will return from some place where they have gained power and strength in order to destroy the enemy.

original: phyir la ldog pa'i gnas yul gzhan de ni srid kyis nyon mongs pa'i dgra la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyir la ldog pa'i gnas yul gzhan de ni srid kyis nyon mongs pa'i dgra la ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case with the enemy of afflictions.

original: dgra gzhan ltar de'i spyod pa mi snang ngo //
analyzed: dgra gzhan ltar de'i spyod pa mi snang ngo //
translated: The conduct of that enemy does not appear.

original: yang de ltar 'dod kyang ga la 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang de ltar 'dod kyang ga la 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Again, if one thinks, “Even if I want it that way, how will it happen?”

original: nyon mongs nyon mongs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs nyon mongs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He said, “The afflictions, etc.”

original: bdag gi sems las yul phyung na /
analyzed: bdag gi sems las yul phyung na /
translated: If the object is expelled from one’s mind,

original: nyon mongs pa'i dgra 'di gang du song nas gnas par byed gang du gnas par byas nas bdag la gnod pa bya ba'i phyir 'bad rtsol byed de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dgra 'di gang du song nas gnas par byed gang du gnas par byas nas bdag la gnod pa bya ba'i phyir 'bad rtsol byed de /
translated: Where does this enemy, the afflictions, go to stay? Where does it stay to exert itself in order to harm me?

original: 'di'i gnas ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di'i gnas ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: I do not see its abode.

original: rtsa ba nas med par gyur pa la slar ldang bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: rtsa ba nas med par gyur pa la slar ldang bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that it is not reasonable for it to arise again, since it has become nonexistent from the root.

original: blo'i rgyu ba mi zin pa'i phyir bdag la spro ba med pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi nyon mongs pa 'di ni rtsa ba med pa'i phyir don dam pa de kho na nyid mthong ba tsam gyis spang bar bya ba yin pas na nyon mongs yin no //
analyzed: blo'i rgyu ba mi zin pa'i phyir bdag la spro ba med pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi nyon mongs pa 'di ni rtsa ba med pa'i phyir don dam pa de kho na nyid mthong ba tsam gyis spang bar bya ba yin pas na nyon mongs yin no //
translated: Since the movement of the mind is not apprehended, I have no enthusiasm at all. But this affliction is to be abandoned merely by seeing the ultimate reality, because it is without a root.

original: de nyid rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir nyon mongs rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir nyon mongs rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to establish that very point, he says, “The afflictions are not in the object, nor are they in the self, etc.”

original: yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa'i yul mthong yang dbang po bsdams pa kha cig ni nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i phyir dang / rnam par brtags na rdul phra rab kyang de la ma mthong ba'i phyir yul na mi gnas so //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa'i yul mthong yang dbang po bsdams pa kha cig ni nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i phyir dang / rnam par brtags na rdul phra rab kyang de la ma mthong ba'i phyir yul na mi gnas so //
translated: Even when one sees an object such as a beautiful form, it does not reside in the object, because the afflictions do not arise for some who restrain their senses, and because when one analyzes, one does not see even the subtle particles of the object.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i tshogs la yang snga ma bzhin du mi gnas te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i tshogs la yang snga ma bzhin du mi gnas te /
translated: It also does not reside in the collection of sense faculties such as the eyes, as before.

original: chos la sems pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na dbang po'i dngos po yod kyang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽yul dang dbang po dag gi bar na ste /
analyzed: chos la sems pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na dbang po'i dngos po yod kyang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro // yul dang dbang po dag gi bar na ste /
translated: Even though the nature of the sense faculties exists in the state of reflection on the Dharma, it is not perceived.

original: dbus na gnas pa'ang min ste /
analyzed: dbus na gnas pa'ang min ste /
translated: It also does not reside in the middle between the object and the sense faculties.

original: snang bu rung ba mi dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang bu rung ba mi dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not perceived as a suitable location.

original: de dag las gnas gzhan 'ga' zhig tu yang gnas pa'i nges pa med do //
analyzed: de dag las gnas gzhan 'ga' zhig tu yang gnas pa'i nges pa med do //
translated: It is not ascertained as residing in any other location apart from those.

original: de bas na rtsa ba med pa'i phyir de kho na nyid du stong pa ste glo bur ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rtsa ba med pa'i phyir de kho na nyid du stong pa ste glo bur ba nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is empty of reality, rootless, and adventitious.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtogs pa tsam las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtogs pa tsam las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise from mere false imagination.

original: de lta bur gyur na yang 'gro ba kun gnod byed de 'khrug par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur na yang 'gro ba kun gnod byed de 'khrug par byed do //
translated: And even though they are like that, they harm all beings, they disturb them.

original: de ltar yin na ci ltar bya bar rigs she na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na ci ltar bya bar rigs she na /
translated: If that is so, what should be done?

original: gsungs pa 'di ni sgyu 'dra ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa 'di ni sgyu 'dra ste /
translated: It is said: This is like an illusion.

original: dper na sgyu ma ni de'i rnam pas stong yang sngags dang sman gyi mthu las de rkyen 'di tsam @86b gyis de kho na nyid du med kyang glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa 'di rnams kyang phyin ci log
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma ni de'i rnam pas stong yang sngags dang sman gyi mthu las de rkyen 'di tsam @86b gyis de kho na nyid du med kyang glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa 'di rnams kyang phyin ci log
translated: For example, an illusion is empty of that form, but by the power of spells and medicine, it appears in the form of an elephant, etc., although it does not exist in reality.

original: gi rgyu mtshan dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: gi rgyu mtshan dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung ba ste /
translated: In the same way, these afflictions arise from the signs of error and incorrect mental activity.

original: rkyen 'di dag tsam gyis de kho na nyid du med pa nyid du snang ngo //
analyzed: rkyen 'di dag tsam gyis de kho na nyid du med pa nyid du snang ngo //
translated: By these conditions alone, they appear as if they existed in reality.

original: de'i phyir snying la 'jigs pa spangs te nyon mongs pa rnams las so //
analyzed: de'i phyir snying la 'jigs pa spangs te nyon mongs pa rnams las so //
translated: Therefore, abandon fear in your heart and be free from the afflictions.

original: don dam par rnam par dpyad na brdzun pa 'di ci zhig tu rung ste /
analyzed: don dam par rnam par dpyad na brdzun pa 'di ci zhig tu rung ste /
