translated: For, ultimately, when analyzed, how could this falsity be tenable?

original: de'i phyir brtson pa bsten cig ste spro bar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brtson pa bsten cig ste spro bar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, apply yourself, be enthusiastic!

original: shes phyir ni de kho na nyid rab tu rnam par 'byed pas rtogs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: shes phyir ni de kho na nyid rab tu rnam par 'byed pas rtogs pa'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of knowledge, for the sake of realization through the thorough differentiation of reality.

original: don med nyid du dgos pa med pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: don med nyid du dgos pa med pa nyid du'o //
translated: For the sake of meaninglessness, for the sake of meaninglessness.

original: dmyal ba rnams su ni bsdus 'joms la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba rnams su ni bsdus 'joms la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: In the hells, in Saṃghāta and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pas bdag la gnod pa ni gzir ba ste ci ste bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pas bdag la gnod pa ni gzir ba ste ci ste bya ba'o //
translated: By the power of the afflictions, one is oppressed, tormented, by oneself.

original: da ni sngar bstan pa'i don ma lus pa nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sngar bstan pa'i don ma lus pa nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to summarize the meaning taught above,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: thus, etc. is stated.

original: de ltar ni bstan ma thag pa'i le'u ma lus pas bstan pa'i don nam /
analyzed: de ltar ni bstan ma thag pa'i le'u ma lus pas bstan pa'i don nam /
translated: Thus, by the entire chapter just taught, the meaning taught,

original: bstan ma thag pa'i sgyu ma'i rang bzhin la rnam par bsams te brten par byas nas 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa'i sgyu ma'i rang bzhin la rnam par bsams te brten par byas nas 'bad par bya'o //
translated: or the illusory nature just taught, having reflected, having relied, one should strive.

original: ci'i don du zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i don du zhe na /
translated: For what purpose?

original: ji ltar bshad pa'i bslab pa bsgrub pa'i rgyur te ji skad gsungs pa'i bslab pa ni mdo de dang de dag las byang chub sems dpa'i bya bar 'os pa gang zhig bstan pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar bshad pa'i bslab pa bsgrub pa'i rgyur te ji skad gsungs pa'i bslab pa ni mdo de dang de dag las byang chub sems dpa'i bya bar 'os pa gang zhig bstan pa'am /
translated: The reason for practicing the training as it is explained is that the training as it is taught is whatever is suitable for a bodhisattva to do that is taught in this or that sutra.

original: bstan bcos 'di nyid las mdor bsdus nas de dang der nye bar bstan pa de dag bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di nyid las mdor bsdus nas de dang der nye bar bstan pa de dag bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: Or, it is that which is taught in this treatise, which is presented in brief in this or that place.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde rnams su byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde rnams su byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi gsungs pa ni /
translated: The Bhagavat taught the bases of bodhisattva training in the sutras.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it says:

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las /
translated: Noble Cloud of Jewels:

original: rigs kyi bu ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Son of noble family, how are bodhisattvas bound by the vow of bodhisattva training?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar dpyod de /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar dpyod de /
translated: Here, bodhisattvas analyze as follows:

original: so so thar pa'i sdom pa tsam gyis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus kyis de bzhin gshegs pas gang 'di mdo sde de dang de dag las byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang
analyzed: so so thar pa'i sdom pa tsam gyis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus kyis de bzhin gshegs pas gang 'di mdo sde de dang de dag las byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang
translated: I cannot become fully enlightened in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening just through the pratimokṣa vows.

original: / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gnas bcas pa de dag la bdag gis bslab par bya'o zhes @87a * //
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gnas bcas pa de dag la bdag gis bslab par bya'o zhes @87a * //
translated: I will train in those bodhisattva practices and those bases of bodhisattva training that the Tathāgata has set forth in this and that sūtra.”

original: rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: Thus it is stated extensively.

original: de bas na bdag lta bu blo zhan pas rgya cher gsungs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa shes par dka' na /
analyzed: de bas na bdag lta bu blo zhan pas rgya cher gsungs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa shes par dka' na /
translated: Therefore, if it is difficult for someone like me, who is of little intelligence, to know the bodhisattva vows because they are taught extensively,

original: des na ji ltar bya ba'i rigs //
analyzed: des na ji ltar bya ba'i rigs //
translated: then what should I do?

original: gang gis ltung bar mi 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: gang gis ltung bar mi 'gyur ba'i //
translated: How can I avoid downfalls?

original: gnad kyi gnas rnams 'dis rigs bya //
analyzed: gnad kyi gnas rnams 'dis rigs bya //
translated: I will understand the essential points.

original: gnad kyi gnas de gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnad kyi gnas de gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the essential points? They are as follows:

original: bdag gi lus dang longs spyod dang // dge ba dus gsum skyes pa rnams //
analyzed: bdag gi lus dang longs spyod dang // dge ba dus gsum skyes pa rnams //
translated: My body, enjoyments, and virtues produced in the three times,

original: sems can kun la btang ba dang // de bsrung dag pa spel ba'o //
analyzed: sems can kun la btang ba dang // de bsrung dag pa spel ba'o //
translated: Giving to all sentient beings,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: protecting, purifying, and increasing.

original: gang la byang chub sems dpa' rnams goms pa glod can yang ltung bar rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa mdor bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la byang chub sems dpa' rnams goms pa glod can yang ltung bar rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa mdor bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is the brief summary of the bodhisattva vow.

original: ji skad du byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa'i mdo las gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji skad du byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa'i mdo las gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: The Bodhisattva-pratimoksha-sutra says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad kyi phyir sdug bsngal zad par 'gyur ba'i lam gang yongs su bzung ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad kyi phyir sdug bsngal zad par 'gyur ba'i lam gang yongs su bzung ba ste /
translated: The bodhisattva takes up the path that will end suffering for all sentient beings.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpas lam de yongs su bzung nas gnas pa na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpas lam de yongs su bzung nas gnas pa na /
translated: If the bodhisattva, having taken up that path, should remain in it,

original: bskal pa bye ba 'das nas tha na 'dug pa tsam gyi bde ba 'dod pa'i sems gcig bskyed na yang de la byang chub sems dpas sems 'di ltar bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba 'das nas tha na 'dug pa tsam gyi bde ba 'dod pa'i sems gcig bskyed na yang de la byang chub sems dpas sems 'di ltar bskyed par bya ste /
translated: then even if he were to generate a single thought of desire for the happiness of mere sitting, after a hundred million eons have passed,🔽the bodhisattva should generate the following thought:

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi nyes pa dang du blangs nas 'dug pa gang yin pa de yang ma nges pa yin no zhes so //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi nyes pa dang du blangs nas 'dug pa gang yin pa de yang ma nges pa yin no zhes so //
translated: And whatever I do in taking on the faults of all sentient beings is also uncertain.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: sman pa'i dag  ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: sman pa'i dag  ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: he says, “Like a doctor,” and so on.

original: dper na sman pa'i dag ltar mi byed na gang la sman bsgrub par bya ba'i sman gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i nod pa skyon med cing nad med par 'gyur ba ga la yod /
analyzed: dper na sman pa'i dag ltar mi byed na gang la sman bsgrub par bya ba'i sman gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i nod pa skyon med cing nad med par 'gyur ba ga la yod /
translated: For example, if one does not act like a doctor, how can one who is to be cured by medicine be cured by medicine, be free from faults, and be free from disease?

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i sman pa chen pos lung phog pa'i bslab pa bsgrub par ma byas par skyon med par 'gyur ba las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa chen po las rnam par grol bar 'gyur🔽ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i sman pa chen pos lung phog pa'i bslab pa bsgrub par ma byas par skyon med par 'gyur ba las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa chen po las rnam par grol bar 'gyur🔽ba lta ga la yod /
translated: In the same way, if one does not practice the precepts that are the doctor’s prescription of the great omniscient doctor, how can one be free from faults, and be free from the great fear of suffering such as birth that is produced by karma and afflictions?

original: de ltar sdom pa yang dag par bzung ba la ltung ba'i mtshan nyid gang dang ldan pa'i dngos po bdag nyid kyis brtags shing spong ba dang / ltung ba'i gzugs brnyan dang / ltung ba ma yin pa'i gzugs brnyan la rmongs par mi 'gyur ba'i ltung ba spyi'i @87b mtshan nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sdom pa yang dag par bzung ba la ltung ba'i mtshan nyid gang dang ldan pa'i dngos po bdag nyid kyis brtags shing spong ba dang / ltung ba'i gzugs brnyan dang / ltung ba ma yin pa'i gzugs brnyan la rmongs par mi 'gyur ba'i ltung ba spyi'i @87b mtshan nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, in the case of one who has taken up the vow correctly, the general characteristics of the downfalls should be stated, so that one can recognize and avoid those things that constitute downfalls, and so that one will not be confused about what are mere imitations of downfalls and what are not downfalls at all.

original: byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad kyi da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba thams cad zhi bar bya ba dang / da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba thams cad bskyed pa'i phyir g-yo med par lus dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad kyi da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba thams cad zhi bar bya ba dang / da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba thams cad bskyed pa'i phyir g-yo med par lus dang /
translated: The bodhisattva should be free of deceit in order to pacify all the present and future suffering and mental pain of all sentient beings, and in order to generate all their present and future happiness and mental pleasure.

original: ngag dang ; yid brtson pas nan tan mi byed pa dang / de'i rkyen tshogs pa mi tshol ba dang / de'i bar du gcod pa'i 'chos pa po la mi 'bad pa dang / sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba chung ngus sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba chen po'i 'chos par 'gyur ba mi skyed pa dang /
analyzed: ngag dang ; yid brtson pas nan tan mi byed pa dang / de'i rkyen tshogs pa mi tshol ba dang / de'i bar du gcod pa'i 'chos pa po la mi 'bad pa dang / sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba chung ngus sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba chen po'i 'chos par 'gyur ba mi skyed pa dang /
translated: It is not to be diligent in speech and mind, not to seek the conditions for that, not to strive to correct the obstacles to that, and not to generate great suffering and mental dissatisfaction from small suffering and mental dissatisfaction.

original: don chen po bsgrub pa'i phyir don chung ngu nyams par mi byed pa dang / skad cig gcig tsam yang yal bar 'dor na ltung ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: don chen po bsgrub pa'i phyir don chung ngu nyams par mi byed pa dang / skad cig gcig tsam yang yal bar 'dor na ltung ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: It is not to lose a small goal for the sake of accomplishing a great goal, and to be at fault if one abandons it even for a moment.

original: mdor na rang gi nus pa ma yin pa'i bya ba'i yul rnams la ltung ba med de /
analyzed: mdor na rang gi nus pa ma yin pa'i bya ba'i yul rnams la ltung ba med de /
translated: In brief, there is no fault in not doing what is not one's responsibility.

original: de la 'bras bu med pas bslab pa bcas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu med pas bslab pa bcas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no result from that, there is no transgression of the precepts.

original: gzhan ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin pas bzung ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin pas bzung ba nyid do //
translated: Others are naturally reprehensible, so they are to be avoided.

original: rang gi nus pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa gang la brtson pa ni shugs kyis ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi nus pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa gang la brtson pa ni shugs kyis ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if one strives at something that is not within one's range of ability, one will fall by the wayside.

original: de bsam mi dgos par spyir sdig pa bshags pa'i nang du 'dus pas de las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bsam mi dgos par spyir sdig pa bshags pa'i nang du 'dus pas de las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that is not necessary, it is included in the general confession of evil deeds, and so one is freed from that.

original: de dag ni mdor na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i lus yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni mdor na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i lus yin te /
translated: In brief, these are the body of the bodhisattva's training.

original: rgyas par bshad na bskal pa dpag tu med pa'i mthas bstan dgos pas so //
analyzed: rgyas par bshad na bskal pa dpag tu med pa'i mthas bstan dgos pas so //
translated: If they were explained in detail, they would have to be taught until the end of immeasurable eons.

original: yang na mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba gnyis te /🔽ci nus kyis rigs pa dang mi rigs pa brtags nas rtsom pa'am /
analyzed: yang na mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba gnyis te / ci nus kyis rigs pa dang mi rigs pa brtags nas rtsom pa'am /
translated: Or, in brief, there are two downfalls for a bodhisattva:

original: mi ldog pa'am /
analyzed: mi ldog pa'am /
translated: To undertake something after examining whether it is right or wrong, or not to undertake it,

original: btang snyoms su 'jog pa ni ltung ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms su 'jog pa ni ltung ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: or to remain indifferent, is to have a downfall.

original: brtags te ji ltar 'os pa las 'da' bar byed la /
analyzed: brtags te ji ltar 'os pa las 'da' bar byed la /
translated: To transgress what is proper after examining it,

original: tha na gdol pa'i bran gyis dpyas na'ang ltung ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: tha na gdol pa'i bran gyis dpyas na'ang ltung ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: even if one is criticized by a low-caste servant, is to have a downfall.

original: gang zhig de dag goms par bya ba'i don du bye brag tu rtogs par 'dod pa des re zhig bslab pa kun las btus pa las spyod pa'i sgo tsam bslab pa'i don du mngon par brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig de dag goms par bya ba'i don du bye brag tu rtogs par 'dod pa des re zhig bslab pa kun las btus pa las spyod pa'i sgo tsam bslab pa'i don du mngon par brtson par bya'o //
translated: Whoever wishes to understand this in detail for the purpose of cultivating it should strive to understand the mere door of conduct in the Compendium of Trainings for the purpose of training.

original: bslab pa la rtsom pa tsam yang 'bras bu che ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bslab pa la rtsom pa tsam yang 'bras bu che ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because even just beginning to train has great fruit.

original: ji skad du rab tu zhi ba rnam par nges pa'i cho 'phrul las bsngags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du rab tu zhi ba rnam par nges pa'i cho 'phrul las bsngags pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is praised in the Sūtra of the Play of Mañjuśrī:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa mdor bsdus nas bstan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa mdor bsdus nas bstan pa /
translated: The Compendium of Trainings is taught in brief

original: @88a * // brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: @88a * // brjod pa yin no //
translated: as the essence of all the scriptures.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i dka' 'grel /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i dka' 'grel /
translated: The Commentary on the Difficult Points of the Bodhisattva’s “Lamp for the Path to Awakening”🔽was composed by Prajñākaramati.

original: shes rab 'byung gnas blo gros kyis byas pa las le'u bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab 'byung gnas blo gros kyis byas pa las le'u bzhi pa'o /
translated: The fourth chapter.

original: // / de ltar lus la sogs pa btang ba dang bsrung ba bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar lus la sogs pa btang ba dang bsrung ba bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the giving and protection of the body and so on,

original: yang rgyas par bsrung ba dang sbyang ba dang dag par bya ba rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir rtsom par byed de /
analyzed: yang rgyas par bsrung ba dang sbyang ba dang dag par bya ba rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir rtsom par byed de /
translated: Moreover, in order to extensively teach protection, purification, and enhancement, he composes this treatise.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas lus btang ba yang bsrung ba dang sbyang ba dang spel ba dag bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas lus btang ba yang bsrung ba dang sbyang ba dang spel ba dag bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has generated the mind of enlightenment should protect, purify, and increase the giving of his body.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: sems can rnams kyi longs spyod phyir //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi longs spyod phyir //
translated: For the enjoyment of sentient beings,

original: lus la sogs pa sbyin par bya /🔽ma bsrungs longs spyod dag las 'ong //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa sbyin par bya / ma bsrungs longs spyod dag las 'ong //
translated: give your body and so on.

original: gang mi spyod la ci zhig sbyin //
analyzed: gang mi spyod la ci zhig sbyin //
translated: If you do not protect it, how can you give it?

original: de bas sems can longs spyod phyir //
analyzed: de bas sems can longs spyod phyir //
translated: Therefore, for the enjoyment of sentient beings,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi gtong zhing //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi gtong zhing //
translated: do not abandon the spiritual friend,

original: mdo sde dag la rtag lta bas //
analyzed: mdo sde dag la rtag lta bas //
translated: always look at the sutras,

original: lus la sogs pa bsrung bar bya //🔽zhes bstan to //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa bsrung bar bya // zhes bstan to //
translated: and protect your body and so on.

original: lus la sogs pa yongs su bskyang ba la sogs pa de yang bslab pa bsrungs pa las 'gyur ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa yongs su bskyang ba la sogs pa de yang bslab pa bsrungs pa las 'gyur ba nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, that protection of the body and so on is due to protecting the trainings,

original: gzhan du na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na mi 'gyur te /
translated: but not otherwise.

original: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa log par ltung bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa log par ltung bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they go to the lower realms, such as the hells.

original: de bas na 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, this is stated:

original: bslab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bslab pa ni blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bslab pa ni blang bar bya ste /
translated: “training” and so on. One should take up the training.

original: sdom pa bzung bas gnang ba rnams la bya ba dang / bkag pa rnams la mi byed par bslab pa'o //🔽de bsrung bar bya ste /
analyzed: sdom pa bzung bas gnang ba rnams la bya ba dang / bkag pa rnams la mi byed par bslab pa'o // de bsrung bar bya ste /
translated: By taking up the vow, one should train in what is permitted and not train in what is prohibited.🔽One should guard that,

original: yongs su bskyang bar ro //
analyzed: yongs su bskyang bar ro //
translated: that is, one should protect it.

original: 'dod pas ni 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpas te /
analyzed: 'dod pas ni 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpas te /
translated: “One who desires” is a bodhisattva who desires.

original: bdag gi sems bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi sems bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: One should guard one’s mind.

original: rab tu bsgrims nas ni 'chad par 'gyur ba dag gis so //
analyzed: rab tu bsgrims nas ni 'chad par 'gyur ba dag gis so //
translated: “With great effort” is with the means that will be explained.

original: ci ste bslab pa bsrung ba'i skabs su ci'i phyir sems bsrung bar bya ba zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste bslab pa bsrung ba'i skabs su ci'i phyir sems bsrung bar bya ba zhe na /
translated: But why should one guard the mind in the context of guarding the training?

original: bslab pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bslab pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says, “training” and so on.

original: gzhan du na bslab pa bsrung ba nyid du mi nus so //
analyzed: gzhan du na bslab pa bsrung ba nyid du mi nus so //
translated: Otherwise, one would not be able to guard the training.

original: g-yo zhing dbang du ma gyur pa'i sems ma bsrungs na sems g-yo ba'i bslab pa la bstan pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo zhing dbang du ma gyur pa'i sems ma bsrungs na sems g-yo ba'i bslab pa la bstan pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not reasonable to teach training in a wandering, uncontrolled mind.

original: 'di las kyang sems kho na bsrung bar bya'o zhes //
analyzed: 'di las kyang sems kho na bsrung bar bya'o zhes //
translated: And here, too, it is said that one should guard the mind alone:

original: glang chen ma dul zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: glang chen ma dul zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “An uncontrolled elephant, etc.”

original: byang bar ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: byang bar ma byas pa'o //
translated: means one that is not trained.

original: myos pa ni glang po che mchog ste /
analyzed: myos pa ni glang po che mchog ste /
translated: A “mad” elephant is the best.

original: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol tu mnar med pa la sogs pa gang byed pa'i gnod pa de mi @88b byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol tu mnar med pa la sogs pa gang byed pa'i gnod pa de mi @88b byed do //
translated: It does not do the harm that it might do in this world and the next, in Avīci, etc.

original: rang 'dod pa la spyod cing gnas pa'i sems nyid ni glang po che myos pa dang 'dra ba'ang yin te /
analyzed: rang 'dod pa la spyod cing gnas pa'i sems nyid ni glang po che myos pa dang 'dra ba'ang yin te /
translated: The mind itself, which acts and abides as it wishes, is like a mad elephant,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka'i lcags kyus ji zhig ltar dbang du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka'i lcags kyus ji zhig ltar dbang du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is somehow controlled by the hook of the Tathāgata’s teaching.

original: de dbang du byas pa'i yon tan ni /
analyzed: de dbang du byas pa'i yon tan ni /
translated: The good quality of its being controlled is stated:

original: btags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gal te ji zhig ltar bcings par gyur na'o //
analyzed: btags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gal te ji zhig ltar bcings par gyur na'o //
translated: “If it is somehow bound, etc.”

original: dran par ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: dran par ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Mindfulness is as described in the following verse:

original: de nyid ni thag pa dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni thag pa dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: It is like a rope,

original: 'ching ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ching ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the means of binding.

original: kun nas ni rnam pa thams cad du ste /
analyzed: kun nas ni rnam pa thams cad du ste /
translated: It is all-around,

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa 'gegs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa 'gegs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it prevents one from engaging in non-virtuous activities.🔽At that time, one becomes fearless,

original: de'i tshe 'jigs pa med 'gyur te nub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'jigs pa med 'gyur te nub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: because one is free from fear.

original: thams cad ni ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma lus pa'o //
translated: All means without exception.

original: dge ba thams cad ni mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dge ba thams cad ni mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: All virtues are characterized by the attainment of high status and the definite goodness of liberation.

original: 'ongs pa ni thob pa ste /
analyzed: 'ongs pa ni thob pa ste /
translated: Attained means obtained.

original: dper na char bab pa na 'bras s'a lu skyes so zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na char bab pa na 'bras s'a lu skyes so zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when it rains, rice grows.

original: gcan gzan khro bo dang sbrul la sogs pa nye bar 'tshe bar byed pa mang po yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gcan gzan khro bo dang sbrul la sogs pa nye bar 'tshe bar byed pa mang po yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Aren't there many dangerous wild animals such as tigers and snakes?

original: de dag las sems dbang du byas pas ji ltar 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de dag las sems dbang du byas pas ji ltar 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can fear arise from them when the mind is controlled?

original: stag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
analyzed: stag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
translated: The verse beginning with “tigers” is easy to understand.

original: yang 'di ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Again, why is this?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says “because of this,” and so on.

original: las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis 'di dag thams cad mi 'dod pa ster bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis 'di dag thams cad mi 'dod pa ster bar byed pa yin no //
translated: By the power of the projection of karma, all of these give rise to what is unwanted.

original: las kyang sems nyid yin te /
analyzed: las kyang sems nyid yin te /
translated: And karma is the mind itself,

original: sems pa las yin te zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa las yin te zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that “it is from intention.”

original: ngag dang lus kyi las kyang sems nyid kyis kun nas slong bar byed pa yin pas de med par de dag mi 'byung ste bsams pa'i las zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag dang lus kyi las kyang sems nyid kyis kun nas slong bar byed pa yin pas de med par de dag mi 'byung ste bsams pa'i las zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because verbal and physical karma are also motivated by the mind itself, they do not occur without it, because they are called “intentional actions.”

original: de bas na 'di dag thams cad ni las kyi sprul pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag thams cad ni las kyi sprul pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, all of these are emanations of karma,

original: de yang sems las gzhan na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang sems las gzhan na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and that is not other than the mind.

original: de ni / las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //
analyzed: de ni / las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //
translated: The world arises from karma.

original: de ni sems pa dang des byas ;
analyzed: de ni sems pa dang des byas ;
translated: It is intention and what is produced by it.

original: / sems pa yid kyi las yin te //
analyzed: / sems pa yid kyi las yin te //
translated: Intention is mental action.

original: des skyed lus dang ngag gi las //
analyzed: des skyed lus dang ngag gi las //
translated: What it produces is physical and verbal action.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: This is taught.

original: gnod pa byed pa'i sems med pa la ni su yang gnod pa byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa'i sems med pa la ni su yang gnod pa byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: No one will harm him who has no harmful thoughts.

original: gang gi phyir /🔽'jig rten na ni sdig pa'i sems //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / 'jig rten na ni sdig pa'i sems //
translated: Why is this?🔽In the world,

original: med la sdang dang 'jigs pa med //🔽gang @89a * //
analyzed: med la sdang dang 'jigs pa med // gang @89a * //
translated: there is no hatred or fear of one who has no harmful thoughts.

original: gi sems ni dbang byas pa //
analyzed: gi sems ni dbang byas pa //
translated: He whose mind is controlled

original: de yi bde ba nyams pa med //
analyzed: de yi bde ba nyams pa med //
translated: never loses happiness.

original: de'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sems 'dul ba ni legs pa ste //🔽sems dul ba ni bde ba 'thob //
analyzed: sems 'dul ba ni legs pa ste // sems dul ba ni bde ba 'thob //
translated: It is good to control the mind;

original: ces gsungs so //🔽yang dag gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: ces gsungs so // yang dag gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: one who controls the mind obtains happiness.

original: dngos po'i de kho na nyid gsungs pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na nyid gsungs pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Bhagavān is the one who speaks correctly, because he has the nature of speaking the truth about things as they are.

original: des de kho na nyid 'di bstan pa ni thams cad sems las byung ba yin no zhes rab tu gsal bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: des de kho na nyid 'di bstan pa ni thams cad sems las byung ba yin no zhes rab tu gsal bar byas pa'o //
translated: He has taught this reality, making it very clear that everything arises from the mind.

original: de bas na thams cad du sems nyid gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad du sems nyid gtso bo yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mind itself is primary in all cases.

original: de ltar de dag ni gzhan ma yin no zhes rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni gzhan ma yin no zhes rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, in order to establish that they are not different,

original: sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽dmyal ba'i srung ma rnams kyis mdung dang / ral gri dang / gtun shing la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / dmyal ba'i srung ma rnams kyis mdung dang / ral gri dang / gtun shing la sogs pa'am /
translated: “Sentient beings” and so on.🔽Who created the hell guardians, spears, swords, pestles, and so on, or the forest of razor leaves?

original: lo ma ral gri lta bu'i nags byung ba dag su yis byas te de la dbang phyug la sogs pa byed pa po 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: lo ma ral gri lta bu'i nags byung ba dag su yis byas te de la dbang phyug la sogs pa byed pa po 'ga' yang med de /
translated: There is no creator such as Īśvara at all.

original: de byed pa po gzhan du bkag pa'i phyir dang / 'dir yang 'gegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de byed pa po gzhan du bkag pa'i phyir dang / 'dir yang 'gegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has been refuted that he is the creator of anything else, and because it will be refuted here.

original: lcags bsregs pa'i rang bzhin gyis gzhi su yis byas /
analyzed: lcags bsregs pa'i rang bzhin gyis gzhi su yis byas /
translated: Who created the ground of burning iron?

original: bud med de dag gi rgyu'i tshogs pa gzhan gyi bud med la spyod pa rnams kyis shal ma li'i shing gi 'og dang steng du snang ba dang / shal ma li gang yin pa de yang ga las skyes te de'i phyir 'dir sems las gzhan pa'i rgyu yod par brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bud med de dag gi rgyu'i tshogs pa gzhan gyi bud med la spyod pa rnams kyis shal ma li'i shing gi 'og dang steng du snang ba dang / shal ma li gang yin pa de yang ga las skyes te de'i phyir 'dir sems las gzhan pa'i rgyu yod par brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: Who created the assembly of causes of those women, the men who enjoy other women, the appearance above and below the śālmali tree, and the śālmali tree itself? Therefore, you should not imagine that there is a cause of this other than the mind.

original: gang / sems can 'jig rten snod kyi 'jig rten dag / sna tshogs sems nyid kyis ni spros pa ste //
analyzed: gang / sems can 'jig rten snod kyi 'jig rten dag / sna tshogs sems nyid kyis ni spros pa ste //
translated: are elaborations of mind itself.

original: 'gro ba ma lus las las skyes par bstan //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus las las skyes par bstan //
translated: All worlds are taught to arise from karma.

original: sems las ma gtogs las ni yod pa min //🔽zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems las ma gtogs las ni yod pa min // zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Apart from mind, there is no karma.

original: de bas na 'dir sems nyid rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir sems nyid rgyu yin te /
translated: Thus, here, mind itself is the cause.

original: gzhan med do zhes de'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan med do zhes de'i phyir /
translated: There is no other.

original: sdig sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sdig sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The mind of evil” and so on.

original: sdig pa'i las nye bar 'dus byas pa'i sems nyid de dag gi rgyu yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: sdig pa'i las nye bar 'dus byas pa'i sems nyid de dag gi rgyu yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One taught that the mind of evil karma is the cause of those.

original: gzhan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: There is not even the slightest other.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir 'jig rten gsum na sdig pa'i sems las gzhan 'jigs pa'i rgyu 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir 'jig rten gsum na sdig pa'i sems las gzhan 'jigs pa'i rgyu 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Since that is so, there is no cause of fear other than the evil mind in the three worlds.

original: de'i phyir sems kho na dbang du bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kho na dbang du bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the mind alone should be brought under control.

original: gang @89b 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las /
analyzed: gang @89b 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las /
translated: As it is said in the noble Ratnamegha:

original: sems ni chos thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: sems ni chos thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: The mind is the forerunner of all phenomena.

original: sems yongs su shes na chos thams cad yongs su shes par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems yongs su shes na chos thams cad yongs su shes par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: If the mind is comprehended, all phenomena are comprehended.

original: gzhan yang / 'jig rten sems kyis khrid pa ste //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'jig rten sems kyis khrid pa ste //
translated: Moreover, the world is led by the mind.

original: sems kyis sems ni mi mthong ngo //🔽dge ba'am yang na mi dge ba'i //
analyzed: sems kyis sems ni mi mthong ngo // dge ba'am yang na mi dge ba'i //
translated: The mind does not see the mind.

original: las ni sems kyis sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las ni sems kyis sogs pa'o //
translated: The mind accumulates virtuous and non-virtuous karma.

original: sems ni mgal me bzhin du 'khor //
analyzed: sems ni mgal me bzhin du 'khor //
translated: The mind circles like a firebrand.

original: sems ni rlabs dang 'dra bar g-yo //
analyzed: sems ni rlabs dang 'dra bar g-yo //
translated: The mind moves like waves.

original: sems ni nags kyi me bzhin sreg / sems ni chu chen bzhin du bskyed //
analyzed: sems ni nags kyi me bzhin sreg / sems ni chu chen bzhin du bskyed //
translated: The mind burns like a forest fire. The mind floods like a great river.

original: ces so // des de ltar nye bar brtags pas na sems la dran pa nye bar gzhag nas gnas te /
analyzed: ces so // des de ltar nye bar brtags pas na sems la dran pa nye bar gzhag nas gnas te /
translated: Thus, by closely examining in this way, one should establish mindfulness in the mind and abide.

original: sems kyi dbang du mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: sems kyi dbang du mi 'gro'o //
translated: One should not fall under the influence of the mind.

original: 'on kyang sems de'i dbang du sems nyid 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems de'i dbang du sems nyid 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: However, the mind itself should come under the influence of that [mindfulness].

original: de'i dbang du sems gyur pa na chos thams cad dbang du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbang du sems gyur pa na chos thams cad dbang du gyur pa yin no //
translated: When the mind comes under its influence, all phenomena come under influence.

original: de ltar yin na ji ltar na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa las sems gtso bo yin /
analyzed: de ltar yin na ji ltar na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa las sems gtso bo yin /
translated: If that is so, how is it that the mind is primary in the perfections of generosity and so on?

original: de ni sems can thams cad kyi dbul ba sel bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni sems can thams cad kyi dbul ba sel bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: It is characterized by the removal of poverty of all sentient beings.

original: gal te 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If you say that the perfection of generosity is the removal of poverty of the world and so on,

original: dbul po zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i bde ba'i longs spyod kyis bkren zhing sems bkren pa'am yo byad med pa ste /
analyzed: dbul po zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i bde ba'i longs spyod kyis bkren zhing sems bkren pa'am yo byad med pa ste /
translated: poor means destitute of contaminated happiness and wealth, or it means having a poor mind or lacking resources.

original: gal te de dang 'gro ba bral bar byas pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pa yin no zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gal te de dang 'gro ba bral bar byas pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pa yin no zhes brjod na /
translated: If you say that the perfection of generosity is the completion of generosity through the removal of poverty of the world,

original: de'i tshe sngon skyob pa ste sngon mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de ji ltar te /
analyzed: de'i tshe sngon skyob pa ste sngon mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de ji ltar te /
translated: then how is that of the protectors, the previously fully enlightened transcendent conquerors?

original: ji ltar yang rigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yang rigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: How could that be reasonable?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: da dung 'gro bkren yod na ste /
analyzed: da dung 'gro bkren yod na ste /
translated: Because if the world is still poor,

original: da dung yang ji srid du 'gro ba'i dbul po nye bar zhi ba med do //
analyzed: da dung yang ji srid du 'gro ba'i dbul po nye bar zhi ba med do //
translated: Still, as long as the poverty of the world is not pacified.

original: gal te de ltar mi 'dod na 'o na de ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar mi 'dod na 'o na de ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one does not accept it in this way, then how is it?

original: bdog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “all possessions,” and so on.

original: bdog pa thams cad ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad de sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i 'bras bu sems can thams cad la yongs su gtong ba goms pa'i rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad de sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i 'bras bu sems can thams cad la yongs su gtong ba goms pa'i rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i phyir /
translated: All possessions are all external and internal things. Giving and the result of giving are completely given to all sentient beings.

original: gang gi tshe chags pa med pas ser sna'i dri ma dang bral ba'i sems skye ba de'i tshe sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs zhes brjod do //🔽de bas na sems nyid las gzhan sbyin pa'i @90a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chags pa med pas ser sna'i dri ma dang bral ba'i sems skye ba de'i tshe sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs zhes brjod do // de bas na sems nyid las gzhan sbyin pa'i @90a * //
translated: When the mind arises free from the stain of miserliness due to nonattachment, at that time the perfection of giving is complete.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa med do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no perfection of giving other than the mind itself.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang shin tu sems nyid yin no zhes bya ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang shin tu sems nyid yin no zhes bya ba de'i phyir /
translated: The perfection of morality is also just the mind itself.

original: nya la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nya la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “fish,” and so on.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa kha na ma tho ba thams cad spong ba'i sems nyid ni tshul khrims yin te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa kha na ma tho ba thams cad spong ba'i sems nyid ni tshul khrims yin te /
translated: Morality is the very intention to avoid all evil, such as killing, etc.

original: de'i rten du gyur pa pha rol gyi yul bzlog pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rten du gyur pa pha rol gyi yul bzlog pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of the prevention of the objects of others.

original: gal te gsad pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos po med pas de gsod pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir tshul khrims su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gsad pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos po med pas de gsod pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir tshul khrims su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is morality because there is no object of killing, etc.

original: de'i tshe nya la sogs pa dang / gzhan gyi bdog pa dang / bud med dang chang la sogs pa de dag gang zhig tu de dag mi mthong bar 'gyur bar bskrad par bya /
analyzed: de'i tshe nya la sogs pa dang / gzhan gyi bdog pa dang / bud med dang chang la sogs pa de dag gang zhig tu de dag mi mthong bar 'gyur bar bskrad par bya /
translated: then at that time, where would you banish fish, etc. and the wealth of others, women, liquor, etc. so that they would not be seen?

original: gzhan du na de dag gsad pa la sogs pa la 'jug par byed pa na tshul khrims su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de dag gsad pa la sogs pa la 'jug par byed pa na tshul khrims su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, when they engage in killing, etc. it would not be morality.

original: de ltar ma yin pa de'i phyir de dag yod pa rnams la yang spong ba'i sems ni thob pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin pa de'i phyir de dag yod pa rnams la yang spong ba'i sems ni thob pa ste /
translated: Since it is not like that, the intention to avoid them is obtained even when they exist.

original: sems ldog par yid la byed pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dod de de'i rang bzhin rigs pa rnams 'dod do //
analyzed: sems ldog par yid la byed pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dod de de'i rang bzhin rigs pa rnams 'dod do //
translated: The mental attention to the reversal of mind is asserted as the perfection of morality, and the natures of those are asserted as the principles.

original: de bas na de yang sems nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de yang sems nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, that also is just mind.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang sems las tha dad pa ma yin no zhes /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang sems las tha dad pa ma yin no zhes /
translated: The perfection of patience is also not different from mind.

original: sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “sentient beings,” and so on.

original: gzhan gnod pa byed pa la sogs pa yod na'ang sems 'khrugs pa med pa nyid ni bzod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gnod pa byed pa la sogs pa yod na'ang sems 'khrugs pa med pa nyid ni bzod pa yin no //
translated: Patience is just the non-disturbance of mind even when there is the existence of others who inflict harm, and so on.

original: gzhan du na gal te dgra thams cad log par ltung bar byed pas dgra tshar phyin par byas par gyur pa ni gang gis kyang dgra med pas nye bar zhi ba dang / dgra la yang gnod pa byed pa med par 'gyur bas bzod pa ni bzod pa yin na de'i tshe de dag ni bsgrub par mi nus te /
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te dgra thams cad log par ltung bar byed pas dgra tshar phyin par byas par gyur pa ni gang gis kyang dgra med pas nye bar zhi ba dang / dgra la yang gnod pa byed pa med par 'gyur bas bzod pa ni bzod pa yin na de'i tshe de dag ni bsgrub par mi nus te /
translated: Otherwise, if all enemies were to be destroyed by being caused to fall into a bad rebirth, then since no one would have any enemies, there would be peace and there would be no harm to enemies. Therefore, patience is not patience. At that time, those are not able to be accomplished.

original: dgra bo rnams ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dgra bo rnams ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa nyid yin te /
translated: Because enemies are like space, they are infinite.

original: de dag gsad par mi nus so //
analyzed: de dag gsad par mi nus so //
translated: They cannot be killed.

original: de lta bas na khro ba la sogs pa las sems log pa nyid de dag thabs kyis bsad pa dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na khro ba la sogs pa las sems log pa nyid de dag thabs kyis bsad pa dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mind is turned away from anger, etc. They are like killed by a method.

original: des gnod pa byas par mi brtsi ba'i phyir dang / tshe rabs gzhan la dgra bo mi 'byung ba'i phyir de dag bsad pa dang 'dra ba yin na //
analyzed: des gnod pa byas par mi brtsi ba'i phyir dang / tshe rabs gzhan la dgra bo mi 'byung ba'i phyir de dag bsad pa dang 'dra ba yin na //
translated: Because he does not count the harm done by them, and because the enemy does not appear in other lives, they are like killed.

original: mi nus pa 'di la yang thabs kyis 'jug pa na dpe nye bar bstan pas nus pa nyid du /
analyzed: mi nus pa 'di la yang thabs kyis 'jug pa na dpe nye bar bstan pas nus pa nyid du /
translated: Even in this impossibility, when one engages by a method, he is able, by the teaching of an example.

original: sa stengs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @90b te ;🔽tsher ma la sogs pa'i gnod pa bsrung ba'i don du sa stengs g-yogs par ni rigs na de ni mi nus te /
analyzed: sa stengs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @90b te ; tsher ma la sogs pa'i gnod pa bsrung ba'i don du sa stengs g-yogs par ni rigs na de ni mi nus te /
translated: He says, “The earth’s surface,” etc.

original: de snyed kyi ko ba med pa'i phyir dang / yod du zin kyang g-yogs par byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de snyed kyi ko ba med pa'i phyir dang / yod du zin kyang g-yogs par byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is reasonable to cover the earth’s surface for the purpose of protecting against the harm of thorns, etc. But that is impossible, because there is no leather to that extent, and even if there were, one could not cover it.

original: yang thabs kyis nus pa ni /
analyzed: yang thabs kyis nus pa ni /
translated: Again, the ability by a method is

original: lham mthil tsam gyi go bas ni sa stengs thams cad g-yogs pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lham mthil tsam gyi go bas ni sa stengs thams cad g-yogs pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is as if the entire surface of the earth were covered with the leather of a single shoe.

original: dpe bstan nas don rnal ma la sbyar ba /🔽de bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dpe bstan nas don rnal ma la sbyar ba / de bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having taught the example, now, the application to the real point:

original: de bzhin ni sa stengs ko bas g-yogs pa lta bur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin ni sa stengs ko bas g-yogs pa lta bur ro //
translated: Thus, just as the surface of the earth is covered with the leather of a single shoe,

original: dgra la sogs pa'i dngos po bdag gis phyir bzlog par mi lang gi gnod pa byed pa'i bya ba las rang gi sems kyi nus pa nyid phyir bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: dgra la sogs pa'i dngos po bdag gis phyir bzlog par mi lang gi gnod pa byed pa'i bya ba las rang gi sems kyi nus pa nyid phyir bzlog pa ste /
translated: one cannot possibly ward off enemies and so forth with one's own body.  One should ward off the capacity of one's own mind to engage in the activity of harming.

original: gzhan bzlog pa la don med pa'i phyir dang / rang gi sems bzlog pa kho nas de 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan bzlog pa la don med pa'i phyir dang / rang gi sems bzlog pa kho nas de 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because warding off the other is pointless and because that is accomplished just by warding off one's own mind.

original: de bas na de ni sems nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ni sems nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is just the mind.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dge ba'i las la spro ba'i rang bzhin yang sems nyid yin par shin tu gsal bas /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dge ba'i las la spro ba'i rang bzhin yang sems nyid yin par shin tu gsal bas /
translated: The nature of delighting in virtuous action, which is the perfection of effort, is also just the mind, as is very clear.

original: sems gsal zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems gsal zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, the text says, The mind is clear light, and so forth.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la lus dang ngag dang bcas kyang sems kyi 'jug pa zhen pas bsam gtan la sogs pa yul la gsal bar rab tu 'jug pa sems gcig pu zhig na yang 'bras bu tshangs pa la sogs pa 'byung ba ji lta ba de ltar 'bras bu
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la lus dang ngag dang bcas kyang sems kyi 'jug pa zhen pas bsam gtan la sogs pa yul la gsal bar rab tu 'jug pa sems gcig pu zhig na yang 'bras bu tshangs pa la sogs pa 'byung ba ji lta ba de ltar 'bras bu
translated: Though body and speech are engaged in virtue, the mind is not.🔽🔽The mind alone is engaged in concentration and so on, but the result is not clear.🔽🔽The result of concentration is the formless realm and the result of the formless realm is the peak of existence.🔽

original: mi skye ste /
analyzed: mi skye ste /
translated: Even though one is engaged in virtue with body and speech, if the mind is not engaged with concentration, etc. due to attachment, then the result of Brahma, etc. will not arise, just as it does when the mind is engaged with clarity in the object.

original: de lta bas na de yang sems nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de yang sems nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, that also is just the mind.

original: bsam gtan ni sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Concentration has the characteristic of a one-pointed mind.

original: sems las gzhan du smra bar mi nus pas /
analyzed: sems las gzhan du smra bar mi nus pas /
translated: Since it cannot be said to be other than the mind,

original: bzlas brjod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: bzlas brjod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: he says “recitation,” etc.

original: gsang sngags la sogs pa zlos pa'i mtshan nyid dag gis byed pa ni bzlas brjod do //
analyzed: gsang sngags la sogs pa zlos pa'i mtshan nyid dag gis byed pa ni bzlas brjod do //
translated: Recitation is the action of those who have the characteristic of reciting mantras, etc.

original: dka' thub ni lus kyis te dbang po 'dul ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dka' thub ni lus kyis te dbang po 'dul ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Austerity is bodily, having the characteristic of subduing the senses.

original: de rnams zhes bya ba ni dus ring por goms par byas pa rnams kyang ngo //🔽gzhan du na ni sems chags pas sam //
analyzed: de rnams zhes bya ba ni dus ring por goms par byas pa rnams kyang ngo // gzhan du na ni sems chags pas sam //
translated: Those, i.e., those that are practiced for a long time,🔽otherwise, if the mind is attached,

original: gnyid kyis bcom pa'i sems kyis te /
analyzed: gnyid kyis bcom pa'i sems kyis te /
translated: or if the mind is overcome by sleep,

original: bsam gtan la gsal ba med pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gtan la gsal ba med pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “because there is no clarity in concentration” is that.

original: don med pa ni 'bras bu med pa nyid do //
analyzed: don med pa ni 'bras bu med pa nyid do //
translated: “Meaningless” means being without result.

original: 'bras bu shin tu nyung ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'bras bu shin tu nyung ba'i phyir ram /
translated: Because the result is very small,

original: 'dod pa'i don la mkho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don la mkho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because there is no need for the desired meaning.

original: dper na bu'i bya ba mi byed pa'i phyir /🔽bu yang bu min pa dang @91a * //
analyzed: dper na bu'i bya ba mi byed pa'i phyir / bu yang bu min pa dang @91a * //
translated: For example, because a son does not perform his duties,

original: 'dra ba yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: he is like a son who is not a son.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The Omniscient One,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: the Blessed One, has said this.

original: de lta bas na bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang sems nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang sems nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of concentration is also just the mind.

original: shes rab ni rtsod pa med par sems nyid yin pas /
analyzed: shes rab ni rtsod pa med par sems nyid yin pas /
translated: Wisdom is just the mind without dispute.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: Therefore, it is said, “By whom, etc.”

original: 'gro ba lnga'i skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal spangs pa'i phyir de spong bar byed pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba thob par bya bar 'dod kyang sems can de dag 'khor bar 'bras bu med cing don med pa gyi na nyid du nam mkha' la me tog ka shi bzhin du 'khyam mo //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal spangs pa'i phyir de spong bar byed pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba thob par bya bar 'dod kyang sems can de dag 'khor bar 'bras bu med cing don med pa gyi na nyid du nam mkha' la me tog ka shi bzhin du 'khyam mo //
translated: In order to abandon the suffering of birth, etc., in the five destinies, he strives to abandon them, and he desires to attain the bliss of nirvana. But those sentient beings wander in cyclic existence, like a flower in the sky, aimlessly and without purpose.

original: de nyid kyis me lnga bstan pa dang skra bsal ba la sogs pa'i brtul zhugs 'bad par byas pa gang du yang 'brel pa med par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis me lnga bstan pa dang skra bsal ba la sogs pa'i brtul zhugs 'bad par byas pa gang du yang 'brel pa med par brjod pa yin no //
translated: He also says that the austerities of the five fires, the removal of the hair, etc., are not related to anything.

original: su zhig de ltar 'khyam zhe na /
analyzed: su zhig de ltar 'khyam zhe na /
translated: Who wanders in that way?

original: gang gis te 'khor ba'i 'jigs pas bred pas bde ba don du gnyer ba rnams kyis chos kyi bdog pa kun te 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi gter du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis te 'khor ba'i 'jigs pas bred pas bde ba don du gnyer ba rnams kyis chos kyi bdog pa kun te 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi gter du gyur pa'o //
translated: Those who, fearing the terrors of cyclic existence, strive for happiness, the entire wealth of the Dharma, which is a treasure of mundane and supramundane Dharma.

original: sems can byis pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gsang ba ste /
analyzed: sems can byis pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gsang ba ste /
translated: It is secret because it is not the domain of experience of childish sentient beings.

original: gang gis ma bsgoms pa ni de kho na nyid kyi sems kyis yang nas yang du brtan par ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis ma bsgoms pa ni de kho na nyid kyi sems kyis yang nas yang du brtan par ma byas pa'o //
translated: Not cultivated means not repeatedly stabilized by the mind of reality.

original: de bas na 'di ni shin tu yang sems nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni shin tu yang sems nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is also the mind itself.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las kyang bsngags te /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las kyang bsngags te /
translated: As it is praised in the noble Gaṇḍavyūha Sūtra:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad ni rang gi sems la brten to /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad ni rang gi sems la brten to /
translated: “All the bodhisattva practices are based on one’s own mind.

original: sems can thams cad smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba ni rang gi sems la brten to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba ni rang gi sems la brten to //
translated: Ripening and guiding all sentient beings is based on one’s own mind.

original: de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: And so on.

original: rigs kyi bu de la bdag 'di snyam du sems te /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rang gi sems nyid nye bar brten par bya'o //🔽chos kyi sprin rnams kyis rang gi sems yongs su brlan par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de la bdag 'di snyam du sems te / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rang gi sems nyid nye bar brten par bya'o // chos kyi sprin rnams kyis rang gi sems yongs su brlan par bya'o //
translated: Son of noble family, I think this:🔽One should rely on one’s own mind with wholesome actions.🔽One should moisten one’s own mind with the clouds of Dharma.

original: sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos can rnams las rang gi sems yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos can rnams las rang gi sems yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: One should purify one’s own mind from the phenomena that lead to obscuration.

original: brtson 'grus kyis rang gi sems nyid brtan par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis rang gi sems nyid brtan par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and by striving, one should stabilize one's own mind.

original: de ltar thams cad du sems kyi rang bzhin yin par bstan nas mjug bsdu ba de lta zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad du sems kyi rang bzhin yin par bstan nas mjug bsdu ba de lta zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, having taught that everything is of the nature of mind, he concludes:

original: de ltar byang chub kyi sems bskyed pas bslab pa la @91b bsrung ba la 'bad pa dang ldan par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub kyi sems bskyed pas bslab pa la @91b bsrung ba la 'bad pa dang ldan par yid la bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should attend to one's own mind with mindfulness and vigilance, striving to guard the training by generating the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis dran pas shin tu brtan pa dang / shes bzhin gyis shin tu bsrung bas bdag gis rang gi sems rtse gcig pa'i yid du bya ste /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis dran pas shin tu brtan pa dang / shes bzhin gyis shin tu bsrung bas bdag gis rang gi sems rtse gcig pa'i yid du bya ste /
translated: One should attend to one's own mind with mindfulness and vigilance, striving to guard the training by generating the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: 'di nyid kyi nang du thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi nang du thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because everything is included in this.

original: de bas na sems bsrung ba nyid brtul zhugs gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sems bsrung ba nyid brtul zhugs gtso bo yin te /
translated: Therefore, guarding the mind is the principal vow.

original: de bor nas brtul zhugs mang po gzhan gyis kyang bdag la ci zhig dgos te /
analyzed: de bor nas brtul zhugs mang po gzhan gyis kyang bdag la ci zhig dgos te /
translated: What need have I for other vows, which I might break?

original: phan pa cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: phan pa cung zad kyang med de /
translated: They are of no use at all.

original: de dang bral na de la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang bral na de la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not, then it is fruitless.

original: re zhig byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: re zhig byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The training of the bodhisattvas is as follows:

original: 'di lta ste sems yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sems yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: The mind should be purified.

original: de ni sems can gyi don thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sems can gyi don thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the root of all the aims of sentient beings.

original: de ni 'di ltar chos yang dag par sdud pa las bstan te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos yang dag par sdud pa las bstan te /
translated: This is taught in the Compendium of Dharma:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par gnon pa'i blo gros kyis gsol ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par gnon pa'i blo gros kyis gsol ba /
translated: The bodhisattva Vikrāntavikrāmī said:

original: chos chos zhes bgyi ba'i chos gang lags pa de ni yul na mi gnas /
analyzed: chos chos zhes bgyi ba'i chos gang lags pa de ni yul na mi gnas /
translated: The so-called Dharma does not abide in a place

original: phyogs na mi gnas te /
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas te /
translated: or in a direction.🔽Except for the Dharma that depends on one’s own mind,🔽therefore, one should thoroughly grasp one’s own mind,🔽thoroughly please it,

original: chos rang gi sems la rag las pa ni ma gtogs pas de lta bas na de dag gis rang gi sems shin tu gzung ba dang / legs par mgu ba dang / shin tu mthar gtugs pa dang shin tu dul ba dang shin tu mnyam par brtsams pa dang /
analyzed: chos rang gi sems la rag las pa ni ma gtogs pas de lta bas na de dag gis rang gi sems shin tu gzung ba dang / legs par mgu ba dang / shin tu mthar gtugs pa dang shin tu dul ba dang shin tu mnyam par brtsams pa dang /
translated: thoroughly exhaust it,🔽thoroughly tame it,🔽thoroughly concentrate it,

original: shin tu tshar gcod par bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu tshar gcod par bya'o //
translated: and thoroughly destroy it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems gang na mchis pa de ni yon tan dang nyes pa rnams mchis kyi /
analyzed: sems gang na mchis pa de ni yon tan dang nyes pa rnams mchis kyi /
translated: Wherever there is mind, there are good qualities and faults.

original: sems ma mchis pa la ni yon tan dang nyes pa rnams ma mchis snyam ste /
analyzed: sems ma mchis pa la ni yon tan dang nyes pa rnams ma mchis snyam ste /
translated: But where there is no mind, there are no good qualities and faults.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' nyes pa rnams las sems bzlog nas yon tan rnams la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' nyes pa rnams las sems bzlog nas yon tan rnams la 'jug ste /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva, having turned the mind away from faults, engages in good qualities.

original: de lta bas na chos ni sems la rag las /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos ni sems la rag las /
translated: Thus, the Dharma depends on the mind.

original: byang chub ni chos la rag las zhes bgyi'o zhes so //
analyzed: byang chub ni chos la rag las zhes bgyi'o zhes so //
translated: Awakening depends on the Dharma.”

original: de ltar thams cad du sems la rag las pa nyes par byas nas sems brtan par bya ba'i dpe brjod pa /🔽ma grangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad du sems la rag las pa nyes par byas nas sems brtan par bya ba'i dpe brjod pa / ma grangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having thus seen that everything depends on the mind, the author states an example of how to stabilize the mind:🔽“Even in the midst of an unruly crowd, a person who is heedful, with a mind alert to the dangers of injury, is protected like someone guarding a wound.”

original: skye bo mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i khrod na yang nye bar gnod pa'i 'jigs pas der brtad pa'i yid kyis bag yod pa 'ga' zhig ji ltar srung ba rma'i bag byed pa bzhin du de bzhin te de ltar bslab pa bsrung bar 'dod pas don med par byis
analyzed: skye bo mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i khrod na yang nye bar gnod pa'i 'jigs pas der brtad pa'i yid kyis bag yod pa 'ga' zhig ji ltar srung ba rma'i bag byed pa bzhin du de bzhin te de ltar bslab pa bsrung bar 'dod pas don med par byis
translated: Thus, one who wishes to protect the training should be like someone guarding a wound.

original: pa'i skye bo'i nang na gnas pa na brtson pas sems kyi rma dus thams cad du bsrung ngo //
analyzed: pa'i skye bo'i nang na gnas pa na brtson pas sems kyi rma dus thams cad du bsrung ngo //
translated: One should guard the wound of the mind at all times with effort, while living among people.

original: @92a * // grags pa ji bzhin du 'dir dper brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: @92a * // grags pa ji bzhin du 'dir dper brjod pa yin te /
translated: The example is given here in accordance with the well-known fact.

original: yang cung zad du yang 'dra ba med par gsungs pa /🔽rma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas te /
analyzed: yang cung zad du yang 'dra ba med par gsungs pa / rma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas te /
translated: But there is not even the slightest similarity, as is stated:

original: rma yis byas pa'i sdug bsngal cung zad tsam ni sdug bsngal chung ngu'o //
analyzed: rma yis byas pa'i sdug bsngal cung zad tsam ni sdug bsngal chung ngu'o //
translated: The suffering caused by a wound is slight.

original: de yis skrag pa'ang rma'i bag byed na'ang ste /
analyzed: de yis skrag pa'ang rma'i bag byed na'ang ste /
translated: Even for that, one is afraid and guards the wound.

original: gus pas ni lhur blang ba nas so //
analyzed: gus pas ni lhur blang ba nas so //
translated: With respect, one should apply oneself.

original: bsdus 'joms ni sems can dmyal bar lhung ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: bsdus 'joms ni sems can dmyal bar lhung ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The suffering of falling into the hell of Saṃghāta is great.

original: stong phrag du mar myong bar 'gyur ba'i ris 'joms pa thams cad du khyab pa'i bsnun pa'i skrag pa yis /🔽sems kyi rma lta cis mi bsrung ste bsrung bar bya'o zhes skabs kyis 'brel to //
analyzed: stong phrag du mar myong bar 'gyur ba'i ris 'joms pa thams cad du khyab pa'i bsnun pa'i skrag pa yis / sems kyi rma lta cis mi bsrung ste bsrung bar bya'o zhes skabs kyis 'brel to //
translated: One should guard the wound of the mind with the fear of being crushed in many thousands of ways, the fear of being struck everywhere.🔽Or, one should understand the context as follows: Why should one not guard the wound of the mind?

original: yang na bdag gis cis te bsrung bar mi bya zhes sgyur te sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag gis cis te bsrung bar mi bya zhes sgyur te sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Or, one should understand it as follows: Why should one not guard it?

original: yang na byang chub tu sems bskyed pas de ltar yid kyis bsam par bya'o zhes drangs la /
analyzed: yang na byang chub tu sems bskyed pas de ltar yid kyis bsam par bya'o zhes drangs la /
translated: Or else, by generating the Thought of Enlightenment, one should think in this way with the mind.

original: de'i tshe bsrung bar bya'o zhes gdon cing sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe bsrung bar bya'o zhes gdon cing sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: At that time, one should guard it, and one should be exhorted and applied to it.

original: de ltar gyur pa la yon tan ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa la yon tan ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the good quality of one who has become like that?

original: yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse says Because of that, etc.

original: gang gi phyir khang bzangs kyi steng na bud med kyi 'gro ba'i khrod na yid la byed pa 'di lta bus gnas pa na 'dod pa rnams las shin tu bzlog par mi nus pa 'di yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khang bzangs kyi steng na bud med kyi 'gro ba'i khrod na yid la byed pa 'di lta bus gnas pa na 'dod pa rnams las shin tu bzlog par mi nus pa 'di yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because of that, in the midst of the assembly of women on the roof of the palace, when one dwells with this kind of mental orientation, one is not able to turn away from the sense objects.

original: sdom brtson brten pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sdom brtson brten pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, the one who is firm in the effort of the vow.

original: yid la byed pa 'di la nges par sems pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa 'di la nges par sems pa'o //
translated: One is certain in the mental orientation of this.

original: nyams mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyams mi 'gyur te /
translated: One does not change.

original: bslab pa bsrung ba'i yid la byed pa 'khrul par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bslab pa bsrung ba'i yid la byed pa 'khrul par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One does not err in the mental orientation of guarding the precepts.

original: yang de ltar bya bar 'os pa yin no zhes don 'di la mngon par zhen pa brtan par bya ba bstan pa /
analyzed: yang de ltar bya bar 'os pa yin no zhes don 'di la mngon par zhen pa brtan par bya ba bstan pa /
translated: One should do it that way, and so on. In order to show the stability of the conviction in this meaning, it says:

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse that begins I may lose my robes, and so on.

original: chos gos dang / bsod snyoms la sogs pa rnyed pa nyams bla zhing ni brlag kyang bla'i'o //
analyzed: chos gos dang / bsod snyoms la sogs pa rnyed pa nyams bla zhing ni brlag kyang bla'i'o //
translated: It is better to lose my robes, alms, and so on.

original: bdag gi 'dod pa ni ji ltar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi 'dod pa ni ji ltar 'dod pa'o //
translated: My desire is to do whatever I want.

original: bkur sti ni gus pas stan gding ba dang / zhabs la phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: bkur sti ni gus pas stan gding ba dang / zhabs la phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'i mchod pa'o //
translated: Respect is worship with devotion, such as spreading out a seat and prostrating at the feet.

original: lus dang 'tsho ba ste de dag thams cad nyams pa bla zhing gzhan yang ste /
analyzed: lus dang 'tsho ba ste de dag thams cad nyams pa bla zhing gzhan yang ste /
translated: All of these, my body and life, are better lost.

original: bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i rgyu mtshan gang ci yang rung ba de dag nyams su chug gi //
analyzed: bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i rgyu mtshan gang ci yang rung ba de dag nyams su chug gi //
translated: And moreover, whatever is a cause for happiness and mental pleasure, let that be lost.

original: bdag gi sems dge ba ni dus nam du yang nyams par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi sems dge ba ni dus nam du yang nyams par mi bya ba'o //
translated: But my virtuous mind I will never let be lost.

original: yang 'dir gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad pas sems zhes @92b bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang 'dir gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad pas sems zhes @92b bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: And here, in order to generate respect, the author of the treatise says mind, and so on.

original: thal mo sbyar te gsol ba 'debs /
analyzed: thal mo sbyar te gsol ba 'debs /
translated: With palms joined, I make this request.

original: ci'i don du zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i don du zhe na /
translated: For what purpose?

original: dran pa dang ni shes bzhin dag ste /
analyzed: dran pa dang ni shes bzhin dag ste /
translated: For mindfulness and vigilance.

original: dran pa 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: dran pa 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin la /
translated: It is not just mindfulness,

original: shes bzhin 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin no zhes pa ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin no zhes pa ste /
translated: nor is it just vigilance.

original: rang gi don ni phan tshun du ltos pas so //
analyzed: rang gi don ni phan tshun du ltos pas so //
translated: Because one’s own aim is mutually dependent.

original: de la dran pa ni 'phags pa gtsug na rin po che'i mdo las bshad de /
analyzed: de la dran pa ni 'phags pa gtsug na rin po che'i mdo las bshad de /
translated: Here, mindfulness is explained in the Sūtra of the Jewel at the Crown of the Head:

original: dran pa gang gis nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / dran pa gang gis bdud kyi las thams cad kyi skabs mi 'byed pa dang / dran pa gang gis lam gol ba'am ngan par mi 'gro ba dang / dran pa sgo ba lta bur gyur pa gang gis sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi dge ba thams cad kyi skabs mi 'byed pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i dran pa zhes bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: dran pa gang gis nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / dran pa gang gis bdud kyi las thams cad kyi skabs mi 'byed pa dang / dran pa gang gis lam gol ba'am ngan par mi 'gro ba dang / dran pa sgo ba lta bur gyur pa gang gis sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi dge ba thams cad kyi skabs mi 'byed pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i dran pa zhes bya'o zhes so //
translated: “The mindfulness by which all afflictions do not arise, the mindfulness by which one does not provide an opportunity for any of the works of Māra, the mindfulness by which one does not go down a wrong or bad path, the mindfulness that is like a gatekeeper, by which one does not provide an opportunity for any nonvirtuous mental factors or derivative mental factors—this is called right mindfulness.”

original: mdor na dran pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: mdor na dran pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: In brief, mindfulness is this:

original: gnang ba dang bkag pa gnyis ci rigs par dran pa ni dran pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnang ba dang bkag pa gnyis ci rigs par dran pa ni dran pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Mindfulness of what is permitted and what is prohibited is called mindfulness.

original: gang gi phyir dran pa dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dran pa dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because it is taught that mindfulness is the non-forgetting of the object.

original: shes bzhin yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs te /
analyzed: shes bzhin yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs te /
translated: And heedfulness is taught in the Perfection of Wisdom:

original: spyod na yang bdag spyod do zhes rab tu shes so //🔽'greng na bdag 'greng ngo snyam du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: spyod na yang bdag spyod do zhes rab tu shes so // 'greng na bdag 'greng ngo snyam du rab tu shes so //
translated: When walking, he knows, “I am walking.”🔽When standing, he knows, “I am standing.”

original: 'dug na bdag 'dug go snyam du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'dug na bdag 'dug go snyam du rab tu shes so //
translated: When sitting, he knows, “I am sitting.”

original: nyal na bdag nyal lo snyam du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: nyal na bdag nyal lo snyam du rab tu shes so //
translated: When lying down, he knows, “I am lying down.”

original: de'i lus ji lta ji ltar gnas par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de'i lus ji lta ji ltar gnas par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows just as his body is disposed.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: de 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin no //
translated: He is heedful when going out and coming back.

original: lta ba dang rnam par lta ba dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / chos gos snam sbyar dang / thang ba dang ; lhung bzed dang / chos gos 'chang ba dang / za ba dang / 'thung ba dang / 'chal ba dang /
analyzed: lta ba dang rnam par lta ba dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / chos gos snam sbyar dang / thang ba dang ; lhung bzed dang / chos gos 'chang ba dang / za ba dang / 'thung ba dang / 'chal ba dang /
translated: He is heedful when looking ahead and looking aside, when bending and stretching his arms, when wearing his robes and carrying his alms bowl, when eating, drinking, chewing, and tasting, when defecating and urinating, when walking, standing, sitting, sleeping, waking, talking, and remaining silent.
