original: gnyid dang / sdom pa bsal ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / gnyid kyis log pa dang / gnyid kyis ma log pa dang / smra ba dang / mi smra ba dang / nang du yang dag par 'jog pa na shes bzhin du spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyid dang / sdom pa bsal ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / gnyid kyis log pa dang / gnyid kyis ma log pa dang / smra ba dang / mi smra ba dang / nang du yang dag par 'jog pa na shes bzhin du spyod pa yin no //
translated: and being in meditative equipoise.

original: 'di nyid nas kyang /🔽lus dang sems kyi gnas skabs la //
analyzed: 'di nyid nas kyang / lus dang sems kyi gnas skabs la //
translated: And here itself it is said:

original: yang nas yang du lta ba gang //🔽'di nyid kho na mdor bsdus na //
analyzed: yang nas yang du lta ba gang // 'di nyid kho na mdor bsdus na //
translated: The repeated observation of the condition of body and mind

original: shes bzhin bsrung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shes bzhin bsrung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: is precisely the definition of introspection.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //🔽gang gis 'di dag bsrung bar bya bar @93a * //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro // gang gis 'di dag bsrung bar bya bar @93a * //
translated: And it is said:🔽The repeated observation of the condition of body and mind🔽is precisely the definition of introspection.

original: bstan pa 'di dag med na nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di dag med na nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the fault if these are not present, which are taught to be the means of protection?

original: nad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said: “By the loss of mindfulness and introspection, the mind becomes distracted and confused.”

original: nad kyis nus pa nyams pa'i skyes bu ji lta bar las rnams kun la ste /
analyzed: nad kyis nus pa nyams pa'i skyes bu ji lta bar las rnams kun la ste /
translated: Just as a person whose strength is impaired by illness, so the mind is in all activities.

original: 'gro ba dang ston mo la sogs pa'i las rnams kun la las su rung bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du dran pa dang shes bzhin med pa'i sems kyis bsam gtan dang kha ton la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de las rnams kun la'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang ston mo la sogs pa'i las rnams kun la las su rung bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du dran pa dang shes bzhin med pa'i sems kyis bsam gtan dang kha ton la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de las rnams kun la'o //
translated: Just as one is not fit for any activity, such as going out or a feast, in the same way, with a mind lacking mindfulness and vigilance, one is not fit for any activity, such as concentration and recitation.

original: 'di dag bsdoms nas med pa'i nyes pa bstan nas /
analyzed: 'di dag bsdoms nas med pa'i nyes pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the fault of lacking these two in combination,

original: re re med par brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: re re med par brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: he speaks of the fault of lacking each one:

original: shes bzhin med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes bzhin med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He who lacks vigilance, etc.

original: gang la shes bzhin yod pa ma yin pa de ni shes bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: gang la shes bzhin yod pa ma yin pa de ni shes bzhin med pa ste /
translated: He who does not have vigilance is one who lacks vigilance.

original: sems can de gang la yod pa de la thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis dngos po yongs su shes kyang dran pa la mi gnas so //
analyzed: sems can de gang la yod pa de la thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis dngos po yongs su shes kyang dran pa la mi gnas so //
translated: Even though he has understood things with the wisdom born from listening, reflection, and meditation, he does not abide in mindfulness.

original: de dge ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: de dge ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin no //
translated: Mindfulness is the root of all virtue.

original: ci dang 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: ji ltar bum pa glo rdol du kha nas chu blugs pa 'og tu 'gro zhing mi gnas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa glo rdol du kha nas chu blugs pa 'og tu 'gro zhing mi gnas pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as when a pot with a hole at the bottom is filled with water, the water does not remain but flows out.

original: gzhan yang 'di med pa yi skyon //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di med pa yi skyon //
translated: Moreover, the faults of its absence are

original: thos ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: thos ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: stated in the following: “The learned, the faithful, the diligent, and the respectful🔽will be defiled by downfalls due to the fault of lack of alertness.”

original: mang ba ni mang du thos pa'o //
analyzed: mang ba ni mang du thos pa'o //
translated: “The learned” are those who have heard much.

original: de bzhin du dad pa dang ldan pa brtson pa lhur len pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dad pa dang ldan pa brtson pa lhur len pa ste /
translated: Similarly, “the faithful” are those who have faith in the Three Jewels.🔽“The diligent” are those who are devoted to the training.

original: bslab pa la gus par byed pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: bslab pa la gus par byed pa rnams kyang /
translated: “The respectful” are those who are devoted to the precepts.

original: shes bzhin med pa'i skyon chags pas ltung ba'i rnyog pa dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes bzhin med pa'i skyon chags pas ltung ba'i rnyog pa dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: They will be defiled by downfalls due to the fault of lack of alertness,

original: lus dang sems kyi spyod pa so sor mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi spyod pa so sor mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not discern the conduct of body and mind.

original: de med pa'i skyon gzhan yang /
analyzed: de med pa'i skyon gzhan yang /
translated: The other faults of its absence are

original: shes bzhin med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes bzhin med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: stated in the following: “The unalert are seized by the thieves,🔽and their virtue is stolen away.”

original: shes bzhin med pa ni shes bzhin dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin med pa ni shes bzhin dang bral ba'o //
translated: Lack of alertness is the absence of alertness.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo ni chom rkun te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo ni chom rkun te /
translated: The essence of the things that are afflictions are thieves,

original: dge ba'i nor 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i nor 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they steal the wealth of virtue.

original: des dran pa nyams pa'i rjes su 'brang bas bsrung zhing skyong bar 'gyur ba'i dran pa brjed pa'i dngos po'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: des dran pa nyams pa'i rjes su 'brang bas bsrung zhing skyong bar 'gyur ba'i dran pa brjed pa'i dngos po'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: Since it follows after the loss of mindfulness, it is the mindfulness that is forgotten, which follows after the things that are to be guarded and protected.

original: phrogs pa ni dge ba'i nor yod pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: phrogs pa ni dge ba'i nor yod pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is a thief, because it robs one of the wealth of virtue.

original: bsod nams dag ni nye bar bsags kyang ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dag ni nye bar bsags kyang ste /
translated: Even though one has accumulated merit,

original: dge ba'i nor rnams bsags par byas nas kyang ngan 'gror gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i nor rnams bsags par byas nas kyang ngan 'gror gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: even though one has accumulated the wealth of virtue, one is still headed for the miserable realms.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar na bstan pa'i don nyid gsal bar byed pa nyon mongs zhes bya ba la sogs pa @93b gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na bstan pa'i don nyid gsal bar byed pa nyon mongs zhes bya ba la sogs pa @93b gsungs te /
translated: Thus, in order to clarify the meaning of the teaching, he says, “The afflictions are like thieves and so on.”

original: chom po dang rkun po de dag gi tshogs glags skabs tshol bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: chom po dang rkun po de dag gi tshogs glags skabs tshol bar byed pa ste /
translated: The hordes of those thieves and robbers seek an opportunity,

original: sha za bzhin du glags skabs kyi lam lta zhing skyon tshol ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sha za bzhin du glags skabs kyi lam lta zhing skyon tshol ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: looking for a chance to devour one, looking for a fault and so on.

original: glags rnyed gyur nas de 'jug pa'i las dang phrad nas dge ba 'phrog cing /
analyzed: glags rnyed gyur nas de 'jug pa'i las dang phrad nas dge ba 'phrog cing /
translated: Once they have found an opportunity, they steal the virtue by encountering the karma that engages it.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba bzang po'i srog thob pa 'joms par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba bzang po'i srog thob pa 'joms par byed de /
translated: Therefore, it destroys the attainment of the life of good destiny.

original: dge ba'i brgyags med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i brgyags med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of the food of virtue.

original: da ni dran pa'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni dran pa'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
translated: Now, having taken up mindfulness, he says:

original: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gi phyir dran pa med pa'i nyes pa de ltar 'gyur ba de'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gi phyir dran pa med pa'i nyes pa de ltar 'gyur ba de'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, etc. Because of the fault of the absence of mindfulness, it would be like that.

original: 'dir nyes pa 'di mthong nas dran pa dmigs pa ma brjed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir nyes pa 'di mthong nas dran pa dmigs pa ma brjed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Having seen this fault here, mindfulness has the characteristic of not forgetting the object.

original: yid sgo nas yid kyi khyim gyi 'jug pa'i sgo nas gud du mi gtang zhing ma spang bar rtag tu gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid sgo nas yid kyi khyim gyi 'jug pa'i sgo nas gud du mi gtang zhing ma spang bar rtag tu gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The door of the mind is the door of entry into the house of the mind. It should not be let out, not abandoned, but always placed. This is the meaning.

original: ji ste brgya zhig la bag med pas de de nas song nas de'i tshe song na'ang slar bzlog nas de nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: ji ste brgya zhig la bag med pas de de nas song nas de'i tshe song na'ang slar bzlog nas de nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: But if, by chance, through heedlessness, it goes out from there, then, when it goes, it should be turned back and placed near.

original: de nyid du gtad de gzhag par bya'o ;
analyzed: de nyid du gtad de gzhag par bya'o ;
translated: It should be placed right there, fixed.

original: / ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: / ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: ngan song ste sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan 'gro'i gnod pa dran par byas shing yid la gzhag la'o //
analyzed: ngan song ste sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan 'gro'i gnod pa dran par byas shing yid la gzhag la'o //
translated: One should recollect and keep in mind the harm of the lower realms, such as the hells.

original: de la dran pa bcu gnyis po 'di dag gi 'bras bu med pa'i spyod pa spang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la dran pa bcu gnyis po 'di dag gi 'bras bu med pa'i spyod pa spang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Here, these twelve recollections are for the purpose of abandoning conduct that is fruitless.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' las mi 'da' bar srung zhing rnam par smin pa la gus par bya ba'i dran pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bslab pa kun las btus pa las rab tu bstan nas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' las mi 'da' bar srung zhing rnam par smin pa la gus par bya ba'i dran pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bslab pa kun las btus pa las rab tu bstan nas te /
translated: As stated in the Compendium of Training, one should guard against transgressing the words of the Tathagata with the recollection of respect for ripening and so forth.

original: de nyid nas rnam par phye ste gzung bar bya'o //🔽dran pa de yang gus pa drag pos skye'o //
analyzed: de nyid nas rnam par phye ste gzung bar bya'o // dran pa de yang gus pa drag pos skye'o //
translated: One should understand them in detail as explained there.🔽Moreover, that recollection arises through intense respect.

original: gus pa yang zhi gnas kyi bdag nyid chen po khong du chud nas lhur blangs pa las skye ste /
analyzed: gus pa yang zhi gnas kyi bdag nyid chen po khong du chud nas lhur blangs pa las skye ste /
translated: And respect arises from taking up the great self of shamatha.

original: de dag kyang skabs ji lta ba bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang skabs ji lta ba bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: Those will be explained as the occasion arises.

original: kha cig la rnam pa gzhan du yang dran pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig la rnam pa gzhan du yang dran pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: For some, recollection arises in other ways as well.

original: de bstan pa ni bla ma dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽slob dpon dang mkhan po dang nye ba'am /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni bla ma dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / slob dpon dang mkhan po dang nye ba'am /
translated: The teaching of that is stated by “to the guru” and so forth.🔽One should be near the master, the preceptor, and so forth.

original: de las gzhan yang dung ste ma gu bar bya ba tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dang nye bar ste 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan yang dung ste ma gu bar bya ba tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dang nye bar ste 'grogs pa'o //
translated: Or else, one should be near, that is, associate with, the fellow brahmacharins who are to be respected.

original: de'i rjes su bstan pa 'jigs pa ni des 'jigs pa la'ang ngo //
analyzed: de'i rjes su bstan pa 'jigs pa ni des 'jigs pa la'ang ngo //
translated: One should be afraid of the teaching of that, that is, of the fear of that.

original: gus pas ni bya ba rnams la dngos po kun gyis phyogs pa nyid de brnyas pa'i gnyen po'i chos yin no //
analyzed: gus pas ni bya ba rnams la dngos po kun gyis phyogs pa nyid de brnyas pa'i gnyen po'i chos yin no //
translated: With respect, that is, with all things in the direction of the activities, is the antidote to contempt.

original: de byed pa ni mkhas pa 'bad pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de byed pa ni mkhas pa 'bad pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The one who does that is the wise one who is endowed with effort.

original: @94a * // de'i rjes su bstan pa ni phan pa dang mi phan pa sgrub pa dang dgag pa nges pa rjes su 'dzin pa tshegs chung dus dran pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @94a * // de'i rjes su bstan pa ni phan pa dang mi phan pa sgrub pa dang dgag pa nges pa rjes su 'dzin pa tshegs chung dus dran pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The teaching of that is the definite acceptance of the establishment and prohibition of benefit and harm, which is the arising of mindfulness with little difficulty.

original: 'di ltar yang gnas na dran pa yid la byed pa mang du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis kyis bstan pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang gnas na dran pa yid la byed pa mang du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis kyis bstan pa /
translated: Thus, if one dwells in this way, one dwells in the frequent mental attentions of mindfulness. This is taught by two verses.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Buddha, etc.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dus kun tu dngos po'i yul mtha' dag thogs pa med pa'i spyan mnga' ba rnams kyi spyan snga na dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad dus kun tu gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dus kun tu dngos po'i yul mtha' dag thogs pa med pa'i spyan mnga' ba rnams kyi spyan snga na dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad dus kun tu gnas pa yin te /
translated: The Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, who at all times have the unobstructed eye of knowledge of all the objects of the world, see all the aspects of the world at all times.

original: dngos po thams cad ltar bdag kyang de rnams kyi spyan snga na 'dug pa nyid yin no zhes yid la bzhag la /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ltar bdag kyang de rnams kyi spyan snga na 'dug pa nyid yin no zhes yid la bzhag la /
translated: Just as all the objects are in their presence, so also am I.

original: de bzhin du bdag nyid legs par bsdams shing bsdad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag nyid legs par bsdams shing bsdad do //
translated: Thus, one should keep this in mind and remain well restrained.

original: ngo tsha shes gus 'jigs bcas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes gus 'jigs bcas zhes bya ba la /
translated: With a sense of shame, respect, and fear.

original: mi mthun pa'i las la 'jom pa ni ngo tsha shes pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / de las mi 'da' bar 'jigs pa'am /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i las la 'jom pa ni ngo tsha shes pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / de las mi 'da' bar 'jigs pa'am /
translated: Shame is the embarrassment at doing something wrong. Respect for the precepts is the fear of transgressing them.

original: 'dir khrel yod pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la go bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir khrel yod pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la go bar bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand that shame, etc., are the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar gyur na khyad par gzhan yang yod pas na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na khyad par gzhan yang yod pas na /
translated: Since this is so, there is another distinction.

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The line And that... and so forth.

original: de ltar gnas pa de la skad cig re re zhing mi 'dod bzhin du sangs rgyas rjes su dran bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa de la skad cig re re zhing mi 'dod bzhin du sangs rgyas rjes su dran bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, for one who abides in that way, Buddha-mindfulness occurs in every moment, even if not desired.

original: shes bzhin du skye ba dang brten pa dag gis yang rgyu dran pa nyid yin no zhes brjod pa /
analyzed: shes bzhin du skye ba dang brten pa dag gis yang rgyu dran pa nyid yin no zhes brjod pa /
translated: It is said that mindfulness is the cause of both the arising and the abiding of vigilance.

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The line Whenever... and so forth.

original: gang gi tshe dran pa yid kyi sgo nas nyon mongs pa'i tshe ma rkun gyi tshogs 'jug pa phyir bzlog pa'i don du sgo ba ltar gnas par gyur pa na de'i tshe shes bzhin yang 'bad pa med par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dran pa yid kyi sgo nas nyon mongs pa'i tshe ma rkun gyi tshogs 'jug pa phyir bzlog pa'i don du sgo ba ltar gnas par gyur pa na de'i tshe shes bzhin yang 'bad pa med par 'byung ngo //
translated: Whenever mindfulness is at the gate of the mind, preventing the entry of the hordes of afflictions like a doorkeeper, then at that time vigilance also arises without effort.

original: byung ba yang brten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byung ba yang brten par 'gyur ro //
translated: And when it has arisen, it abides.

original: de ltar re zhig 'di dag gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gang gi yon tan dang skyon brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'di dag gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gang gi yon tan dang skyon brjod nas /
translated: Thus, having described the good qualities and faults of their presence and absence,

original: don med pa spang ba'i don du don med pa'i spyod pa spang ba re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: don med pa spang ba'i don du don med pa'i spyod pa spang ba re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to abandon meaningless activity, he says, “First of all, one should have a mind like this…”

original: dang po re zhig 'di 'dra'i sems //
analyzed: dang po re zhig 'di 'dra'i sems //
translated: “First of all, one should have a mind like this”

original: zhes bya ba nang du bsam par bya'o /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nang du bsam par bya'o /
translated: is to be contemplated inwardly.

original: rtag tu dus thams cad du 'di 'dra ba'i bstan pa'i rim pa dang ldan par nye bar gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: rtag tu dus thams cad du 'di 'dra ba'i bstan pa'i rim pa dang ldan par nye bar gnas par bya ste /
translated: “Always” means at all times. One should remain in possession of the stages of the teaching like this.

original: de las gzhan 'bras bu med pa'i spyod pa spang ba'i don du @94b dbang po'i tshogs dang bral bas gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'bras bu med pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad bsdus la bdag gis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan 'bras bu med pa'i spyod pa spang ba'i don du @94b dbang po'i tshogs dang bral bas gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'bras bu med pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad bsdus la bdag gis gnas par bya'o //
translated: In order to abandon activity that is other than that and is without result, one should gather all conceptual thoughts that apprehend objects such as form that are without result due to being devoid of a collection of sense faculties, and one should remain.

original: ci 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: shing bzhin du zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: shing bzhin du zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “like a tree.”

original: mig la sogs pa'i byed pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i byed pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is empty of the activity of the eyes, etc.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa /
translated: This is clarified:

original: 'bras med ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'bras med ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Without result” and so forth.

original: rdzi ma gnyis cung zad phye la /
analyzed: rdzi ma gnyis cung zad phye la /
translated: The two eyelids are slightly opened.

original: sna'i rtse mor gtad pa'am /
analyzed: sna'i rtse mor gtad pa'am /
translated: They are directed to the tip of the nose.

original: gnya' shing gang tsam du rnam par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gnya' shing gang tsam du rnam par blta bar bya ste /
translated: One should look around only as much as the length of a yoke.

original: dang po rtsom pa na'o //
analyzed: dang po rtsom pa na'o //
translated: When first starting out.

original: rtag tu goms par byed bzhin du ngal ba spang ba'i don du lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rtag tu goms par byed bzhin du ngal ba spang ba'i don du lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to avoid fatigue while always practicing, he says, “looking around,” etc.

original: lta ba dang sems skyo ba spang ba'i phyir res 'ga' ste bar skabs su phyogs su rnam par lta'o //
analyzed: lta ba dang sems skyo ba spang ba'i phyir res 'ga' ste bar skabs su phyogs su rnam par lta'o //
translated: In order to avoid looking and becoming weary, one should sometimes look around in the intervals.

original: ji ste brgya la 'ga' zhig de dang nye bar 'ongs na de'i tshe de'i 'ongs pa'i zhad tsam rig par byas la /
analyzed: ji ste brgya la 'ga' zhig de dang nye bar 'ongs na de'i tshe de'i 'ongs pa'i zhad tsam rig par byas la /
translated: But if perchance someone comes near, then one should just be aware of his presence.

original: legs par byon nam zhes smra bas phebs par smra ba'i don du rnam par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: legs par byon nam zhes smra bas phebs par smra ba'i don du rnam par blta bar bya'o //
translated: And in order to speak in response to his arrival, one should look in the direction of his arrival.

original: gzhan du na der de la 'phya bas mi dge ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na der de la 'phya bas mi dge ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, by sneering at him, nonvirtue would arise.

original: lam du 'gro zhing de ltar lta ba na yang gnod pa bsal ba'i don du /
analyzed: lam du 'gro zhing de ltar lta ba na yang gnod pa bsal ba'i don du /
translated: And when looking around while going on the road, in order to avoid harm,

original: lam sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lam sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “the road,” etc.

original: 'jigs pa'i rgyu rkun mo la sogs pa rig par bya ba'i don du rnam par blta bar bya ba'i rim pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i rgyu rkun mo la sogs pa rig par bya ba'i don du rnam par blta bar bya ba'i rim pa bzhin du'o //
translated: Like a frightened person looking around to see if there are thieves or other dangers, one should look around in order to be aware of what is going on.

original: gzhan du na lus bsrung bar byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na lus bsrung bar byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, one would not be protecting the body.

original: phyogs thams cad du rnam pa blta bar byed pa na rgod pa'i gnod pa spang bar bya ba'i don du bsdad de bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs thams cad du rnam pa blta bar byed pa na rgod pa'i gnod pa spang bar bya ba'i don du bsdad de bya'o //
translated: When looking in all directions, one should do so while standing, in order to avoid the harm of agitation.

original: rgyab tu rnam par lta ba na legs par log ste ba phyir bltas par 'gyur bas bya'o //
analyzed: rgyab tu rnam par lta ba na legs par log ste ba phyir bltas par 'gyur bas bya'o //
translated: When looking behind, one should do so while turning the whole body, not just the neck.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa bsrung bar bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa bsrung bar bya ba'i don du /
translated: In order to protect the meditative absorption,

original: mdun dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mdun dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the text] says “in front” and so forth.

original: 'gro ba ni mdun du'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni mdun du'o //
translated: “Going” is forward.

original: 'ong ba ni phyir la ste /
analyzed: 'ong ba ni phyir la ste /
translated: “Coming” is backward.

original: g-yang sa la sogs pa'i gnod pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: g-yang sa la sogs pa'i gnod pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should look out for dangers such as precipices.

original: de ltar bstan pa'i rim pa'i zur gyis rang dang gzhan la phan pa dang dgos pa khong du chud par byas na sgrub pa snying por gyur pa yin no /🔽// / bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i rim pa'i zur gyis rang dang gzhan la phan pa dang dgos pa khong du chud par byas na sgrub pa snying por gyur pa yin no /🔽// / bam po bdun pa /
translated: If one understands the purpose and the benefit for oneself and others by implication of the sequence of instructions, then one’s practice will become meaningful.

original: da ni shes bzhin gyi bya ba bslab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni shes bzhin gyi bya ba bslab pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the function of vigilance,

original: lus kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “With the body, etc.”

original: spyod lam bzhi'i nang nas spyod lam gang yang rung ba zhig la /
analyzed: spyod lam bzhi'i nang nas spyod lam gang yang rung ba zhig la /
translated: Among the four postures, in whatever posture one is,

original: lus kyis 'di ltar @95a * //
analyzed: lus kyis 'di ltar @95a * //
translated: “with the body” means

original: zhes bya ba ni 'greng bas sam 'dug pas gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'greng bas sam 'dug pas gnas par bya ste /
translated: that one should stand or sit in such a way that,

original: de ma thag tu kha ton la sogs pa'i bya ba'i las brtsams nas yang lus 'di ji ltar bur gnas pa yin zhes skabs su rnam par blta bar bya'o //🔽spyod lam de nyid la'am /
analyzed: de ma thag tu kha ton la sogs pa'i bya ba'i las brtsams nas yang lus 'di ji ltar bur gnas pa yin zhes skabs su rnam par blta bar bya'o // spyod lam de nyid la'am /
translated: immediately after beginning the activity of recitation, etc., one should from time to time look to see how the body is situated.🔽In that very posture,

original: de ste spyod lam logs shig la'o ;
analyzed: de ste spyod lam logs shig la'o ;
translated: or in a different posture,

original: / logs shig pa la yin na yang snga ma bzhin du legs par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: / logs shig pa la yin na yang snga ma bzhin du legs par gnas par bya'o //
translated: if it is a different posture, one should stand or sit as before.

original: lus la so sor rtog pa brjod nas sems la so sor rtog pa /
analyzed: lus la so sor rtog pa brjod nas sems la so sor rtog pa /
translated: Having described the investigation of the body, he describes the investigation of the mind:

original: sems kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “With the mind” means

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos la sems pa ni ka chen te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos la sems pa ni ka chen te /
translated: that one should reflect on the Dharma, which has the nature of benefiting oneself and others.

original: 'ching ba dag las thar bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ching ba dag las thar bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause for being freed from the bonds.

original: de la btags pa yang yang dang yang du brtag par bya ba yin pas /🔽ci nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la btags pa yang yang dang yang du brtag par bya ba yin pas / ci nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: And that which is imputed should be examined again and again.🔽Thus, he says, “I will direct my mind to the object of meditation. ”

original: yang bdag gis yid 'di gang na spyod ces dmigs pa snga ma'am /
analyzed: yang bdag gis yid 'di gang na spyod ces dmigs pa snga ma'am /
translated: “Where is this mind of mine wandering? ”

original: dmigs pa bzhin du brtags la /
analyzed: dmigs pa bzhin du brtags la /
translated: Having examined it as before,

original: song bar rtogs na de nas bzlog la de nyid du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: song bar rtogs na de nas bzlog la de nyid du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: if it is found to have wandered, then one should turn it back and apply it right there.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'bab na ni btang snyoms su bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'bab na ni btang snyoms su bya'o //
translated: If it flows along by itself, one should remain equanimous.

original: de ltar zhi gnas kyi khur skad cig gcig kyang ji ltar mi 'tshor ba de ltar gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhi gnas kyi khur skad cig gcig kyang ji ltar mi 'tshor ba de ltar gzung bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should hold the mind so that it does not slip away even for a moment under the burden of tranquility.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni tshul khrims ni ting nge 'dzin sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni tshul khrims ni ting nge 'dzin sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus far it has been shown that morality is the means to achieve concentration.

original: ji skad du zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las /
translated: As the Candrapradīpa Sūtra says,

original: nyon mongs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin myur thob ste //
analyzed: nyon mongs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin myur thob ste //
translated: “Quickly attaining the concentration of the absence of afflictions

original: de ni tshul khrims rnam dag phan yon no //
analyzed: de ni tshul khrims rnam dag phan yon no //
translated: is the benefit of pure morality. ”

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bas na ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyur gyur pa'i sbyor ba ji snyed pa gang ci yang rung /
analyzed: de bas na ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyur gyur pa'i sbyor ba ji snyed pa gang ci yang rung /
translated: Therefore, whatever the preparations that are causes of meditative concentration,

original: bza' ba de dag ni tshul khrims rjes su song ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bza' ba de dag ni tshul khrims rjes su song ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: all those foods should be known as being in accord with morality.

original: de lta bas na ting nge 'dzin don du gnyer bas dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi ngang tshul can du bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na ting nge 'dzin don du gnyer bas dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi ngang tshul can du bya'o //
translated: Thus, one who seeks meditative concentration should be one whose nature is mindfulness and introspection.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims don du gnyer bas bya ba ting nge 'dzin la nan tan du bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims don du gnyer bas bya ba ting nge 'dzin la nan tan du bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one who seeks morality should be one who is intent on the practice of meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su spong ba'i skabs na 'jigs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su spong ba'i skabs na 'jigs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In the context of abandoning meditative concentration, it is said: “fear, etc.”

original: 'jigs pa ni me'i sreg pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni me'i sreg pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Fear is burning by fire, and so on.

original: de bzhin du dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa la sogs pa ni dga' ston no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa la sogs pa ni dga' ston no //
translated: Similarly, worship of the Three Jewels, etc. is a festival.

original: de bas ches lhag pa'i sems can gyi don la sogs pa'ang rung ste /
analyzed: de bas ches lhag pa'i sems can gyi don la sogs pa'ang rung ste /
translated: Even more than that, the benefit of sentient beings, and so on, is also appropriate.

original: de dag byung ba na gal te gnas par mi nus na de'i tshe 'dod pa bzhin du sbyor @95b do zhes gnang ba ste /
analyzed: de dag byung ba na gal te gnas par mi nus na de'i tshe 'dod pa bzhin du sbyor @95b do zhes gnang ba ste /
translated: If, when they arise, one is unable to remain, then at that time one should apply oneself as one wishes.

original: ltung ba dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ltung ba dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one does not incur a downfall.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di nges pa med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di nges pa med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Again, why does this become indeterminate?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse states, “If, etc.”

original: gang yang tshul khrims ni sbyin pa bas mchog tu byung ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gang yang tshul khrims ni sbyin pa bas mchog tu byung ba yin mod kyi /
translated: Although morality is superior to generosity,

original: de lta na yang bslab pa gzhan slob pa'i de ma thag tu phyi nas bslab pa'i gnas la goms pa gsal ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang bslab pa gzhan slob pa'i de ma thag tu phyi nas bslab pa'i gnas la goms pa gsal ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: nevertheless, immediately after training in the other perfections, one does not have clear mastery of the points of training.

original: ji zhig ltar dus de srid du de las ldog par byed na'ang ltung ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: ji zhig ltar dus de srid du de las ldog par byed na'ang ltung ba med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if one turns away from them in some way for a while, there is no downfall.

original: 'di sbyin pa'i dus yin gyi tshul khrims kyi ni ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di sbyin pa'i dus yin gyi tshul khrims kyi ni ma yin pa ste /
translated: This is the time for generosity, not for morality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gal te mi nus zhes so //
analyzed: gal te mi nus zhes so //
translated: “If one is unable, etc.”

original: de dag tsam nyid kyi dpe brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag tsam nyid kyi dpe brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is just an illustration.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽“The wise one should practice generosity even with regard to morality.”

original: de la bslab pa gcig rdzogs par byed pa bslab pa phyi ma goms par ma byas pas mi nus pa la ltung ba med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de la bslab pa gcig rdzogs par byed pa bslab pa phyi ma goms par ma byas pas mi nus pa la ltung ba med do zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that there is no downfall for one who is unable to practice the later trainings without having become familiar with the earlier ones.

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And the noble Aksayamatinirdesa states:

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: And:

original: sbyin pa'i dus su tshul khrims nye bar bsdus te btang snyoms su bya'o zhes rgya tsher gsungs so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i dus su tshul khrims nye bar bsdus te btang snyoms su bya'o zhes rgya tsher gsungs so //
translated: At the time of generosity, one should gather morality and be patient.

original: de lta bas na lhod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na lhod par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should not be lax.

original: dge ba'i phyogs gang la spyod na yang ting nge 'dzin 'ga' zhig gi gegs su 'gyur ba de blang bar bya ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs gang la spyod na yang ting nge 'dzin 'ga' zhig gi gegs su 'gyur ba de blang bar bya ba ma yin pas /
translated: And when one is practicing any virtuous field, whatever is an obstacle to some meditative concentration should not be undertaken.

original: gang zhig bsams te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zhig bsams te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: rang nyid kyi rigs pa dang lung gis sam dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gsung gi cus pa ji lta ba bzhin du nges par bzung nas bsam gtan dang bsam pa la sogs pa las gang cung zad cig brtsams pa der yid gzhol bas dang por de nyid re
analyzed: rang nyid kyi rigs pa dang lung gis sam dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gsung gi cus pa ji lta ba bzhin du nges par bzung nas bsam gtan dang bsam pa la sogs pa las gang cung zad cig brtsams pa der yid gzhol bas dang por de nyid re
translated: Having ascertained it just as it is through one's own reasoning and scripture or through the words of a spiritual master, one should first of all apply one's mind to that very thing which one has undertaken, be it meditation, reflection, or whatever.

original: zhig bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: zhig bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: One should accomplish it.

original: de ma grub par du yongs su dor nas gzhan brtsam par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ma grub par du yongs su dor nas gzhan brtsam par ni mi bya'o //
translated: Until it is accomplished, one should not completely abandon it and undertake something else.

original: gal te de ltar ma gyur na ci nyes she na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar ma gyur na ci nyes she na /
translated: What is wrong if one does not do it that way?

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, In that case, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar nan tan byas pas thams cad legs par byas par 'gyur gyi de las bzlog pa ni sngar khas blangs pa dang phyis dam bcas pa gnyi gar ma 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar nan tan byas pas thams cad legs par byas par 'gyur gyi de las bzlog pa ni sngar khas blangs pa dang phyis dam bcas pa gnyi gar ma 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because one practices in that way, everything is well done. Otherwise, both the former promise and the subsequent vow are not connected.

original: 'jug pa mi brtan pa ni shes bzhin ma yin par rjes su 'jug pas 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa mi brtan pa ni shes bzhin ma yin par rjes su 'jug pas 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Lack of stability in engagement is increased by unreflective engagement.

original: de lta na'ang 'bras bu med pa spang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta na'ang 'bras bu med pa spang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Still, it is said that “the absence of results should be abandoned.”

original: bre mo'i gtam ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /🔽'brel pa med pa rnam pa du ma brjod pa dang gzhan @96a * //
analyzed: bre mo'i gtam ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te / 'brel pa med pa rnam pa du ma brjod pa dang gzhan @96a * //
translated: “Frivolous speech” and so on.

original: dag gis byas pa la 'jug pa ngo mtshar ba'i dngos po mtha' dag la'am rang gis kyang bya ba de la lta ba dang mnyan pa'i phyir ngag dang sems zhugs pa las bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: dag gis byas pa la 'jug pa ngo mtshar ba'i dngos po mtha' dag la'am rang gis kyang bya ba de la lta ba dang mnyan pa'i phyir ngag dang sems zhugs pa las bzlog par bya'o //
translated: One should turn away from speech and mind that are engaged in many kinds of irrelevant expressions and in the activities of others, or in all things that are amazing, or in the observation and listening to those activities by oneself.

original: gzhan yang 'bras bu med pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir so sor thar pa las bstan par bya ba spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'bras bu med pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir so sor thar pa las bstan par bya ba spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, in order to abandon the absence of results, one should practice the teachings of the pratimokṣa.

original: don med sa rko zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: don med sa rko zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: “Pointlessly digging the earth” and so on.

original: sa dang byang bu la sogs pa la sen mo dang / dbyugs pa la sogs pa'i ri mo 'dren cing 'bri ba la sogs pa dgos pa med pa byed pa ni ltung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: sa dang byang bu la sogs pa la sen mo dang / dbyugs pa la sogs pa'i ri mo 'dren cing 'bri ba la sogs pa dgos pa med pa byed pa ni ltung bar 'gyur bas /
translated: One should not create and draw meaningless designs on the earth, slate, and so on, with one’s fingernails, sticks, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di las bzlog par bya ba bka' bsgo ba dran par byas la rnam par spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di las bzlog par bya ba bka' bsgo ba dran par byas la rnam par spang bar bya ste /
translated: One should remember the Blessed One's injunction to turn away from this and abandon it.

original: de las 'dir ni 'bras bu rnam par smin pa 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las 'dir ni 'bras bu rnam par smin pa 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, it is because of the fear of the maturation of the result.

original: de'i mod la zhes bya ba ni dus de 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mod la zhes bya ba ni dus de 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: Immediately means that time should not be wasted.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa la shes bzhin du bya bar bslab pa ni gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa la shes bzhin du bya bar bslab pa ni gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis bstan pa yin te /
translated: The training in acting vigilantly with regard to the conduct of affliction is taught by seven verses beginning with When.

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dang por rang gi sems brtags nas gsungs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gnas skabs ltar bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dang por rang gi sems brtags nas gsungs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gnas skabs ltar bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: When and so on. First, having examined one's own mind, it is said. This teaches the conduct like the state of non-affliction.

original: de nyid ni chags pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan par byed de /
analyzed: de nyid ni chags pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan par byed de /
translated: That very [state] is taught by attachment and so on.

original: gang gi tshe rang gi sems chags pa'am sdang bar mthong ba de'i lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa bskyod pa tsam yang mi bya zhing dag gis kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang gi sems chags pa'am sdang bar mthong ba de'i lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa bskyod pa tsam yang mi bya zhing dag gis kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: When one sees that one's mind is attached or averse, one should not move one's hands or feet, etc. , nor should one speak.

original: gzhan du na des bslang pa'i lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na des bslang pa'i lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the bodily and vocal intimation aroused by that would be defiled.

original: de'i phyir dbang po phyi rol gyi byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsdus la de tshe shing bzhin du gnas par byas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po phyi rol gyi byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsdus la de tshe shing bzhin du gnas par byas te /
translated: Therefore, one should withdraw the conceptualization of external activity of the sense faculties, and remain as if one were a piece of wood.

original: byed pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad ni byed pa po med pa'o zhes yid la bzhag la shing bzhin du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad ni byed pa po med pa'o zhes yid la bzhag la shing bzhin du gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should attend to the thought, All things are without an agent, because they are devoid of all activity, and remain as if one were a piece of wood.

original: gzhan yang rgod dang zhes gsungs pa ni dam pa'i chos la sogs pa nyan pa la dad pa las kyang rgod pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgod dang zhes gsungs pa ni dam pa'i chos la sogs pa nyan pa la dad pa las kyang rgod pa ste /
translated: Moreover, agitation is said to be the distraction of the mind from faith in listening to the holy Dharma, etc.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba mang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba mang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means a great deal of distraction.

original: gzhar bcas pa ni ngag gi the 'tshams pa la brtson par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhar bcas pa ni ngag gi the 'tshams pa la brtson par byed pa ste /
translated: The etc. refers to the verbal forms of these.

original: de dag ldan pa'am nga rgyal ni sems khengs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ldan pa'am nga rgyal ni sems khengs pa'o //
translated: Pride is the inflation of the mind.

original: rgyags pa ni rnag gi chos la sems mngon par zhen pa @96b ste ;
analyzed: rgyags pa ni rnag gi chos la sems mngon par zhen pa @96b ste ;
translated: Arrogance is the mind's attachment to its own qualities.

original: de dag dang ldan pa ni de dag dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa ni de dag dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: One who is endowed with these is endowed with these.

original: mtshang 'bru ba ni lus kyi tho mtshams pa ste /
analyzed: mtshang 'bru ba ni lus kyi tho mtshams pa ste /
translated: Slander is the verbal form of the fault-finding.

original: de dang ldan pas rgod pa'o //🔽skyor 'byin ni gya gyur can nam g-yo can no //
analyzed: de dang ldan pas rgod pa'o // skyor 'byin ni gya gyur can nam g-yo can no //
translated: One who is endowed with this is one who is slanderous.🔽 Flattery is the crookedness or deceitfulness of the mind.

original: slu sems ni slu bar byed pa'am sgyu can te /
analyzed: slu sems ni slu bar byed pa'am sgyu can te /
translated: Deception is the mind's deceptiveness or dishonesty.🔽 When the mind is like this,

original: gang gi tshe yid de ltar gyur pa na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yid de ltar gyur pa na /
translated: then,

original: de tshe shing bzhin gnas par bya //🔽zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: de tshe shing bzhin gnas par bya // zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: one should stand like a tree trunk.

original: bdag la bstod pa ni rang gi yon tan shin tu yang ston pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la bstod pa ni rang gi yon tan shin tu yang ston pa'o //
translated: Self-praise is the display of one's own good qualities.

original: der snang ba ni de ru snang ba ste /
analyzed: der snang ba ni de ru snang ba ste /
translated: The appearance of these is the appearance of these.

original: der rnam par brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der rnam par brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the discrimination of these,

original: gzhan la smod pa ni gzhan tshar gcod pa'am nyes pa bsal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la smod pa ni gzhan tshar gcod pa'am nyes pa bsal bar byed pa ste /
translated: criticizing others means to defeat others or to point out their faults.

original: de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: One who has that is endowed with it.

original: gshe bcas ni gzhan gyi tshig la smod pa'o //
analyzed: gshe bcas ni gzhan gyi tshig la smod pa'o //
translated: Having reproach means to criticize the words of others.

original: 'gyed pa ni rtag tu 'thab pa dang rtsod pa'i rgyu mtshan la sems pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyed pa ni rtag tu 'thab pa dang rtsod pa'i rgyu mtshan la sems pa ste /
translated: Having quarrels means to always think about the reasons for fighting and arguing.

original: 'dir gnyi ga la de dang bcas par gnas pa zhes tshig bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gnyi ga la de dang bcas par gnas pa zhes tshig bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Here, both are included in the compound endowed with that.

original: de ltar gang gi tshe mthong ba na rang gi yid /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi tshe mthong ba na rang gi yid /
translated: Thus, when one sees that one's mind🔽is attached to these things,🔽one should apply the general teaching:

original: de tshe shing bzhin gnas par bya /🔽zhes spyir bstan pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de tshe shing bzhin gnas par bya / zhes spyir bstan pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: One should remain like a tree.

original: grags pa ni snyan pa'o //
analyzed: grags pa ni snyan pa'o //
translated: Fame means good reputation.

original: 'khor ni bran pho dang bran mo dang las byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ni bran pho dang bran mo dang las byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Attendants are male and female servants, workers, and so on.

original: rim gro ni rkang pa 'khru ba dang nyed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rim gro ni rkang pa 'khru ba dang nyed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Service is washing the feet, massaging, and so on.

original: 'di dag don du gnyer ba ni 'dod pa ste bdag gis sems de dag las zhing bzhin du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag don du gnyer ba ni 'dod pa ste bdag gis sems de dag las zhing bzhin du gnas par bya'o //
translated: One who pursues these is desirous. One should remain like a field for those minds.

original: gzhan don yal bar 'dor ba ni gzhan gyi don la phyir phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan don yal bar 'dor ba ni gzhan gyi don la phyir phyogs pa'o //
translated: Abandoning the welfare of others is turning away from the welfare of others.

original: rang don gnyer ba ni rang gi don la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: rang don gnyer ba ni rang gi don la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Striving for one's own welfare is attachment to one's own welfare.

original: g-yog 'khor ni slob ma dang nye gnas la sogs pa 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: g-yog 'khor ni slob ma dang nye gnas la sogs pa 'dus pa ste /
translated: A retinue is a group of disciples, attendants, and so on.

original: 'di dag mngon par 'dod cing 'khor de dag don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag mngon par 'dod cing 'khor de dag don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: These are desired and sought after by that retinue.

original: mi bzod pa ni bzod pa med pa'i ngang tshul lo //
analyzed: mi bzod pa ni bzod pa med pa'i ngang tshul lo //
translated: Lack of patience is the attitude of not being patient.

original: le lo ni bya ba la las su mi rung ba yin te snyom las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: le lo ni bya ba la las su mi rung ba yin te snyom las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Laziness is unserviceability with regard to activities; it means indolence.

original: 'jigs pa ni lus dang 'tsho ba'i 'jigs pa'am 'jigs pa'i rgyu las so //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni lus dang 'tsho ba'i 'jigs pa'am 'jigs pa'i rgyu las so //
translated: Fear is fear of harm to one's body or livelihood, or the cause of fear.

original: spyi brtol ni spyis brtson pa'o //
analyzed: spyi brtol ni spyis brtson pa'o //
translated: Arrogance is being puffed up.

original: mur cor smra ba ni tshig ngan pa can nam rigs pa dang mi rigs pa la ltos pa med par rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mur cor smra ba ni tshig ngan pa can nam rigs pa dang mi rigs pa la ltos pa med par rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: Boastfulness is speaking badly or speaking without regard for what is reasonable or unreasonable.

original: rang gi phyogs ni slob ma dang nye gnas dang gnyen dang pha la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs ni slob ma dang nye gnas dang gnyen dang pha la sogs pa'o //
translated: One's own faction is disciples, attendants, relatives, parents, and so on.

original: zhen pa ni shin tu phyogs su ltung ba dang ltan pa'i //
analyzed: zhen pa ni shin tu phyogs su ltung ba dang ltan pa'i //
translated: Attachment is the companion of extreme partiality.

original: da ni phyir bcos pa'i phyogs tsam gsungs pa /🔽de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste bstan pa'i @97a * //
analyzed: da ni phyir bcos pa'i phyogs tsam gsungs pa / de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste bstan pa'i @97a * //
translated: Now, just the side of the remedy is stated:🔽Thus, etc.

original: rim pas so //
analyzed: rim pas so //
translated: By the order of the teaching.

original: kun nas nyon mongs te kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs te kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Afflicted, with affliction and endowed with affliction.

original: rang gi sems 'bras bu med pa'i byed pa dang ldan pa shes par byas nas 'jug pa thams cad bkag la nus pa mthu chung bar byas nas tshar gcad par bya zhing zil gyis mnan par bya'o ;
analyzed: rang gi sems 'bras bu med pa'i byed pa dang ldan pa shes par byas nas 'jug pa thams cad bkag la nus pa mthu chung bar byas nas tshar gcad par bya zhing zil gyis mnan par bya'o ;
translated: Having understood one's own mind to be endowed with fruitless activity, one should stop all engagement, and having made one's ability weak, one should be victorious and should be overwhelming.

original: / bstan pa ni ji nas slar yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: / bstan pa ni ji nas slar yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
translated: The teaching is such that it is not the case that one will again engage.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dgra'i g-yul las rnam par rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir ga dar byas pa'i dpa' bo ste byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dgra'i g-yul las rnam par rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir ga dar byas pa'i dpa' bo ste byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The hero who is armored for the sake of being victorious in the battle with the enemy of the afflictions is the bodhisattva.

original: gnyen po yis ni gang zhig gang du gnyen por bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen po yis ni gang zhig gang du gnyen por bstan pa ste /
translated: By the antidote, that which is taught as the antidote to whatever.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags pa la sogs pa'i mi sdug pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags pa la sogs pa'i mi sdug pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the unattractive is for those who are desirous.

original: des de las bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des de las bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should turn away from that.

original: rtag tu ni dus thams cad du ste gang dang gang gi tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa rtogs pa na'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ni dus thams cad du ste gang dang gang gi tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa rtogs pa na'o //
translated: Always means at all times, whenever there is an understanding of the afflictions.

original: drag shul can gyis zhus pa las /
analyzed: drag shul can gyis zhus pa las /
translated: The Inquiry of Ugra

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
translated: speaks for the householder bodhisattva:

original: des 'bru'i chang dang sbyar ba'i chang bag med pa'i gnas spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: des 'bru'i chang dang sbyar ba'i chang bag med pa'i gnas spang bar bya ste /
translated: He should avoid the occasion of heedlessness, which is the drinking of alcohol and fermented liquor.

original: de ra ro ba med pa dang / myos pa med pa dang / 'khrul pa med pa dang / tshig ma 'chal ba dang / mi 'char ba dang / mi khengs pa dang / mi rgod pa dang / mi g-yeng ba dang / dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang /
analyzed: de ra ro ba med pa dang / myos pa med pa dang / 'khrul pa med pa dang / tshig ma 'chal ba dang / mi 'char ba dang / mi khengs pa dang / mi rgod pa dang / mi g-yeng ba dang / dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang /
translated: He should be without intoxication, without confusion, without loose speech, without agitation, without conceit, without excitement, without distraction, with mindfulness present,

original: shes bzhin dang ldan par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: shes bzhin dang ldan par bya'o zhes so //
translated: and with introspection.

original: de nyid las rab tu byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid las rab tu byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
translated: The same text, speaking for the renunciant bodhisattva, says:

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin ni mi g-yeng ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin ni mi g-yeng ba'o zhes so //
translated: Mindfulness and vigilance are non-distraction.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdo las bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdo las bstan te /
translated: Thus it is taught in the Noble Sūtra of the Secrets of the Tathagata:

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' ngag ni tshigs pa'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' ngag ni tshigs pa'am /
translated: “Son of noble family, the bodhisattva does not utter words that are harsh,

original: sdang ba'am / nyon mongs pa can nam /
analyzed: sdang ba'am / nyon mongs pa can nam /
translated: angry, or afflicted,

original: skad cig gsal bar byas pa'am /
analyzed: skad cig gsal bar byas pa'am /
translated: words that are unclear,

original: rang gi phyogs bstod pa'i tshig gam gzhan gyi phyogs tshar bcad pa'i tshig gam /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs bstod pa'i tshig gam gzhan gyi phyogs tshar bcad pa'i tshig gam /
translated: words that praise one’s own position or disparage the positions of others,

original: bdag la bstod pa la rjes su chags pa'i tshig gam /
analyzed: bdag la bstod pa la rjes su chags pa'i tshig gam /
translated: words that are attached to one’s own praise,

original: gzhan gyis bstod pa la gnod pa'i tshig gam /🔽kha 'og tu lus 'khrus par mi byed pa'i tshig gam /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstod pa la gnod pa'i tshig gam / kha 'og tu lus 'khrus par mi byed pa'i tshig gam /
translated: words that are hostile to the praise of others,🔽words that do not purify one’s own mind,

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis lung ston pa'i tshig mi 'byin zhes so //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis lung ston pa'i tshig mi 'byin zhes so //
translated: or words that are given with a sense of pride.”

original: de ltar 'bras bu med pa'i spyod pa spangs pas /
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu med pa'i spyod pa spangs pas /
translated: Thus, by abandoning conduct that is fruitless,

original: don med pa spang pa'i phyir lus bsrung ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don med pa spang pa'i phyir lus bsrung ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: the protection of the body is taught in order to abandon what is meaningless.

original: @97b de lta bas na bdag gis tshul khrims la legs par gnas pa dang / mi bskyod pa dang / mi lhod par gyur par bya'o //
analyzed: @97b de lta bas na bdag gis tshul khrims la legs par gnas pa dang / mi bskyod pa dang / mi lhod par gyur par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I will abide well in morality, without wavering and without laxity.

original: de dag kyang sems mnyam par gzhag pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang sems mnyam par gzhag pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that is accomplished by one whose mind is in meditative equipoise.

original: de'i phyir zhi gnas kyi bdag nyid chen po 'di rtogs nas de lhur blangs te bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhi gnas kyi bdag nyid chen po 'di rtogs nas de lhur blangs te bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, having understood the greatness of śamatha, one should cultivate it with effort.

original: 'dis ni bslab pa rnams la gus pa drag por 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni bslab pa rnams la gus pa drag por 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: By this, one will have intense respect for the trainings.

original: des kyang dran pa nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: des kyang dran pa nye bar gnas te /
translated: And by that, mindfulness is present.

original: dran pa nye bar gnas pas 'bras bu med pa spong zhing de la don med pa phyir 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gnas pas 'bras bu med pa spong zhing de la don med pa phyir 'byung ngo //
translated: By the presence of mindfulness, one abandons the fruitless and the useless arises.

original: de lta bas ni lus bsrung bar 'dod pas rtsa ba dran pa btsal te dran pa nye bar gnas par rtag tu gyur par bya'o ;🔽/ de nyid ni /
analyzed: de lta bas ni lus bsrung bar 'dod pas rtsa ba dran pa btsal te dran pa nye bar gnas par rtag tu gyur par bya'o ; / de nyid ni /
translated: Therefore, one who wishes to protect the body should seek the root, mindfulness, and always be one in whom mindfulness is present.

original: de la lus bsrung gang yin na //
analyzed: de la lus bsrung gang yin na //
translated: What is the protection of the body?

original: gang zhig don med spang ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig don med spang ba'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of the useless.

original: de kun gang gis 'thob ce na //
analyzed: de kun gang gis 'thob ce na //
translated: By what is that obtained?

original: 'bras bu med pa'i spyod spangs las //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i spyod spangs las //
translated: Abandoning action that is fruitless,

original: de yang rtag tu dran pas 'grub //
analyzed: de yang rtag tu dran pas 'grub //
translated: that is accomplished by constant mindfulness.

original: dran pa shin tu gus las 'byung //
analyzed: dran pa shin tu gus las 'byung //
translated: Mindfulness arises from great respect,

original: gus ni zhi ba che bdag nyid //
analyzed: gus ni zhi ba che bdag nyid //
translated: and respect is the nature of great peace.

original: shes par gyur nas brtun pa skye //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes par gyur nas brtun pa skye // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Having understood, one generates perseverance.

original: zhi gnas kyi che ba'i bdag nyid kyang skabs ji lta ba bzhin du 'di las 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi che ba'i bdag nyid kyang skabs ji lta ba bzhin du 'di las 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The greatness of śamatha will be explained in this text according to the context.

original: 'dir don med pa spang ba'i don du bsdus pa'i don 'di khong du chud par bya'o zhes tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bstan pa /
analyzed: 'dir don med pa spang ba'i don du bsdus pa'i don 'di khong du chud par bya'o zhes tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bstan pa /
translated: Here, in order to eliminate the meaningless, this summary meaning should be understood. This is shown by three verses.🔽Very certain, very pure,🔽very firm, very respectful,🔽very humble, very persevering,

original: shin tu nges dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shin tu nges dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: very much delight and satisfaction.

original: shin tu nges pa ni the tshom dang phyin ci log spangs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu nges pa ni the tshom dang phyin ci log spangs pa'o //
translated: Very certain means abandoning doubt and error.

original: rab dang ni rtag tu dga' ba dang yid bde ba mang ba'o //
analyzed: rab dang ni rtag tu dga' ba dang yid bde ba mang ba'o //
translated: Very pure means always having much delight and satisfaction.

original: brtan pa ni ma brtags pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni ma brtags pa'o //
translated: Very firm means not being unreflective.

original: gus pa ni bshad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gus pa ni bshad pa nyid yin no //
translated: Very respectful means as explained.

original: zhe sa ni mnyes par bya ba rnams la sems 'dud pa ste /
analyzed: zhe sa ni mnyes par bya ba rnams la sems 'dud pa ste /
translated: Very humble means the mind bowing to those who are to be pleased.

original: de dag dang lhan cig 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig 'jug pa'o //
translated: and they are engaged in the same activities.

original: ngo mtshar bcas ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ngo mtshar bcas ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: They are “astonished” as above.

original: 'jigs bcas ni 'khrul pa byung bas 'jig rten la 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs bcas ni 'khrul pa byung bas 'jig rten la 'jigs pa'o //
translated: They are “frightened” because they are afraid of the world when they make mistakes.

original: zhi ba ni dbang po yang dag par sdom pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni dbang po yang dag par sdom pa'o //
translated: They are “calm” because they control their senses.

original: sems can mgu bar byed pa la brtson pa dang ldan pa dang / skye bo gcig gi 'dod pa gang yin pa de gzhan la bzlog pa yin pas so so'i skye bo'i 'dod pa phan tshun mi mthun pa rnams kyis mi skyob ste yid la gcags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can mgu bar byed pa la brtson pa dang ldan pa dang / skye bo gcig gi 'dod pa gang yin pa de gzhan la bzlog pa yin pas so so'i skye bo'i 'dod pa phan tshun mi mthun pa rnams kyis mi skyob ste yid la gcags pa med pa'o //
translated: They are “not discouraged” because they are intent on pleasing sentient beings and they are not discouraged by the mutual hostility of the desires of ordinary people, since what one person desires another person rejects.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽brtser ldan te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / brtser ldan te /
translated: How so?🔽“They are compassionate.”

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi tshig yin no //
translated: This is the reason.

original: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa skyes pas te rang dbang med pas so//
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa skyes pas te rang dbang med pas so//
translated: Because they are not independent, since the afflictions arise.

original: @98a * // 'di zhes pa ni de dag ste byis pa 'di dag gi phan tshun mi mthun pa'i spyod pa'o snyam du shes par byas nas so //
analyzed: @98a * // 'di zhes pa ni de dag ste byis pa 'di dag gi phan tshun mi mthun pa'i spyod pa'o snyam du shes par byas nas so //
translated: “These” refers to the mutual hostility of the conduct of these foolish people.

original: bdag dang sems can dbang byas shing ni rang dang gzhan la rag las par te dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can dbang byas shing ni rang dang gzhan la rag las par te dus thams cad du'o //
translated: One should be controlled by oneself and by sentient beings, and should be dependent on oneself and on others, at all times.

original: ci thams cad du'am zhe na ma yin te /🔽kha na ma tho med dngos la ste /
analyzed: ci thams cad du'am zhe na ma yin te / kha na ma tho med dngos la ste /
translated: Is it always so? No, it is not.🔽In things that are not blameworthy,

original: kha na ma tho ba gnyi gas stong pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba gnyi gas stong pa rnams la'o //
translated: in things that are empty of both kinds of faults.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: sprul pa bzhin du ste sprul pa byas pa ltar nga rgyal dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: sprul pa bzhin du ste sprul pa byas pa ltar nga rgyal dang bral ba ste /
translated: Like an emanation, like a magical creation.

original: nga rgyal legs par gzung bar bya ste bdag 'di lta bu yin no snyam du byang chub sems dpa' yid la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal legs par gzung bar bya ste bdag 'di lta bu yin no snyam du byang chub sems dpa' yid la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should be free of pride, and one should be mindful of pride, thinking, “I am like that, I am a Bodhisattva.”

original: skye ba yid la byed pa 'di las kyang sems kyi don med pa spangs pas bsrung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: skye ba yid la byed pa 'di las kyang sems kyi don med pa spangs pas bsrung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: From this attention to birth, one should guard against the uselessness of mind.

original: ring zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ring zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: This is stated in the verse beginning with “for a long time.”

original: dus shin tu mang ba zhig gis thob pa'i dal ba mchog bstan pa dran pa'i sems kyis yang dang yang du bar med par byas shing brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: dus shin tu mang ba zhig gis thob pa'i dal ba mchog bstan pa dran pa'i sems kyis yang dang yang du bar med par byas shing brtan par bya'o //
translated: One should repeatedly and uninterruptedly make firm the recollection of the supreme opportunity that is obtained in this way.

original: de lta bur ni brtan pa'i rang bzhin can du'o //
analyzed: de lta bur ni brtan pa'i rang bzhin can du'o //
translated: In this way, one should be firm in nature.

original: rab tu mi g-yo ni 'dod pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i rlung rnams kyis ri'i rgyal po ltar bskyod par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu mi g-yo ni 'dod pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i rlung rnams kyis ri'i rgyal po ltar bskyod par mi nus pa'o //
translated: One should be unmoving, not to be shaken by the winds of discursive thought such as desire, like the king of mountains.

original: de ltar tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin phan tshun 'phel bar byed pa de dag gis sems kyi las yongs su bsgrub pa yin no ;
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin phan tshun 'phel bar byed pa de dag gis sems kyi las yongs su bsgrub pa yin no ;
translated: In this way, by the mutual increase of morality and meditative concentration, the mental activity is accomplished.🔽Therefore, the training of the bodhisattva is the purification of the mind.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa ni sems yongs su sbyang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba de dag gnas so //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa ni sems yongs su sbyang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba de dag gnas so //
translated: Thus, it is established.

original: des na gang /
analyzed: des na gang /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sems bsrung brtul zhugs ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: sems bsrung brtul zhugs ma gtogs pa //
translated: Except for the discipline of guarding the mind,

original: brtul zhugs mang pos ci zhig bya //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: brtul zhugs mang pos ci zhig bya // zhes gsungs te /
translated: what is the use of many disciplines?

original: de gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is established.

original: yang de nyid gcig tu nges par legs par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir lus la so sor brtags pa /
analyzed: yang de nyid gcig tu nges par legs par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir lus la so sor brtags pa /
translated: Moreover, in order to thoroughly grasp that reality as being one and only, he says:

original: bya rgod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bya rgod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The body is like a bird, etc.

original: lus la ni rnam pa thams cad du gang yang byed pa med de /
analyzed: lus la ni rnam pa thams cad du gang yang byed pa med de /
translated: The body is not an agent in any way,

original: bdag rang nyid la'ang nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag rang nyid la'ang nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not capable of acting on its own.

original: gzhan du sems dang bral ba'i lus bya rgod la sogs pa rnams kyis phan tshun kun tu drangs shing glongs kyang bdag nyid bsrung ba'i don du slar bcos pa ci ste mi byed ces 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du sems dang bral ba'i lus bya rgod la sogs pa rnams kyis phan tshun kun tu drangs shing glongs kyang bdag nyid bsrung ba'i don du slar bcos pa ci ste mi byed ces 'dri ba'o //
translated: Otherwise, why would the body, which is devoid of mind, not be restored by vultures, etc., when they pull it apart, since it is for the sake of its protection?

original: nus pa thams cad med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nus pa thams cad med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is devoid of all capacity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ni sems yongs su sbyang ba nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ni sems yongs su sbyang ba nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mind alone is to be purified, since it is the basis of purification.

original: de yongs su sbyangs nas 'bad pa med @98b par lus yongs su sbyangs pa 'grub ste de ni de la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yongs su sbyangs nas 'bad pa med @98b par lus yongs su sbyangs pa 'grub ste de ni de la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it is purified, the purification of the body is accomplished without effort, because it is dependent on that.

original: zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be demonstrated.

original: de ltar rnam pa thams cad du mkho ba ma yin pa'i lus la ltos pa dang bcas pa dgag pa /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa thams cad du mkho ba ma yin pa'i lus la ltos pa dang bcas pa dgag pa /
translated: The body is not to be protected.

original: lus 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The body is not to be protected.🔽The body is not to be protected.🔽The body is not to be protected.🔽The body is not to be protected.🔽The body is not to be protected.

original: kye yid bdag nyid ma yin pa la bdag nyid du khas blangs nas sha dang rus pa'i tshogs lus kyi ming can la ci'i phyir na khyod srung bar byed /🔽ci ste de ltar mi bya zhe na /🔽gal te khyod dang lus 'di tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: kye yid bdag nyid ma yin pa la bdag nyid du khas blangs nas sha dang rus pa'i tshogs lus kyi ming can la ci'i phyir na khyod srung bar byed / ci ste de ltar mi bya zhe na / gal te khyod dang lus 'di tha dad pa yin na /
translated: The body is not to be protected.🔽The body is not to be protected.🔽The body is not to be protected.🔽The body is not to be protected.

original: de ste 'di god pas khyod la ci zhig god par 'gyur /🔽sngar nas yun ring por bdag gir byas pas so zhe na /
analyzed: de ste 'di god pas khyod la ci zhig god par 'gyur / sngar nas yun ring por bdag gir byas pas so zhe na /
translated: The body is not to be protected.

original: de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi /

original: 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes /
analyzed: 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes /

analyzed: de'i tshe na yang 'ga' yang slar 'chos par mi 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //

original: de ltar gyur pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa yin mod kyi /

analyzed: zas dang bgo ba la sogs pa tsam gyis bskyang bar bya'o snyam na /

original: 'dir / bran g-yog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir / bran g-yog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: gal te bran g-yog la sogs pa bkol bar bya ba yin du zin na /

analyzed: de lta mod kyi /

analyzed: de la 'khor du mi btub pa'i rang bzhin mdzangs pas shes par byed nas 'jug par byed do //

original: de bzhin du skabs su bab par yang de'i chos can yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin du skabs su bab par yang de'i chos can yin na /

analyzed: 'on ci de la rnam pa thams cad du skabs mi dbye 'am zhe na /

original: ma yin te /

analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: gla rngan ni las kyi rin no //
analyzed: gla rngan ni las kyi rin no //

analyzed: de snying tsam lus 'gro ba'i tshul can 'di la byin la ste /

original: las la mkho bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las la mkho bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to make it useful for work.

original: kye yid rang gi dgos bsgrubs shig /
analyzed: kye yid rang gi dgos bsgrubs shig /

analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di la nyid kyis bsags pa ci'i phyir 'di la sbyin par mi bya zhe na /

analyzed: gang gi phyir gang cung zad byed pas sgrub pa las byed pa de la sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i rigs pa ni yod pa ma yin te /

original: de bas na 'jug pa dang zlog pa'i rgyur lus la gru'i blor ba zhog nas nye bar rton pa tsam byin nas /
analyzed: de bas na 'jug pa dang zlog pa'i rgyur lus la gru'i blor ba zhog nas nye bar rton pa tsam byin nas /
translated: Therefore, having set the mind on the body as a boat for the cause of engaging and turning back, one should just give the loan.

analyzed: sems can gyi don bsgrub cing rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa la rag las pa'i lus su gyur cig pa ste /

original: kye yid ces skabs yin par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: kye yid ces skabs yin par sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar lus so sor brtags nas de'i rang bzhin mkho ba yang dpyad de / lus kyi dgos pa @99b nges pa'i nye bar bsdu ba ni /

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The definite conclusion of the purpose of the body is stated by thus... and so on.

original: bstan pa'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i tshul du'o //
