original: bdag gi sems dang lus kyi mtshan nyid rag las par gyis te'o //
analyzed: bdag gi sems dang lus kyi mtshan nyid rag las par gyis te'o //
translated: Make the mind and body dependent on the characteristics of self.

original: dus thams cad du dang ba'i bzhin du gyis shig pa ste /
analyzed: dus thams cad du dang ba'i bzhin du gyis shig pa ste /
translated: Have a face full of faith at all times.

original: smin ma dpral bar bsdus la gnyer ba ste /
analyzed: smin ma dpral bar bsdus la gnyer ba ste /
translated: The eyebrows are drawn together, and the forehead is wrinkled.

original: dang ba nyams par byas pa thang zhig pa'o //
analyzed: dang ba nyams par byas pa thang zhig pa'o //
translated: The face is drawn, having lost its luster.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyis sngar ma bskul ba nyid du legs par 'ongs sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag gis phebs par smra ba'i ngang tshul dang / rgyu med par sems can thams cad kyi gnyen du gyur par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyis sngar ma bskul ba nyid du legs par 'ongs sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag gis phebs par smra ba'i ngang tshul dang / rgyu med par sems can thams cad kyi gnyen du gyur par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Similarly, without being prompted by others, one should have the disposition of speaking pleasantly, with such words as, “Welcome!” and so on, and one should be a friend to all sentient beings, without ulterior motive.

original: de ltar yang don med pa spangs pa'i phyir bslab pa'i bya ba /
analyzed: de ltar yang don med pa spangs pa'i phyir bslab pa'i bya ba /
translated: Thus, in order to avoid uselessness, the activity of training is

original: khri la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: khri la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: stated in the verse beginning with “on a seat, etc.”

original: bab col du rtab rtab bor dgos pa med par lag pa dang dbyug pa la sogs pas sgo glegs kyang brdung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bab col du rtab rtab bor dgos pa med par lag pa dang dbyug pa la sogs pas sgo glegs kyang brdung bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not, without reason, suddenly and hastily strike the door with one’s hand, a stick, and so on.

original: mdor na rtag tu sgra med par bcom bskyud ba la mngon par dga' bar gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: mdor na rtag tu sgra med par bcom bskyud ba la mngon par dga' bar gyur bar bya'o //
translated: In brief, one should always delight in being silent and forgiving.

original: de lar byas pa la yon tan ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de lar byas pa la yon tan ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the good of doing that?

original: chu skyar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chu skyar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse says “the heron,” etc.

original: de dag thams cad kyis bcom bskyungs shing sgra med pa dang mi rgod par gnas pas brjod par 'dod pa'i don 'thob pa de bzhin du brtul zhugs can gyis kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi tsher ma spangs la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis bcom bskyungs shing sgra med pa dang mi rgod par gnas pas brjod par 'dod pa'i don 'thob pa de bzhin du brtul zhugs can gyis kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi tsher ma spangs la gnas par bya'o //
translated: Just as all of them, being subdued and silent, live without agitation, and thus attain the goal of what is to be expressed, in the same way, the one who is disciplined should also abandon the thorns of meditative concentration and live.

original: 'di ltar bslab par bya'o //🔽gzhen la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽mdor na 'gyod pa sel ba dang / gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa la gus pa can 'dul ba la sogs pa mkhas pa gsol ba ma btab par phan par 'dod cing phan 'dogs ba'i tshig ni spyi bos blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bslab par bya'o // gzhen la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / mdor na 'gyod pa sel ba dang / gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa la gus pa can 'dul ba la sogs pa mkhas pa gsol ba ma btab par phan par 'dod cing phan 'dogs ba'i tshig ni spyi bos blang bar bya ste /
translated: One should train in this way.

original: de dag la sems sun dbyung bar mi gya ste byad du gsad par yang mi bya'o snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: de dag la sems sun dbyung bar mi gya ste byad du gsad par yang mi bya'o snyam du dgongs so //
translated: It is said, In brief, one who is respectful toward the removal of regret, the instruction, and the teaching, who is skilled in the Vinaya, and so on, whose beneficial words are unsolicited, and who desires to benefit and help, one should accept with one's head, thinking, I will not displease them, nor will I deceive them.

original: sems can thams cad la bla mar gus pa'i glos legs par dpyad par bya'o snyam pas thams cad la thams cad bslab bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bla mar gus pa'i glos legs par dpyad par bya'o snyam pas thams cad la thams cad bslab bar bya'o //
translated: One should think, I will examine well with the light of respect for all sentient beings, thinking, 'I will train in everything toward all.'

original: phrag dog gi dri ma rab tu bkru ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phrag dog gi dri ma rab tu bkru ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to thoroughly wash away the stain of envy,

original: legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa la /🔽gzhan dag la yon tan dang ldan par brjod pa la de mgu bar bya ba'i phyir legs so legs so 'di ni bzang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra lhag pa'i bsam @100a * //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa la / gzhan dag la yon tan dang ldan par brjod pa la de mgu bar bya ba'i phyir legs so legs so 'di ni bzang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra lhag pa'i bsam @100a * //
translated: he says, “Well-spoken,”

original: pas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pas brjod par bya'o //
translated: and in order to please them, he should say, “Excellent, excellent! This is good!” with an elevated thought.

original: dge ba'i las byed pa dag mthong na yang legs par byas so //
analyzed: dge ba'i las byed pa dag mthong na yang legs par byas so //
translated: And when he sees virtuous actions being done, he should encourage them with praise, saying, “Well done!

original: skal pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: skal pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: You are fortunate!

original: legs par bya ba'i las byed pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bstod pa brjod pa rnams kyis spro ba bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: legs par bya ba'i las byed pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bstod pa brjod pa rnams kyis spro ba bskyed par bya'o //
translated: You are doing good actions!” and so forth.

original: kha gsag tu dgos pa bzlog pa'i don du /
analyzed: kha gsag tu dgos pa bzlog pa'i don du /
translated: In order to avoid the need for flattery,

original: lkog na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lkog na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “In private,” and so forth.

original: gzhan la yon tan yod par gyur ba yin na'ang lkog tu brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan la yon tan yod par gyur ba yin na'ang lkog tu brjod par bya ste /
translated: Even if others have good qualities, he should speak of them in private,

original: mngon sum du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum du ni ma yin no //
translated: not in public.

original: gzhan du na kha cig kha gsag yin snyam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na kha cig kha gsag yin snyam par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, some might think he is flattering them.

original: gzhan gyis de'i mngon sum du gzhan gyi yon tan smra bar byed pa na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis de'i mngon sum du gzhan gyi yon tan smra bar byed pa na /
translated: When others speak of the good qualities of others in his presence,

original: de dang mthun par smra bar byed pas de'i mngon sum du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang mthun par smra bar byed pas de'i mngon sum du brjod par bya'o //
translated: he should speak in agreement, so that they will speak in his presence.

original: gzhan du na 'di de lam dga'o snyam nas pha rol rang gi sems sun 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'di de lam dga'o snyam nas pha rol rang gi sems sun 'byin par byed do //
translated: Otherwise, thinking, “He is not pleased with that,” he will displease others with his own mind.🔽When some, falling into the side of good qualities, speak of his good qualities in his presence and behind his back, he should turn away his mental inflation and think,

original: rang gi yon tan la yon tan gyi phyogs su lhung bas dang ba 'ga' zhig gis mngon sum dang lkog tu grags par byed pa na sems kyi khengs pa bzlog cing yon tan rjod par byed pa de la yon tan la rjes su chags pa yin par yid
analyzed: rang gi yon tan la yon tan gyi phyogs su lhung bas dang ba 'ga' zhig gis mngon sum dang lkog tu grags par byed pa na sems kyi khengs pa bzlog cing yon tan rjod par byed pa de la yon tan la rjes su chags pa yin par yid
translated: “I am pleased with the one who speaks of good qualities.”

original: la bya'o // gzhan gyi yon tan la mi bzod pa spang ba gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: la bya'o // gzhan gyi yon tan la mi bzod pa spang ba gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Abandoning intolerance of others’ good qualities.🔽He should be pleased with the good qualities of all sentient beings, whether inferior, middling, or superior.

original: sems can tha ma dang 'bring dang phul du byung ba thams cad kyi'am /
analyzed: sems can tha ma dang 'bring dang phul du byung ba thams cad kyi'am /

original: yang na brtson pa'o //🔽sdug bsngal yongs su spong bas dga' phyir te /
analyzed: yang na brtson pa'o //🔽sdug bsngal yongs su spong bas dga' phyir te /
translated: Or else, he should be pleased with the good qualities of all

original: yongs su ngal ba'i rtsom pa thams cad kyis ni dga' ba nyid bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: yongs su ngal ba'i rtsom pa thams cad kyis ni dga' ba nyid bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that one should generate joy through all the undertakings of complete exertion.

original: dga' ba de yang nor btang bas kyang rnyed par dka' ste rnyed par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba de yang nor btang bas kyang rnyed par dka' ste rnyed par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: And that joy is also difficult to obtain through the giving of wealth, and it is not obtained.

original: 'dir ni 'bad pa med par grub cing nye bar gnas pa yin na ci'i phyir 'dor bar byed snyam du shes par byas la dga' ba'i bde ba la longs spyad par bya ste nyams su myong bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'bad pa med par grub cing nye bar gnas pa yin na ci'i phyir 'dor bar byed snyam du shes par byas la dga' ba'i bde ba la longs spyad par bya ste nyams su myong bar bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand that if it is accomplished without effort and remains nearby, why should one cast it aside? One should enjoy the happiness of joy, one should experience it.

original: ci ste gzhan gyis 'bad pas bsgrubs pa'i yon tan rnams kyis bskyed pa la ma yin na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan gyis 'bad pas bsgrubs pa'i yon tan rnams kyis bskyed pa la ma yin na /
translated: But if it is not generated by the qualities accomplished through the effort of others,🔽then it is not right to protect the qualities of a beloved son.

original: bu sdug pa'i yon tan srung ba ni mi rigs so snyam du bsgoms la gzhan gyi yon tan thos pa las sems rtsub par 'gyur ba spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bu sdug pa'i yon tan srung ba ni mi rigs so snyam du bsgoms la gzhan gyi yon tan thos pa las sems rtsub par 'gyur ba spang bar bya'o //
translated: Having cultivated this, one should abandon the coarseness of mind that comes from hearing the qualities of others.

original: 'di la sogs pa yin pas bdag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la sogs pa yin pas bdag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Since this is so, one should cultivate the thought “I am the protector of the qualities of others,” as stated in the lines beginning “I am the protector of those without protection.”

original: don 'di la 'jug par 'gyur ba @100b bdag la 'jig rten 'dir zad pa'i zhad tsam yang 'byung ba ma yin la bsags pa ni yod do zhes ston par byed pa pha rol du'ang bde ba che ste /
analyzed: don 'di la 'jug par 'gyur ba @100b bdag la 'jig rten 'dir zad pa'i zhad tsam yang 'byung ba ma yin la bsags pa ni yod do zhes ston par byed pa pha rol du'ang bde ba che ste /
translated: The present verse shows that the bodhisattva is happy in this world and the next. In this world, he is happy because he thinks, I have not wasted this life, but have accumulated merit. And in the next world, he is happy because he thinks, I will be reborn in the higher realms.

original: gzhan gyi yon tan la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yon tan la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who does this has no loss in this world, even to the slightest degree, and has only gain. And there is great happiness in the next world, too, because of the joy in the good qualities of others.

original: de ltar mi byed pa la 'grib pa 'jig rten gnyi gar yang sdug bsngal ba mthong ste /
analyzed: de ltar mi byed pa la 'grib pa 'jig rten gnyi gar yang sdug bsngal ba mthong ste /
translated: The one who does not act in this way has loss in both worlds, and sees suffering in both.

original: gzhan gyi yon tan ma bzod pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bas na sdig pa thams cad yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yon tan ma bzod pa'i phyir ro // de bas na sdig pa thams cad yongs su spangs te /
translated: Because of the lack of tolerance of the good qualities of others.

original: rigs pa'i las bya ba la bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rigs pa'i las bya ba la bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, one should avoid all evil, and train in the practice of what is right.

original: smra na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: smra na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: This is stated in the verse beginning with when speaking, etc.

original: kha na ma tho ba thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir yid phebs pa'o//
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir yid phebs pa'o//
translated: The mind is pleasing because of being free from all faults.

original: rim par rnam par gnas pa'i tshig dang / the tshom med pa'i don dang / yid tshim par byed pa dang / mnyan na tshim par byed pa dang / snying rje'i ro'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyu ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: rim par rnam par gnas pa'i tshig dang / the tshom med pa'i don dang / yid tshim par byed pa dang / mnyan na tshim par byed pa dang / snying rje'i ro'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyu ma yin pa dang /
translated: The words are arranged in order, the meaning is without doubt, it satisfies the mind, it satisfies when listened to, it arises from the cause of the taste of compassion, and it is not a cause of desire and so on.

original: 'jam pa ni rtsub pa'i tshig spangs pa dang / ran pa'i tshig ni sgra ji tsam gyis go bar bya ba rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /🔽de las gzhan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'jam pa ni rtsub pa'i tshig spangs pa dang / ran pa'i tshig ni sgra ji tsam gyis go bar bya ba rtogs par 'gyur ba ste / de las gzhan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Smooth means abandoning harsh words, and appropriate words are those that are understood by just the right sound.

original: ha cang lhug pa yang ma yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ha cang lhug pa yang ma yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should speak neither more than that nor less.

original: drang por lta ba ni yon po ma yin zhing gya gyu can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: drang por lta ba ni yon po ma yin zhing gya gyu can ma yin pa ste /
translated: Straightforward means not crooked or devious.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i ro'i khur gyis dud par gyur pa'i mig gis skom pa chu grang mo mchog tu tshim par byed pa legs par 'thung ba bzhin du sems can rnams la rnam par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i ro'i khur gyis dud par gyur pa'i mig gis skom pa chu grang mo mchog tu tshim par byed pa legs par 'thung ba bzhin du sems can rnams la rnam par blta bar bya ste /
translated: One should look at sentient beings with eyes that are languid from the weight of the taste of supreme joy, as if drinking well the supremely satisfying cool water of thirst.

original: chags pas ma yin /
analyzed: chags pas ma yin /
translated: One should not look with desire.

original: sdang bas ma yin /
analyzed: sdang bas ma yin /
translated: Not out of hatred,

original: rmongs pas ma yin te /
analyzed: rmongs pas ma yin te /
translated: not out of delusion.

original: de dag ni mchog tu phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mchog tu phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: They are the supreme benefactors.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir sems can de dag la brten nas rnyed par dka' ba'i sangs rgyas nyid 'thob par bdag 'gyur ba ste skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can de dag la brten nas rnyed par dka' ba'i sangs rgyas nyid 'thob par bdag 'gyur ba ste skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because, in dependence on those sentient beings, I will become one who obtains buddhahood, which is difficult to obtain.🔽In that way, even now, I am able to benefit sentient beings.

original: de ltar gnas pa na deng sang nyid nas kyang sems can gyi don nus pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa na deng sang nyid nas kyang sems can gyi don nus pa nyid yin te /
translated: As it is said:🔽By being completely calm, gentle,

original: gang / kun du mi rgod 'jam pa dang / ran cing mi nyon par smra ba yis //🔽skal ma can skye bo 'dun par 'gyus //
analyzed: gang / kun du mi rgod 'jam pa dang / ran cing mi nyon par smra ba yis // skal ma can skye bo 'dun par 'gyus //
translated: speaking appropriately and without agitation,🔽the fortunate will be attracted

original: gzung bar 'os pa'ang skye bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzung bar 'os pa'ang skye bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: and will be worthy of being accepted.

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos la yang dag par sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos la yang dag par sdud pa yin no //
translated: That is the correct summary of the bodhisattva’s Dharma.

original: de ltar mi byed na ci nyes she na /
analyzed: de ltar mi byed na ci nyes she na /
translated: What is wrong with not doing that?

original: de ni gzung 'os ma yin na /
analyzed: de ni gzung 'os ma yin na /
translated: If you are not worthy of being accepted,

original: 'jig rten rgyal ba'i myu gu @101a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyal ba'i myu gu @101a * //
translated: you are not a sprout of the Victorious Ones in the world.

original: brnyas ; / thal bas g-yogs ba'i me bzhin du //
analyzed: brnyas ; / thal bas g-yogs ba'i me bzhin du //
translated: Like fire covered with ashes,

original: sems can dmyal la sogs par bsreg / ces so //
analyzed: sems can dmyal la sogs par bsreg / ces so //
translated: they burn in the hells and so on.

original: de lta bas na sems can mgu bar bya ba nyid byang chub sems dpa'i las yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems can mgu bar bya ba nyid byang chub sems dpa'i las yin no //
translated: Therefore, the activity of the bodhisattva is to please sentient beings.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i zhing ni bsod nams 'byung ba'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa yin pas de'i zhar la 'ongs pa gzhan yang bstan pa /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i zhing ni bsod nams 'byung ba'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa yin pas de'i zhar la 'ongs pa gzhan yang bstan pa /
translated: The field of benefit is the extraordinary cause of the arising of merit. Another topic is taught in order to illustrate that:

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Always, etc.

original: mngon par zhen pa las byung ba ni yi dam du byas pa'i dang ba drag pos bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa las byung ba ni yi dam du byas pa'i dang ba drag pos bskyed pa'o //
translated: Arisen from clinging is generated by the intense clarity of a vow.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po stong pa nyid la sogs pa bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po stong pa nyid la sogs pa bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Arisen from the side of the antidote is generated by the cultivation of the emptiness, etc., which are the antidotes to the afflictions.

original: yon tan gyi zhing ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi zhing ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
translated: The field of virtues is the buddhas, bodhisattvas, etc.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i zhing ni pha ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i zhing ni pha ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The field of benefit is one's parents, etc.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i zhing ni nad pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i zhing ni nad pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The field of suffering is the sick, etc.

original: de dag la nyung du zhig byas pas kyang dge ba tshad med pa'i rgyu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la nyung du zhig byas pas kyang dge ba tshad med pa'i rgyu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even a small amount of these generates the cause of immeasurable virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis te 'di yang goms par bya ba yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis te 'di yang goms par bya ba yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: The bodhisattvas should cultivate this, as stated.

original: mkhas shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: mkhas shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The wise one, etc.

original: thams cad du spyod pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du spyod pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving is the practice in all situations.

original: ldang dang ldan pa ni le lo spangs pa'i phyir te brtson 'grus dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ldang dang ldan pa ni le lo spangs pa'i phyir te brtson 'grus dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: Endowed with rising means endowed with effort, because laziness is abandoned.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid kyis thams cad bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid kyis thams cad bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, everything should be done by oneself.🔽One should not be dependent on others for any action.

original: las 'ga' la yang gzhan la ltos pa med par bya'o zhes pa 'di nyid skabs dbye bar zhes bya ba la sogs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: las 'ga' la yang gzhan la ltos pa med par bya'o zhes pa 'di nyid skabs dbye bar zhes bya ba la sogs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught by the verse beginning with “in this very life.”

original: pha rol tu phyin pa goms par byed pa na don med pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir mthar gyis bya ba sbyin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa goms par byed pa na don med pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir mthar gyis bya ba sbyin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to abandon uselessness when cultivating the perfections, the verse beginning with “gradually” is stated.

original: gong nas gong du ni sbyin pa bas tshul khrims khyad zhugs la /
analyzed: gong nas gong du ni sbyin pa bas tshul khrims khyad zhugs la /
translated: The latter is superior to the former.🔽

original: tshul khrims pas bzod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims pas bzod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The higher ones are superior to the lower ones, such as morality is superior to generosity, and patience is superior to morality.

original: de'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan gyi rgyur gong ma mi btang ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan gyi rgyur gong ma mi btang ste /
translated: Therefore, the higher ones are not abandoned as causes of the other perfections.

original: de dang 'gal bas mi bsten snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal bas mi bsten snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that they are not relied upon because they are in conflict with that.

original: ci rnam pa thams cad du 'am ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci rnam pa thams cad du 'am ma yin zhe na /
translated: Is it in every way?

original: spyod pa'i zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: spyod pa'i zhes gsungs te /
translated: He says, “in practice.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa bslab pa sdom pa mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid ni dge ba'i chu bsrung ba'i ched du chu lon byas pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa bslab pa sdom pa mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid ni dge ba'i chu bsrung ba'i ched du chu lon byas pa'o //
translated: The very nature of the training and vow in the practice of the bodhisattvas is a dike built to hold the water of virtue.

original: de bas @101b na las gzhan du zhes bya ba ni ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bas @101b na las gzhan du zhes bya ba ni ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, “in any other way” means except for that.

original: de ji ltar mi nyams par zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar mi nyams par zhe na /
translated: How is it not lost?

original: bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is for the sake of action.

original: de bas tshogs bsags par 'dod pa snying rje gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas thams cad bya bar gsungs pa yin no zhes brjod pa de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de ltar bla na med pa shes par byas la sems can rnams kyi phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas tshogs bsags par 'dod pa snying rje gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas thams cad bya bar gsungs pa yin no zhes brjod pa de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / de ltar bla na med pa shes par byas la sems can rnams kyi phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said that one who wishes to gather the collections, who is governed by compassion, should do everything.

original: rtag tu brtson 'grus brtsams par 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu brtson 'grus brtsams par 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, having understood the unsurpassed, one should always exert oneself in the practice of striving in order to accomplish the benefit and happiness of sentient beings.

original: don bkag pa la 'jug pa dag ji ltar na ltung bar bcas pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: don bkag pa la 'jug pa dag ji ltar na ltung bar bcas pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that one does not incur a downfall when one engages in the prohibition of the object?

original: 'ga' zhig bkag pa yang bya bar 'os pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig bkag pa yang bya bar 'os pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ste /
translated: The Blessed One permitted the performance of what is proper even though it is prohibited.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa la nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa la nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of the Blessed One is endowed with renunciation.

original: de yang thams cad la ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang thams cad la ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, it is not for everyone,

original: 'on kyang thugs rje mnga' ba ste thugs rje rab kyi mthar phyin pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang thugs rje mnga' ba ste thugs rje rab kyi mthar phyin pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but rather for one who is compassionate, who is engaged in the perfection of compassion.

original: de'i gzhan dbang du gyur cing gzhan gyi don la ro gcig pa can rang gi dgos pa la phyir phyogs par blta ste /
analyzed: de'i gzhan dbang du gyur cing gzhan gyi don la ro gcig pa can rang gi dgos pa la phyir phyogs par blta ste /
translated: One should see that one is under the control of the other's aim, and that one's own aim is turned away from.

original: de ltar shes rab dang snying rje las byung bas gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa thabs mkhas pas rab tu 'jug par byed pa la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab dang snying rje las byung bas gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa thabs mkhas pas rab tu 'jug par byed pa la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: Thus, there is no downfall for one who is engaged in the aim of others through the power of wisdom and compassion, and who is engaged in skillful means.

original: 'dir yang nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las ltung ba dang ltung ba med pa'i rnam par 'byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las ltung ba dang ltung ba med pa'i rnam par 'byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should know the distinction between downfalls and non-downfalls from the Upalipariprﬁccha-sutra.

original: de bzhin du thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin du thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las /
translated: Similarly, the Skill in Means Sutra says:

original: bram ze'i khye'u skar ma'i dbang du byas te ltung ba dang ltung bar mi 'gyur ba'i cha shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u skar ma'i dbang du byas te ltung ba dang ltung bar mi 'gyur ba'i cha shes par bya'o //
translated: “In the case of the young brahmin Nakṣatra, there is knowledge of the distinction between downfalls and non-downfalls.”

original: 'di ni bdag lus bsrung ba ste sman dang gos la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba de dag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag lus bsrung ba ste sman dang gos la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba de dag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Here, the protection of one’s own body is by means of medicine, clothing, and so on. In order to teach those,

original: log par ltung dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: log par ltung dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “By the wrong path, and so on.”

original: sman dang gos la sogs pas bdag gi lus yongs su bskyang bar bya ste gzhan gyi don la mkho ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sman dang gos la sogs pas bdag gi lus yongs su bskyang bar bya ste gzhan gyi don la mkho ba'i phyir ro //
translated: I will care for my body with medicine, clothing, and so on, because it is needed for the benefit of others.

original: ji skad du sngar bstan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji skad du sngar bstan pa lta bu ste /
translated: As it was taught above:

original: de la sman ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sman ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, medicine is of two kinds:

original: rtag tu bya ba'i sman dang / na ba'i gsos sman no //
analyzed: rtag tu bya ba'i sman dang / na ba'i gsos sman no //
translated: medicine for daily use and medicine for curing the sick.

original: de la rtag tu bya ba'i sman ni zan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rtag tu bya ba'i sman ni zan la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, medicine for daily use is food and so on.

original: zas de ni don du spyod yul du spyod pa grong du 'jug pa na ji skad du bstan pa'i bslab pa la dran pa gzhag ste rgyu bar bya'o //
analyzed: zas de ni don du spyod yul du spyod pa grong du 'jug pa na ji skad du bstan pa'i bslab pa la dran pa gzhag ste rgyu bar bya'o //
translated: That food is for the sake of the range of experience. When entering the village for alms, one should move about placing mindfulness in the training as it has been taught.

original: de nas bsod snyoms rnyed pa las cha bzhir bgos la /
analyzed: de nas bsod snyoms rnyed pa las cha bzhir bgos la /
translated: Then, having obtained alms, divide them into four parts.🔽Give one part to those who have fallen into misfortune,

original: log par ltung bar gyur pa dang / mgon med pa @102a * //
analyzed: log par ltung bar gyur pa dang / mgon med pa @102a * //
translated: and to those who are without protection,

original: dang brtul zhugs la gnas pa la legs par bgo bar bya ste /
analyzed: dang brtul zhugs la gnas pa la legs par bgo bar bya ste /
translated: and to those who are observing a vow.

original: bgo skal gcig ni log par ltung ba rnams la /
analyzed: bgo skal gcig ni log par ltung ba rnams la /
translated: One part is for those who have fallen into misfortune.

original: gnyis pa ni mgon med pa rnams la /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mgon med pa rnams la /
translated: The second is for those who are without protection.

original: gsum pa ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la byin nas /
analyzed: gsum pa ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la byin nas /
translated: The third is to give to fellow practitioners of the way.

original: bzhi pa bdag nyid bza' bar bya'o ;
analyzed: bzhi pa bdag nyid bza' bar bya'o ;
translated: The fourth is to eat oneself.

original: / de za ba na 'dod chags med par bza' ste /🔽chags par ma yin /
analyzed: / de za ba na 'dod chags med par bza' ste / chags par ma yin /
translated: When eating, one should eat without desire.🔽Not out of desire,

original: brkam par ma yin /
analyzed: brkam par ma yin /
translated: not out of greed,

original: zhen par ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zhen par ma yin gyi /
translated: not out of attachment.

original: gzhan du na ji tsam du lus 'di gnas par bya ba dang / bskyang bar bya ba'i phyir ran pa tsam du bza'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na ji tsam du lus 'di gnas par bya ba dang / bskyang bar bya ba'i phyir ran pa tsam du bza'o //
translated: Rather, one should eat only as much as is needed to sustain and nourish this body.

original: ji ltar ha cang yang nyams dma' ba dang / ha cang yang lus lci bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar bza'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ha cang yang nyams dma' ba dang / ha cang yang lus lci bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar bza'o //
translated: One should eat in such a way that one does not become either weak or too heavy.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ha cang yang nyams dmas na ni dge ba'i phyogs la rgyab kyis phyogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha cang yang nyams dmas na ni dge ba'i phyogs la rgyab kyis phyogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is too weak, one turns away from the wholesome side.

original: lus ha cang yang lcis na gnyid kyis non par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus ha cang yang lcis na gnyid kyis non par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the body is too heavy, one is overcome by sleep.🔽After eating that alms-food, one should turn to the wholesome side.

original: des bsod snyoms de zos nas dge ba'i phyogs la mngon du phyogs par bya'o zhes 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las gsungs so //
analyzed: des bsod snyoms de zos nas dge ba'i phyogs la mngon du phyogs par bya'o zhes 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in the noble Cloud of Jewels.

original: 'phags pa rin po che'i phung po las kyang zas za ba na sems 'di ltar bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rin po che'i phung po las kyang zas za ba na sems 'di ltar bskyed par bya ste /
translated: When you eat food, you should generate this thought:

original: lus 'di la srin bu'i rigs stong phrag brgyad cu yod pa de dag de'i mthus bde bar gnas par gyur cig /
analyzed: lus 'di la srin bu'i rigs stong phrag brgyad cu yod pa de dag de'i mthus bde bar gnas par gyur cig /
translated: “By the power of this, may the eighty-four thousand types of worms in this body be happy.

original: de lta na ni 'di dag zang zing gis bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'di dag zang zing gis bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, I will gather them with material things.

original: byang chub thob nas ni chos kyis bsdu bar bya'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byang chub thob nas ni chos kyis bsdu bar bya'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: When I attain Awakening, I will gather them with the Dharma.”

original: yang de nyid las /
analyzed: yang de nyid las /
translated: And the same text says:

original: 'od srungs ngas gnyis la dad pas byin pa gnang ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs ngas gnyis la dad pas byin pa gnang ste /
translated: “Kāśyapa, I allow two kinds of gifts given out of faith:

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: rigs pa dang stong pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: rigs pa dang stong pa'o zhes so //
translated: The rational and the empty.”

original: phyogs 'dis longs spyod thams cad sems can thams cad kyi don du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis longs spyod thams cad sems can thams cad kyi don du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: By this method, you should bless all your possessions for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: gzhan du na bdag nyid la chags pas longs spyod pa las ni nyon mongs pa can gyi ltung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na bdag nyid la chags pas longs spyod pa las ni nyon mongs pa can gyi ltung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if you are attached to yourself and use them for your own sake, you will incur an afflicted downfall.

original: ji skad du zla ba'i sgron ma'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du zla ba'i sgron ma'i mdo las /
translated: As the Candrapradīpa Sūtra says,

original: de dag kha zas ro zhim bsod pa dag / rnyed nas rnal 'byor mi brtson za zhing 'thung //
analyzed: de dag kha zas ro zhim bsod pa dag / rnyed nas rnal 'byor mi brtson za zhing 'thung //
translated: Having found delicious, sweet-tasting food, they eat and drink without striving in yoga.

original: de dag la ni zas de dug par 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag la ni zas de dug par 'gyur //
translated: That food becomes poison for them.

original: ba glang phru gu pad rtsam bkrus bzhin //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ba glang phru gu pad rtsam bkrus bzhin // zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: Like a calf with a lotus root in its mouth.

original: de dag rgya cher ni bslab pa kun las btus par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag rgya cher ni bslab pa kun las btus par blta bar bya'o //
translated: These should be understood in detail from the Compendium of Trainings.

original: bza' ba dang btung ba ni thun chod du bya ba dang / nyin zhag @102b tu bya ba dang ji srid du 'tsho ba'i bar du zhes bya ba ste rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba ni thun chod du bya ba dang / nyin zhag @102b tu bya ba dang ji srid du 'tsho ba'i bar du zhes bya ba ste rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Food and drink are of three kinds: to be consumed before noon, to be consumed in one period, and to be consumed throughout one’s life.

original: de dag kyang dge slong gi 'dul bar bstan pas de nyid las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang dge slong gi 'dul bar bstan pas de nyid las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Since these are taught in the monastic code of the fully ordained monks, you should understand them from that.

original: gos la sogs pa lus bsrung ba chos gos gsum ma gtogs par sbyin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gos la sogs pa lus bsrung ba chos gos gsum ma gtogs par sbyin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As for clothing and so forth, which are for the protection of the body, it is said that “except for the three Dharma robes, you should give away all your possessions.”

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' la lhung bzed dang chos gos slong ba 'ga' zhig 'ongs na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' la lhung bzed dang chos gos slong ba 'ga' zhig 'ongs na /
translated: If someone comes to a bodhisattva and asks for his alms bowl and Dharma robes,

original: des shin tu gtong bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: des shin tu gtong bar mi bya ste /
translated: the bodhisattva should not give them away.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba gang yin pa dge sbyong la rung ba chos gos gsum po de las lhag pa gang yin pa ni slong ba la sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba gang yin pa dge sbyong la rung ba chos gos gsum po de las lhag pa gang yin pa ni slong ba la sbyin par bya ste /
translated: But whatever is permitted by the Lord is suitable for an ascetic, and whatever is in excess of the three robes should be given to those who beg.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no ;
translated: But not otherwise.

original: / byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las gsungs pa /
translated: The Bodhisattvapratimoksha says,

original: yang gal te la la zhig 'ongs nas lhung bzed dang chos gos slong ba na /
analyzed: yang gal te la la zhig 'ongs nas lhung bzed dang chos gos slong ba na /
translated: “If someone comes and asks for the begging-bowl and robes,

original: gal te de la sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba'i chos gos gsum las lhag pa zhig yod na ji lta ba bzhin du btang zhing sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de la sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba'i chos gos gsum las lhag pa zhig yod na ji lta ba bzhin du btang zhing sbyin par bya'o //
translated: if you have in excess of the three robes permitted by the Buddha, you should give them away as is proper.

original: gal te de la chos gos gsum las nyung bar gyur na gang la brten nas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa de ni yongs su gtong bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de la chos gos gsum las nyung bar gyur na gang la brten nas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa de ni yongs su gtong bar mi bya'o //
translated: But if you have less than the three robes, you should not give away that on which you depend to live the holy life.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos gos gsum gtong bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos gos gsum gtong bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Tathagata has said, ‘Do not give away the three robes.’

original: sh'a ri'i bu gal te byang chub sems dpa' chos gos gsum yongs su btang nas slong ba po la gtso bor byed na des ni 'dod pa chung ba bsten pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes ha cang btang ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gal te byang chub sems dpa' chos gos gsum yongs su btang nas slong ba po la gtso bor byed na des ni 'dod pa chung ba bsten pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes ha cang btang ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Śāriputra, if a bodhisattva, having given away his three Dharma robes, were to make a priority of begging, then he would not be practicing contentment.

original: yang bdag bsrung pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang bdag bsrung pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To show the protection of oneself, he says:

original: dam pa'i chos ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽dam pa ste skyes bu dam pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'am /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / dam pa ste skyes bu dam pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'am /
translated: The holy Dharma and so on.

original: dam pa'i chos te gzhan la phan pa dang bde ba 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos te gzhan la phan pa dang bde ba 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa bsgrub pa ste /
translated: The holy Dharma is that of the holy beings, the bodhisattvas, or it is the Dharma of the holy ones, the means of accomplishing the welfare and happiness of others, both mundane and supramundane.

original: de bstan pa'i lus la rgyu mtshan cung zad kyi don ched du gzir bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i lus la rgyu mtshan cung zad kyi don ched du gzir bar mi bya ste /
translated: One should not be bent on the body that teaches that Dharma for the sake of some small purpose.

original: gzhan du ni don chen po'i phung po nyams par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gzhan du ni don chen po'i phung po nyams par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Otherwise, the great purpose will be lost.

original: / de'i phyir 'di dag ni snga ma'i gtan tshigs kyi tshig yin no //
analyzed: / de'i phyir 'di dag ni snga ma'i gtan tshigs kyi tshig yin no //
translated: Therefore, these are the words of the reason for the previous statement.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: gang gi phyir shin tu 'jam pa'i brtson pa 'di nyid 'phel bas myur du sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub par nus par 'gyur ba yin no //🔽gang gi phyir de bas na rang gi lus @103a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir shin tu 'jam pa'i brtson pa 'di nyid 'phel bas myur du sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub par nus par 'gyur ba yin no // gang gi phyir de bas na rang gi lus @103a * //
translated: Because by the increase of just this very soft effort, one will be able to quickly accomplish the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings.🔽Therefore, one should not give one’s body, head, etc.

original: dang mgo sbyin pa la sogs pa mi bya'o zhes bkag go //
analyzed: dang mgo sbyin pa la sogs pa mi bya'o zhes bkag go //
translated: This is the prohibition.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba dang cig shos dang skye bo phongs pa thams cad la thun mong du 'jug pa snying rje'i sems ma dag pa na'o //
analyzed: mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba dang cig shos dang skye bo phongs pa thams cad la thun mong du 'jug pa snying rje'i sems ma dag pa na'o //
translated: When the mind of compassion is impure, engaging in common with all beings, friends, enemies, and strangers, and the poor.

original: brtson 'grus ha cang brtsams na yang bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i don la gnod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ha cang brtsams na yang bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i don la gnod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If one exerts effort too much, it will harm the purpose of benefitting oneself and others.

original: bdag dang gzhan la mnyam pa'am lhag par 'jug pa'i bsam pa can la ni ma bkag ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la mnyam pa'am lhag par 'jug pa'i bsam pa can la ni ma bkag ste /
translated: For one who has the intention to engage equally or more in the benefit of others, it is not prohibited.

original: gang de bzhin du bdag dang gzhan gyi byang chub kyi phyogs dang thos pa la sogs pa'i bar chad byed pa la gtong ba dang mi gtong ba mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang de bzhin du bdag dang gzhan gyi byang chub kyi phyogs dang thos pa la sogs pa'i bar chad byed pa la gtong ba dang mi gtong ba mi bya'o //
translated: So too, one should not give or not give to one who creates obstacles to the enlightenment factors and learning of oneself and others.

original: sems can gyi don la nus pa lhag pa'am nus pa mnyam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'am mnyam pa'i dge ba'i bar chod byed pa la gtong ba dang mi gtong ba mi bya'o zhes gsungs te grub pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la nus pa lhag pa'am nus pa mnyam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'am mnyam pa'i dge ba'i bar chod byed pa la gtong ba dang mi gtong ba mi bya'o zhes gsungs te grub pa yin no //
translated: One should not give or not give to one who creates obstacles to the virtue of a bodhisattva who is superior or equal in ability to benefit sentient beings and who is superior or equal in enlightenment.

original: 'di nyid la dgongs nas byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las bshad de /
analyzed: 'di nyid la dgongs nas byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las bshad de /
translated: This is the point of the Bodhisattva-pratimoksha:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par 'byung ba byang chub kyi yan lag la mngon par brtson pa des ji ltar sbyin pa sbyin par bya ba gang sbyin par bya /🔽ji tsam zhig sbyin par bya de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par 'byung ba byang chub kyi yan lag la mngon par brtson pa des ji ltar sbyin pa sbyin par bya ba gang sbyin par bya /🔽ji tsam zhig sbyin par bya de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: “Sharivara, a bodhisattva who has gone forth from the home life and is striving in the enlightenment factors should give a gift to whomever and whatever extent is appropriate.

original: chos sbyin par byed pa dang chos kyi sbyin bdag tu bya'o //🔽sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa gang zhig gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang ste /
analyzed: chos sbyin par byed pa dang chos kyi sbyin bdag tu bya'o // sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa gang zhig gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang ste /
translated: He should give the gift of the Dharma and be a benefactor of the gift of the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la dbul ba phul ba bas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la dbul ba phul ba bas /
translated: “Śāriputra, suppose a lay bodhisattva were to fill buddhafields as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river with the seven precious substances and offer them as gifts to the tathāgatas, the arhats, the completely perfect buddhas.

original: sh'a ri'i bu rab tu byung bar gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig bstan na 'di ni de bas ches bsod nams mang du bskyed de /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu rab tu byung bar gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig bstan na 'di ni de bas ches bsod nams mang du bskyed de /
translated: “Śāriputra, suppose a renunciant bodhisattva were to teach a single verse of four lines. The merit of this would be far greater than the previous.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu byung bas zang zing gi sbyin pa bya bar ma gnang ngo //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu byung bas zang zing gi sbyin pa bya bar ma gnang ngo //
translated: Śāriputra, the Tathāgata does not allow renunciant bodhisattvas to give material gifts.

original: de bzhin du sh'a ri'i bu gang gis lhung bzed du 'ongs pa lhung bzed du chud pa'i rnyed pa chos dang mthun pa chos kyis med par gyur na des tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang lhan cig tu thun mong du bza' bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sh'a ri'i bu gang gis lhung bzed du 'ongs pa lhung bzed du chud pa'i rnyed pa chos dang mthun pa chos kyis med par gyur na des tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang lhan cig tu thun mong du bza' bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: In the same way, Sariputra, if the gain that has come into the begging bowl, the gain that has been put into the begging bowl, is in accord with the Dharma, and is not lacking in the Dharma, then he should eat it in common with those who are practicing the holy life.

original: de nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: And the same text says,

original: sh'a ri'i bu khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par ma byung ba gang yin pa des ni chos kun nas @103b bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par ma byung ba gang yin pa des ni chos kun nas @103b bsten par bya'o //
translated: Sariputra, whoever has not gone forth from the home life should attend to the Dharma.

original: des de la brtson par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: des de la brtson par bya'o zhes so //
translated: He should make an effort at that.

original: gzhan du na sems can gcig gi don bsdu ba'i phyir sems can gyi tshogs chen po dang sems can des kyang byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyong ba'i bar chad byas pas don chen po nyams par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can gcig gi don bsdu ba'i phyir sems can gyi tshogs chen po dang sems can des kyang byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyong ba'i bar chad byas pas don chen po nyams par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, for the sake of one being, a great mass of beings and that being would be deprived of the great goal, because of the obstacle to the purification of the thought of the bodhisattva.

original: thabs la mkhas pa 'dis gnas na byang chub kyi lam la nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa 'dis gnas na byang chub kyi lam la nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if he lives by this skillful means, he does not lose the path to Awakening.

original: 'dir dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention here is this.

original: sngon du lus sems can thams cad la byin mod kyi /
analyzed: sngon du lus sems can thams cad la byin mod kyi /
translated: Even though one has previously given one's body to all sentient beings,

original: 'on kyang dus ma yin par longs spyod pa las bsrung bar bya ba 'ba' zhig yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dus ma yin par longs spyod pa las bsrung bar bya ba 'ba' zhig yin te /
translated: nevertheless, one should protect it from being used at the wrong time.

original: des na ser sna'i go skabs kyang med cing dam bcas pa'i don las nyams pa yang med do //
analyzed: des na ser sna'i go skabs kyang med cing dam bcas pa'i don las nyams pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no opportunity for stinginess, and there is no failure to fulfill one's promise.🔽As it is said,🔽Like the seeds of a medicinal tree,

original: gang / sman shing ljon pa blta na sdug ces pa'i //
analyzed: gang / sman shing ljon pa blta na sdug ces pa'i //
translated: which are beautiful to behold,

original: rtsa ba la sogs spyad 'os sa bon ltar //
analyzed: rtsa ba la sogs spyad 'os sa bon ltar //
translated: and are used for their roots and so on,

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi sman shing de bzhin du //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi sman shing de bzhin du //
translated: so it is with the medicinal tree of the perfect Buddha.

original: byis pa dus min spyod las legs bsrung bya //
analyzed: byis pa dus min spyod las legs bsrung bya //
translated: The child should be well protected from using it at the wrong time.

original: zhes gsungs pa'o// sems can gyi bsam pa bsrung ba las kyang bdag bsrung bar bya'o zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'o// sems can gyi bsam pa bsrung ba las kyang bdag bsrung bar bya'o zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that one should protect oneself from the thoughts of sentient beings:

original: ma gus pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ma gus pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: One should not be disrespectful, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos lha dang mi la sogs pas mchod pa gus par mi byed pa la chos bshad na des na lha la sogs pa rnams 'phya bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos lha dang mi la sogs pas mchod pa gus par mi byed pa la chos bshad na des na lha la sogs pa rnams 'phya bar 'gyur te ;
translated: If the Blessed One explains the Dharma to those who do not respectfully worship gods, humans, etc., then the gods, etc. will criticize him.

original: de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bkag pa yin pas de'i bka' las 'da' ba ni ltung ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bkag pa yin pas de'i bka' las 'da' ba ni ltung ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the Blessed One has prohibited this, transgressing his word would be a downfall.

original: ras la sogs pas mgo bo bcings pa la ma yin te /
analyzed: ras la sogs pas mgo bo bcings pa la ma yin te /
translated: But not if the head is bound with cloth, etc.

original: bcas pa'i sgra ni gsum ka dang yang 'brel to //
analyzed: bcas pa'i sgra ni gsum ka dang yang 'brel to //
translated: The word “only” is connected with all three.

original: de bzhin du mchod phyir thogs pas mgo bo dkris pa la yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mchod phyir thogs pas mgo bo dkris pa la yang ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, not if the head is wrapped with a sacred thread.

original: mi na  bzhin du zhes bya bas ni re re la skyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi na  bzhin du zhes bya bas ni re re la skyar bar bya'o //
translated: “Without being sick” should be supplied with each.

original: na ba la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: na ba la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is sick.

original: de dag ni nya bar mtshon pa yin te /🔽nyal ba dang 'dug pa la 'greng bas ma yin zhing /🔽nyal ba la 'dug pas ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni nya bar mtshon pa yin te / nyal ba dang 'dug pa la 'greng bas ma yin zhing / nyal ba la 'dug pas ma yin la /
translated: These are the general rules.🔽But not if one is standing while the other two are lying down;

original: 'dug pa la stan med pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dug pa la stan med pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: not if one is lying down while the other two are sitting;🔽and not if one is sitting on the ground while the other two are on a high seat.

original: lam gol ba nas 'gro bas lam nas 'gro ba la ma yin no //
analyzed: lam gol ba nas 'gro bas lam nas 'gro ba la ma yin no //
translated: Not from one who goes by a different path, but from one who goes by the same path.

original: mdun nas 'gro ba la rgyab nas 'gro bas ma yin te /
analyzed: mdun nas 'gro ba la rgyab nas 'gro bas ma yin te /
translated: Not from one who goes in front, but from one who goes behind.

original: rgyan dang ldan pa la sogs pa'ang ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyan dang ldan pa la sogs pa'ang ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: And not from one who is adorned, etc.

original: don med pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i rgyu 'di yang mi bya'o zhes bstan pa /🔽dman la zhes bya ba la @104a * //
analyzed: don med pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i rgyu 'di yang mi bya'o zhes bstan pa / dman la zhes bya ba la @104a * //
translated: This is the cause of the downfall, which is to be avoided in order to avoid the meaningless.

original: sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: sogs pa yin la /
translated: The words to the inferior etc.

original: zab mo ni yid gzhungs pa ma yin pas gting mi dpogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab mo ni yid gzhungs pa ma yin pas gting mi dpogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The profound is not fathomed by the unintelligent.

original: rgya che ba ni rab kyi mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //🔽de 'dra ba'i chos kyang dman pa la ni blo legs par ma sbyangs pa'am /
analyzed: rgya che ba ni rab kyi mthar thug pa'i phyir ro // de 'dra ba'i chos kyang dman pa la ni blo legs par ma sbyangs pa'am /
translated: The extensive is the ultimate of the excellent.

original: dman pa la mos pa rnams la ste mi bshad do zhes skabs su bab pas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dman pa la mos pa rnams la ste mi bshad do zhes skabs su bab pas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Such Dharma is not to be explained to the inferior, to those whose minds are not well trained, or to those who are devoted to the inferior.🔽One should apply this as it is appropriate.

original: bud med la gcig pu dben par song ste chos mi bshad mi smra ste /
analyzed: bud med la gcig pu dben par song ste chos mi bshad mi smra ste /
translated: One should not go alone and in private to a woman and explain the Dharma or speak.

original: bshad na ltung ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: bshad na ltung ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro /
translated: If one does explain, one becomes guilty of a downfall.

original: gal te skyes pa yod na nyes pa med do //🔽nyan thos kyi theg pa bshad pa'am /
analyzed: gal te skyes pa yod na nyes pa med do // nyan thos kyi theg pa bshad pa'am /
translated: If there is a man, there is no fault.

original: theg pa chen po bshad pa'i chos rnams la sems dad pa la sogs pas mnyan par bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bshad pa'i chos rnams la sems dad pa la sogs pas mnyan par bya ste /
translated: One should listen to the teachings of the Śrāvakayāna or the Mahāyāna with faith in the mind and so on.

original: gzhan du na dam pa'i chos spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na dam pa'i chos spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, one would abandon the holy Dharma.

original: sems can zab mo dang rgya che ba'i chos kyi snod du rgyu mtshan gyis shes nas nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos la gzhug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sems can zab mo dang rgya che ba'i chos kyi snod du rgyu mtshan gyis shes nas nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos la gzhug par mi bya'o //
translated: Having understood through reasons that sentient beings are vessels for the profound and vast Dharma, one should not engage them in the Dharma of the śrāvakas and so on.

original: sdom pa'i bslab pa'i spyod par bya bar 'os pa rnams dor nas mdo sde la sogs pa bklags pa nyid kyis khyod dag par 'gyur ro zhes chos 'dod pa la bstan par mi bya'o /🔽// / bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: sdom pa'i bslab pa'i spyod par bya bar 'os pa rnams dor nas mdo sde la sogs pa bklags pa nyid kyis khyod dag par 'gyur ro zhes chos 'dod pa la bstan par mi bya'o / // / bam po brgyad pa /
translated: One should not teach those who desire the Dharma, saying, “By abandoning the conduct of the training in vows and just reciting the sūtras and so on, you will be purified.”

original: yang 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: Here it is also said:

original: gzhan yang don med pa ni dkon mchog brtsegs pa las gsungs pa mthong ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang don med pa ni dkon mchog brtsegs pa las gsungs pa mthong ste /
translated: Moreover, the meaninglessness is seen in the Ratnakuṭa,

original: sems can yongs su smin par ma byas pa rnams la yid rton te ston pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa dang / sems can snod du ma gyur pa rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po ston pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa dang /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par ma byas pa rnams la yid rton te ston pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa dang / sems can snod du ma gyur pa rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po ston pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa dang /
translated: To trust those who have not ripened sentient beings and to teach them is a bodhisattva’s error.🔽To teach the vast Dharma of the Buddha to sentient beings who are not suitable vessels is a bodhisattva’s error.

original: rgya chen po la mos pa'i sems can rnams la theg pa dman pa ston pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa zhes so //
analyzed: rgya chen po la mos pa'i sems can rnams la theg pa dman pa ston pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khrul pa zhes so //
translated: To teach the Hīnayāna to sentient beings who aspire to the vast is a bodhisattva’s error.

original: 'phags pa chos thams cad rnam par 'thag pa thams cad bsdus pa las kyang don med phra mo gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa chos thams cad rnam par 'thag pa thams cad bsdus pa las kyang don med phra mo gsungs te /
translated: The noble Sūtra on Chanting the Dharma Together also discusses subtle purposelessness:

original: 'jam dpal dam pa'i chos spong ba'i las kyi sgrib pa ni shin tu phra'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal dam pa'i chos spong ba'i las kyi sgrib pa ni shin tu phra'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the karmic obstruction of rejecting the true Dharma is subtle.

original: 'jam dpal gang la la zhig de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos la la ni bzang bar 'du shes par byed /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gang la la zhig de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos la la ni bzang bar 'du shes par byed /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if someone thinks that some of the teachings given by the Tathāgata are good and some are not good,

original: la la ni ngan par 'du shes na de dam pa'i chos spong ba'o //
analyzed: la la ni ngan par 'du shes na de dam pa'i chos spong ba'o //
translated: that is the rejection of the true Dharma.

original: gang 'di ni rigs pa'o 'di ni mi rigs pa'o zhes smra ba des dam pa'i chos spangs pas de bzhin gshegs pa la skur pa 'debs pa yin /
analyzed: gang 'di ni rigs pa'o 'di ni mi rigs pa'o zhes smra ba des dam pa'i chos spangs pas de bzhin gshegs pa la skur pa 'debs pa yin /
translated: Whoever says, “This is correct, that is incorrect,” rejects the true Dharma and thereby denigrates the Tathagata.

original: dge bdun la @104b ngan du brjod pa yin no zhes rgya cher ro //
analyzed: dge bdun la @104b ngan du brjod pa yin no zhes rgya cher ro //
translated: He is a slanderer of the Dharma.

original: 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The noble Akasagarbhasutra also says,

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i skabs su gsungs te /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i skabs su gsungs te /
translated: in the section on the root downfalls:

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pas kha cig la 'di skad du /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pas kha cig la 'di skad du /
translated: Moreover, a beginning bodhisattva might say to someone:

original: khyod kyis so sor thar pa dang 'dul ba'i tshul khrims la legs par bslabs te /
analyzed: khyod kyis so sor thar pa dang 'dul ba'i tshul khrims la legs par bslabs te /
translated: “You should train well in the ethics of individual liberation and the ethics of the Vinaya.

original: khyod myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: khyod myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of quickly generating the intention to become fully enlightened?

original: theg pa chen po lhogs shig dang / des na nyon mongs pa'i rkyen gyis lus dang ngag dang yid rnams kyis mi dge ba'i las gang bsgrubs pa de dag rnam par smin par mi 'gyur bar dag par 'gyur ro zhes smra ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' las dang po ba'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba
analyzed: theg pa chen po lhogs shig dang / des na nyon mongs pa'i rkyen gyis lus dang ngag dang yid rnams kyis mi dge ba'i las gang bsgrubs pa de dag rnam par smin par mi 'gyur bar dag par 'gyur ro zhes smra ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' las dang po ba'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba
translated: Read the Great Vehicle, and then the karma of non-virtue that you have accumulated with your body, speech, and mind through the conditions of the afflictions will be purified and not come to fruition.

original: gsum pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ste /
translated: This is the first root downfall of a beginner bodhisattva.

original: gong du ji skad smos pa'i bar du'o zhes so //
analyzed: gong du ji skad smos pa'i bar du'o zhes so //
translated: Up to the above.

original: de'i phyir 'di yang so sor thar pa las bkag pas spyod par mi bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di yang so sor thar pa las bkag pas spyod par mi bya'o zhes so //
translated: Therefore, this is also prohibited in the Prātimokṣa, so it should not be practiced.

original: shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Blessed One said, Wood, and so on.

original: mchil ma ni bad kan no //
analyzed: mchil ma ni bad kan no //
translated: Phlegm means mucus.

original: dor bar bya ba ni gzhag par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: dor bar bya ba ni gzhag par mi bya ba'o //
translated: Discard means do not keep.

original: longs spyod pa'i chu dang thang ni longs spyod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i chu dang thang ni longs spyod par bya ba ste /
translated: Enjoyment water and land means what is to be enjoyed.

original: gci ba dang phyis la sogs pa yang smad pa'o //
analyzed: gci ba dang phyis la sogs pa yang smad pa'o //
translated: Feces, urine, and so on are also contemptible.

original: 'dir yang lha la sogs pa 'phyo bas bsod nams ma yin pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir yang lha la sogs pa 'phyo bas bsod nams ma yin pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Here too, non-virtue arises from disrespecting gods and so on.

original: kha bkang ba ni kha gang bar byas pa ste /
analyzed: kha bkang ba ni kha gang bar byas pa ste /
translated: The full mouth is the mouth filled up.

original: kham chen por bcad nas so //
analyzed: kham chen por bcad nas so //
translated: Having cut it into large morsels.

original: sgra bcas ni cag cag la sogs pa'i sgra dang ngo //
analyzed: sgra bcas ni cag cag la sogs pa'i sgra dang ngo //
translated: With sound means with the sound of cha cha and so on.

original: kha cher phye ba ste /
analyzed: kha cher phye ba ste /
translated: With the mouth wide open.

original: rkang pa brkyang ba ni khri la sogs pa la 'dug pa nas sa la sogs pa la rkang pa brkyang ste 'dug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rkang pa brkyang ba ni khri la sogs pa la 'dug pa nas sa la sogs pa la rkang pa brkyang ste 'dug par mi bya'o //
translated: With the legs stretched out means that, having sat down on a seat and so on, one should not sit with legs stretched out on the ground and so on.

original: dpung pa gnyi ga yang mnyam pa ste dus gcig tu mi mnye'o //
analyzed: dpung pa gnyi ga yang mnyam pa ste dus gcig tu mi mnye'o //
translated: Both shoulders means that one should not rub them at the same time.

original: rim gyis mnye ba la ni nyes pa med do //🔽rkyen yod pas gcig pu ste /
analyzed: rim gyis mnye ba la ni nyes pa med do // rkyen yod pas gcig pu ste /
translated: There is no fault in rubbing them in turn.

original: gnyis pa med par gzhan gyis bud med la sogs pa dang ste bzhon pa la sogs par gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa med par gzhan gyis bud med la sogs pa dang ste bzhon pa la sogs par gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Alone means that, because of circumstances, one should not sit on a seat and so on together with a woman and so on, or with another man.

original: 'dir 'di ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba gnyi ga'i thun mong yin pas gzhan gyi zhes smos pa yin no //🔽mdor bsdus nas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir 'di ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba gnyi ga'i thun mong yin pas gzhan gyi zhes smos pa yin no // mdor bsdus nas bstan pa ni /
translated: Here, another is mentioned because this is common to both householders and renunciants.

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The summary is taught by In brief, and so on.🔽The meaning of the verse is self-evident.

original: 'jig rten rnams kyi dang ba skyed par byed pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de thams cad bstan bcos sam tha snyad bltas shing mkhas pa la dris nas spang bar bya'o @105a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams kyi dang ba skyed par byed pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de thams cad bstan bcos sam tha snyad bltas shing mkhas pa la dris nas spang bar bya'o @105a * //
translated: All those things which do not inspire the confidence of the world should be abandoned after examining the treatises and consulting the wise.

original: zhes ; de dag ni 'dis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes ; de dag ni 'dis bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is what is taught by this verse.

original: mthong ba yang ni gang gnod pa byed pa'i rnam pa de lta bu de spang bar bya ste ltung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba yang ni gang gnod pa byed pa'i rnam pa de lta bu de spang bar bya ste ltung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And if one is seen to be doing something that is harmful, that should be abandoned, because it is a downfall.🔽As it says in the Sutra of Golden Light:

original: gang / de phyir rgyal ba'i sdom pa'i mdor //🔽gang gis sems can ma dad gyur //
analyzed: gang / de phyir rgyal ba'i sdom pa'i mdor // gang gis sems can ma dad gyur //
translated: Therefore, in the sutra of the Conqueror’s vow,🔽it is said that you should strenuously avoid

original: de ni bsgrims te rnam spang zhes ;
analyzed: de ni bsgrims te rnam spang zhes ;
translated: anything that would cause sentient beings to lose faith.

original: / dkon mchog sprin las bka' stsal to //
analyzed: / dkon mchog sprin las bka' stsal to //
translated: This is taught in the Cloud of Jewels.

original: ji skad du byang chub sems dpa'i legs par spyod pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du byang chub sems dpa'i legs par spyod pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s good conduct?

original: 'dir ji tsam du byang chub sems dpa' gnas dma' ba na dus ma yin par ma yin /🔽dus ma yin par smra bam yin /
analyzed: 'dir ji tsam du byang chub sems dpa' gnas dma' ba na dus ma yin par ma yin / dus ma yin par smra bam yin /
translated: Here, a bodhisattva does not speak at an inappropriate time,🔽does not speak without being asked,

original: dus mi shes pa ma yin /
analyzed: dus mi shes pa ma yin /
translated: does not speak at the wrong moment,

original: yul mi shes pa ma yin /
analyzed: yul mi shes pa ma yin /
translated: does not speak without knowing the place,

original: rgyu gang las de'i thad du sems can ma dad pa smra ba ni de sems can thams cad rjes su bsrung ba dang / bdag gi byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i don du spyod lam phun sum tshogs shing 'jam par smra ba dang /
analyzed: rgyu gang las de'i thad du sems can ma dad pa smra ba ni de sems can thams cad rjes su bsrung ba dang / bdag gi byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i don du spyod lam phun sum tshogs shing 'jam par smra ba dang /
translated: The cause from which he speaks with faith is that he is perfect in conduct, speaks gently,

original: dal bus smra ba dang / 'du 'dzi mi mang ba dang / rab tu dben pa la mngon par phyogs pa dang / bzhin gyi mdangs rab tu dang ba yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dal bus smra ba dang / 'du 'dzi mi mang ba dang / rab tu dben pa la mngon par phyogs pa dang / bzhin gyi mdangs rab tu dang ba yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: speaks slowly, does not engage in much socializing, is inclined to solitude, and has a very clear countenance.

original: byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa' 'ga' la yang khyad du gsad par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa' 'ga' la yang khyad du gsad par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: The bodhisattva should not despise any bodhisattva.

original: sor mos zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo la sogs pa'i sor mo gcig gis ci yang bstan par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sor mos zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo la sogs pa'i sor mo gcig gis ci yang bstan par mi bya ste /
translated: As for “with a finger,” one should not point with any finger, such as the index finger, and so on.

original: 'on kyang kun gyis kyang ste lag pa g-yas pa mtha' dag gis bya'i /
analyzed: 'on kyang kun gyis kyang ste lag pa g-yas pa mtha' dag gis bya'i /
translated: Rather, one should point with the whole hand, with the whole right hand.

original: lag pa g-yon pas ni gus pa ma yin pa'i dngos po gzhan la re zhig zhog / lam yang bstan par mi bya'o zhes 'jig rten la ma dad pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pas ni gus pa ma yin pa'i dngos po gzhan la re zhig zhog / lam yang bstan par mi bya'o zhes 'jig rten la ma dad pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: With the left hand, respectfully means put aside for the moment other things that are not respectful, and do not show the path means do not show the path to the world.

original: lag pas shas cher zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lag pas shas cher zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to abandon disrespect for the world, he says, With the hand, etc.

original: dgos pa chung ngu la lag pa brten te 'ga' zhig la bod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dgos pa chung ngu la lag pa brten te 'ga' zhig la bod par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not, for a small purpose, extend the hand and give to some.

original: shin tu gal che ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: shin tu gal che ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if it is very important.

original: se gol gtogs pa la sogs pa'i sgra bya ste /
analyzed: se gol gtogs pa la sogs pa'i sgra bya ste /
translated: One should make a sound with the fingers snapping, etc.

original: de mi byed na mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang spyod pa ma bsdams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mi byed na mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang spyod pa ma bsdams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not do that, one will not be in equipoise and one will not be restrained in one's conduct.

original: de dag gis ni rgod pa spang ba yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni rgod pa spang ba yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: By that, abandoning agitation is also taught.

original: des nyal ba yongs su brtag pa ni 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya'o zhes bstan pa mgon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: des nyal ba yongs su brtag pa ni 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya'o zhes bstan pa mgon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The examination of sleep is taught by Thus, one should examine, etc. He says, The Lord, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa chen po gzims pa bzhin nyal ba brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa chen po gzims pa bzhin nyal ba brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should examine sleep as the Lord Bhagavat did when he lay down in great nirvana.

original: mngon par 'dod @105b pa'i phyogs su mgo bstan la glo g-yas pa phab ste rkang pa'i steng du rkang pa bzhag la /🔽lag pa g-yas pa sngas su byas nas g-yon pa'ang brkyang ste byin pa'i steng du gzhag la chos gos kyis lus legs par g-yogs pa /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod @105b pa'i phyogs su mgo bstan la glo g-yas pa phab ste rkang pa'i steng du rkang pa bzhag la / lag pa g-yas pa sngas su byas nas g-yon pa'ang brkyang ste byin pa'i steng du gzhag la chos gos kyis lus legs par g-yogs pa /
translated: He should lie down in the direction he wishes to proceed, on his right side, placing one foot on top of the other,🔽placing his right hand under his right cheek, and extending his left arm straight along his body.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas ldang ba'i 'du shes dang snang ba'i 'du shes kyis nyal bar byed de /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas ldang ba'i 'du shes dang snang ba'i 'du shes kyis nyal bar byed de /
translated: He should cover his body with his robe, and lie down mindfully and with clear awareness, with thoughts of rising, and with thoughts of light.

original: sems gnyid kyis non pa ma yin pa dang / gnyid kyi bde ba myong bar mi byed pa dang / ma nyes pa'i bde ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sems gnyid kyis non pa ma yin pa dang / gnyid kyi bde ba myong bar mi byed pa dang / ma nyes pa'i bde ba yang ma yin te /
translated: He should not be overcome by sleep, nor should he enjoy the pleasure of sleep, nor should he lie down in a way that is harmful.

original: gzhan du na ji tsam du 'byung ba chen po rnams gnas pa dang 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ji tsam du 'byung ba chen po rnams gnas pa dang 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Rather, he should lie down to the extent necessary to rest his body and to be comfortable.

original: myur du ldang ba ni skyen par ldang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: myur du ldang ba ni skyen par ldang bar bya ba'o //
translated: He should rise quickly, without delay.

original: bya rmyangs dang / lus gcu ba dang le los nyams pas gnas par mi bya ste /
analyzed: bya rmyangs dang / lus gcu ba dang le los nyams pas gnas par mi bya ste /
translated: He should not lie down in a way that is harmful, or in a way that is accompanied by torpor and sleepiness.

original: de dag thams cad kyang snga nas so //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang snga nas so //
translated: All of these are to be done beforehand.

original: gzhan yang 'di dag mdor bsdus te bstan pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di dag mdor bsdus te bstan pa /
translated: Moreover, these are taught in brief:

original: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The so-called “enlightenment” and so forth are stated.

original: bslab par bya ba tshad med cing grangs med pa byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa la sogs pa las rab tu bstan pa de dag bsdus pa'i tshul dang po nyid du sems sbyang ba nyid kyi spyod pa nges par gdon mi za bar spyad par bya'o
analyzed: bslab par bya ba tshad med cing grangs med pa byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa la sogs pa las rab tu bstan pa de dag bsdus pa'i tshul dang po nyid du sems sbyang ba nyid kyi spyod pa nges par gdon mi za bar spyad par bya'o
translated: The training, which is immeasurable and countless, is fully taught in the Bodhisattva’s Vows of Liberation and so forth. Those should be practiced in the manner of gathering them. The conduct of training the mind itself should definitely be practiced from the very beginning.

original: // ltung ba spyir sbyong ba /🔽nyin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: // ltung ba spyir sbyong ba / nyin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
