translated: The General Purification of Downfalls🔽Day and night, three times, the three heaps

original: nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du phung po gsum pa ste /
analyzed: nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du phung po gsum pa ste /
translated: Day and night, three times, the three heaps

original: phung po gsum po rnams ni sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / byang chub tu bsngo ba rnams kyis mdor bsdus pa'i phung po gsum pa rab tu gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: phung po gsum po rnams ni sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / byang chub tu bsngo ba rnams kyis mdor bsdus pa'i phung po gsum pa rab tu gdon par bya'o //
translated: The three heaps are the confession of misdeeds, rejoicing in merit, and the dedication to enlightenment. The three heaps should be recited in brief.

original: lhag ma ni rtsa ba las gzhan pa'am /
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtsa ba las gzhan pa'am /
translated: The rest are other than the root.

original: yang na bsams bzhin du byas pa gang slar bcos pa ste /
analyzed: yang na bsams bzhin du byas pa gang slar bcos pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is the restoration of whatever was done intentionally.

original: de las gzhan pa'am /🔽dran pa brjed ngas pa'am /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'am / dran pa brjed ngas pa'am /
translated: Other than that,🔽it is the pacification of whatever was done through forgetfulness or lack of vigilance.

original: shes bzhin ma yin pas byas pa de dag rab tu zhi bar bya ba ni phyir bcos pa ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin ma yin pas byas pa de dag rab tu zhi bar bya ba ni phyir bcos pa ste /
translated: That is the restoration.

original: des zhes pa ni phung po gsum 'don pa dang / byang chub kyi sems dang / rgyal ba bcom ldan 'das la yang dag par brten pas so //
analyzed: des zhes pa ni phung po gsum 'don pa dang / byang chub kyi sems dang / rgyal ba bcom ldan 'das la yang dag par brten pas so //
translated: The three lines beginning “I go for refuge to the Exalted One” refer to the recitation of the three-part confession, the thought of awakening, and the reliance on the Victorious One, the Exalted One.

original: de dag gis rnam par sun 'byin pa kun tu spyod pa la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis rnam par sun 'byin pa kun tu spyod pa la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: These lines teach the practice of remorse.

original: de la sdig pa sbyang ba ni chos bzhi pa'i mdo las bstan pa /🔽byams pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos bzhi dang ldan na sdig @106a * //
analyzed: de la sdig pa sbyang ba ni chos bzhi pa'i mdo las bstan pa / byams pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos bzhi dang ldan na sdig @106a * //
translated: The purification of evil is taught in the Sūtra on the Four Qualities:

original: pa byas shing bsags pa zil gyis non par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa byas shing bsags pa zil gyis non par 'gyur ro //
translated: Maitreya, if bodhisattva mahāsattvas have four qualities, then the evil they have done and accumulated will be overcome.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste rnam par sun 'byin pa kun tu spyod pa dang / gnyen po kun tu spyod pa dang / nyes pa bzlog pa'i stobs dang / rten gyi stobs so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rnam par sun 'byin pa kun tu spyod pa dang / gnyen po kun tu spyod pa dang / nyes pa bzlog pa'i stobs dang / rten gyi stobs so //
translated: They are the power of remorse, the power of the antidote, the power of turning away from faults, and the power of reliance.

original: de la rnam par sun 'byin pa kun tu spyod pa'i stobs ni /
analyzed: de la rnam par sun 'byin pa kun tu spyod pa'i stobs ni /
translated: The power of remorse is

original: mi dge ba'i las spyad na de nyid la 'gyod pa mang ba yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las spyad na de nyid la 'gyod pa mang ba yin no //
translated: to have much regret for having done nonvirtuous actions.

original: de la gnyen po kun tu spyod pa ni mi dge ba'i las byas nas kyang dge ba'i las la shin tu brtson pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnyen po kun tu spyod pa ni mi dge ba'i las byas nas kyang dge ba'i las la shin tu brtson pa'o //
translated: The power of the antidote is to strive very much at virtuous actions after having done nonvirtuous actions.

original: de la nyes pa bzlog pa'i stobs ni sdom pa yang dag par blangs nas mi byed pa'i sdom pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyes pa bzlog pa'i stobs ni sdom pa yang dag par blangs nas mi byed pa'i sdom pa thob pa'o //
translated: The power of turning away from faults is to attain the restraint of not doing [a misdeed] again after having taken a vow.

original: de la rten gyi stobs ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba ste /
analyzed: de la rten gyi stobs ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba ste /
translated: The power of reliance is to go for refuge to the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, and not to give up the thought of awakening.

original: de stobs dang ldan pa la brten nas sdig pa byas pas zil gyis gnon par mi nus so //
analyzed: de stobs dang ldan pa la brten nas sdig pa byas pas zil gyis gnon par mi nus so //
translated: Because one relies on these powerful [forces], one cannot be overcome by the misdeeds one has done.

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi po de dag dang ldan na sdig pa byas shing bsags pa zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi po de dag dang ldan na sdig pa byas shing bsags pa zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: Maitreya, if bodhisattvas have these four qualities, they will overcome the evil they have done.

original: khyad par du byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba lci ba dang yang ba rnams kyi bshags par bya ba ni 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las gsungs te /
analyzed: khyad par du byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba lci ba dang yang ba rnams kyi bshags par bya ba ni 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las gsungs te /
translated: In particular, the noble Kṣudravarga’s Questions Sūtra teaches the confession of the serious and slight downfalls of bodhisattvas:

original: de dag bslab pa kun las btus par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag bslab pa kun las btus par blta bar bya'o //
translated: You should look at the Compendium of Trainings for the confession of all the downfalls of bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpas ltung ba thams cad sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sum cu rtsa lnga'i spyan sngar gcig pus bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ltung ba thams cad sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sum cu rtsa lnga'i spyan sngar gcig pus bshags par bya'o //
translated: A bodhisattva should confess all downfalls in the presence of thirty-five Blessed Buddhas.

original: de la bshags pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bshags pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The confession is as follows:

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba sangs rgyas la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams na ;
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba sangs rgyas la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams na ;
translated: “I, named so-and-so, go for refuge to the Buddha. ”

original: dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'a kya thub pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'a kya thub pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened Buddha Śākyamuni.

original: rdo rje snying pos rab tu 'joms pa la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos rab tu 'joms pa la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Homage to Vajra Essence, the Thoroughly Subjugator.

original: thal mo sbyar bar bgyis te skyabs su nye bar mchi zhes bya ba'i bar rgya cher bstan nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: thal mo sbyar bar bgyis te skyabs su nye bar mchi zhes bya ba'i bar rgya cher bstan nas gsungs pa /
translated: Having joined the palms together, I go for refuge.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas sum cu rtsa lnga po 'di dag la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba yid la byed pas sdig pa rnam @106b par dag par bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas sum cu rtsa lnga po 'di dag la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba yid la byed pas sdig pa rnam @106b par dag par bya'o //
translated: Thus, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva should purify his misdeeds by attending to all the tathāgatas, beginning with these thirty-five buddhas.

original: de ltar sdig pa rnam par dag par gyur pas de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams zhal nye bar ston to //
analyzed: de ltar sdig pa rnam par dag par gyur pas de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams zhal nye bar ston to //
translated: As his misdeeds are purified in this way, the blessed buddhas show their faces to him.

original: de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Thus it is connected.

original: byang chub sems dpas nyin mtshan du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi mtshan 'dzin pa dang / yongs su brjod pa dang / phung po gsum pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs gdon pas ltung ba 'gyod pa las byung ba dang / ting nge 'dzin yang thob pa gang yin pa de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ba thams cad kyi ltung ba 'gyod pa'i gnas rnam par sbyang bar mi nus so zhes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas nyin mtshan du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi mtshan 'dzin pa dang / yongs su brjod pa dang / phung po gsum pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs gdon pas ltung ba 'gyod pa las byung ba dang / ting nge 'dzin yang thob pa gang yin pa de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ba thams cad kyi ltung ba 'gyod pa'i gnas rnam par sbyang bar mi nus so zhes so //
translated: The bodhisattva who holds the names of those Buddha Bhagavats day and night, and recites the Tripiṭaka Dharma Collection, will attain the remorse that arises from downfalls and also attain meditative concentration. That is not able to purify the downfalls and bases of remorse of all those in the vehicles of the hearers and solitary realizers.

original: de dag ma lus par bslab pa kun las btus pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ma lus par bslab pa kun las btus pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: All of that should be understood from the Compendium of Trainings.

original: rnam par sun 'byin pa kun tu spyod pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par sun 'byin pa kun tu spyod pa bstan to //
translated: The practice of remorse has been explained.

original: gnyen po kun tu spyod pa dang / nyes pa bzlog pa'i stobs kyang rgyas par bslab pa kun las btus pa nyid las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po kun tu spyod pa dang / nyes pa bzlog pa'i stobs kyang rgyas par bslab pa kun las btus pa nyid las blta bar bya'o //
translated: The practice of the antidote and the power of turning away from faults should be understood in detail from the Compendium of Trainings itself.

original: 'phags pa byams pa'i rnam par thar pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa'i rnam par thar pa las /
translated: In the Liberation of Maitreya it says:

original: byang chub kyi sems kyis sdig pa rnam par dag par gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyis sdig pa rnam par dag par gsungs te /
translated: It is taught that evil is purified by the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de yang sngar bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang sngar bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: And that has been taught above.

original: rgyal ba la brten nas sdig pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba ni phag mo'i rtogs pa brjod pa dper bya ste /
analyzed: rgyal ba la brten nas sdig pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba ni phag mo'i rtogs pa brjod pa dper bya ste /
translated: As for the purification of evil by means of the Victor, the story of the Sow is an example.

original: gang dag sangs rgyas skyabs song ba //
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas skyabs song ba //
translated: Those who have gone to the Buddha for refuge

original: de dag ngan 'gror 'gro mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag ngan 'gror 'gro mi 'gyur //
translated: will not go to the evil destinies.

original: mi yi lus 'di spangs nas su //
analyzed: mi yi lus 'di spangs nas su //
translated: Having abandoned this human body,

original: de dag lha yi lus 'thob bo //
analyzed: de dag lha yi lus 'thob bo //
translated: they will obtain a divine body.

original: zhes te / de ltar chos dang dge 'dun gyi dbang du byas nas kyang brjod do //
analyzed: zhes te / de ltar chos dang dge 'dun gyi dbang du byas nas kyang brjod do //
translated: And so it is said with reference to the Dharma and the Community.

original: 'dis kyang gnyen po'i stobs bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang gnyen po'i stobs bstan to //
translated: This also teaches the power of the antidote.

original: yang nges pa med par bstan pa /🔽rang ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang nges pa med par bstan pa / rang ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Again, the absence of certainty is taught:🔽One’s own, or that of another, or for the sake of a sentient being,

original: rang ste bdag nyid dam gzhan la rag las pa'ang rung ste sems can gyi don la rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rang ste bdag nyid dam gzhan la rag las pa'ang rung ste sems can gyi don la rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: one should enter into it.

original: yang ci ltar nges pa med par brjod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci ltar nges pa med par brjod ce na /
translated: And how is the absence of certainty stated?

original: rgyal sras zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyal sras zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The text says the so-called 'children of the victors,' etc.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad kyi de kho na nyid rnam pa thams cad du khong du chud nas thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub pa'i don du brtson pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sras po rnams kyis bslab par bya ba gnag yin pa de ni
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad kyi de kho na nyid rnam pa thams cad du khong du chud nas thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub pa'i don du brtson pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sras po rnams kyis bslab par bya ba gnag yin pa de ni
translated: Because, having understood the reality of all things in all aspects, the children of the Buddha strive to accomplish the benefit and happiness of all.

original: cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /🔽gzhan du na sems can gyi don thams @107a * //
analyzed: cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te / gzhan du na sems can gyi don thams @107a * //
translated: There is not the slightest thing that they should learn.🔽Otherwise, they would not be able to accomplish the aims of all sentient beings.

original: cad du bya bar mi nus la de ltar nam par spyod pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyang mthar thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cad du bya bar mi nus la de ltar nam par spyod pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyang mthar thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the practice of that would be an inexhaustible accumulation of merit.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi'i rgyu 'di yang gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi'i rgyu 'di yang gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: This is the cause of the basis of training.

original: dngos sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: It is said, directly or indirectly, etc.

original: tha na rang zas la sogs pa byed pa'am /🔽gzhan bskul ba'am /
analyzed: tha na rang zas la sogs pa byed pa'am / gzhan bskul ba'am /
translated: Even if it is just for one's own food, etc.🔽Or if one encourages others.

original: brgyud nas pho nya bskul ba'am /
analyzed: brgyud nas pho nya bskul ba'am /
translated: Or indirectly, by encouraging messengers.

original: dngos su rang nyid zang zing gi sbyin pa la sogs pa byed pa'ang rung ste /
analyzed: dngos su rang nyid zang zing gi sbyin pa la sogs pa byed pa'ang rung ste /
translated: directly.

original: gang sems can rnams kyi phan pa dang bde ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba de mi bya'am byed du mi gzhug go //
analyzed: gang sems can rnams kyi phan pa dang bde ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba de mi bya'am byed du mi gzhug go //
translated: One should not do or cause others to do anything that is not a cause of the benefit and happiness of sentient beings.

original: de dag 'ba' zhig tsam ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag 'ba' zhig tsam ni ma yin te /
translated: And not only that.

original: 'khor ba sdug bsngal bar ltung ba'i sems can rnams de nas dbyung ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu'ang thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba sdug bsngal bar ltung ba'i sems can rnams de nas dbyung ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu'ang thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: In order to rescue sentient beings who have fallen into the suffering of cyclic existence, one should dedicate all the roots of virtue to supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po de dag gis ni bsod nams 'phel ba nye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po de dag gis ni bsod nams 'phel ba nye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: These two verses show the increase of merit.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi gtong zhing //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi gtong zhing //
translated: One should not abandon the spiritual teacher.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa de rtag par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa de rtag par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: This is what is taught by the verse beginning with “constantly.”

original: dge ba ni mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa 'thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi las so //
analyzed: dge ba ni mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa 'thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi las so //
translated: Virtue is action characterized by the attainment of high status and the definite good.

original: gnyen ni thun mong ma yin pa'i nye ba ste /
analyzed: gnyen ni thun mong ma yin pa'i nye ba ste /
translated: A friend is a very close relative.

original: de lus dang srog chud za ba'i 'jigs pas 'jigs kyang mi btang ngo //
analyzed: de lus dang srog chud za ba'i 'jigs pas 'jigs kyang mi btang ngo //
translated: Even if one is afraid of the danger of losing one's body and life, one should not abandon him.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi phan yon yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i rtag par rab tu ngu ba'i le'u las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi phan yon yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i rtag par rab tu ngu ba'i le'u las shes par bya'o //
translated: The benefits of the spiritual teacher should be understood from the chapter on Sadaprarudita in the Astasahasrika Prajnaparamita.

original: chos bzhi pa'i mdor yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: chos bzhi pa'i mdor yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also stated in the Catuh-pari-ishad-sutra:

original: dge slong dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji srid 'tsho ba'i bar du dge ba'i bshes gnyen srog gi phyir yang gtang bar mi bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: dge slong dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji srid 'tsho ba'i bar du dge ba'i bshes gnyen srog gi phyir yang gtang bar mi bya'o zhes so //
translated: Bhikshus, a bodhisattva-mahasattva should not abandon the spiritual teacher even for the sake of his life.

original: yongs su mi gtang ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: yongs su mi gtang ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The definition of the spiritual teacher who is not to be abandoned is stated:

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa'i sdom pa la rnam par gnas shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa'i sdom pa la rnam par gnas shing /
translated: The bodhisattva means one who is established in the vow of training.

original: theg pa chen po'i don la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i don la mkhas pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the Mahayana means skill in the meaning of the Mahayana.

original: shin tu rnyed par dka' ba de lta bu'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnyed par dka' ba de lta bu'o //
translated: Very difficult to find means just that.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bsnyen bkur yongs su shes par bya ba'i don du dpal 'byung ba'i zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bsnyen bkur yongs su shes par bya ba'i don du dpal 'byung ba'i zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to understand the service to the spiritual master, he says, “the chapter on the glorious origin.”

original: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo le'u dpal 'byung ba'i rnam par @107b par thar pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo le'u dpal 'byung ba'i rnam par @107b par thar pa las /
translated: In the noble Array of Stalks Sūtra, in the chapter called “The glorious origin,”

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bsnyen bkur bslab par bya ste shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bsnyen bkur bslab par bya ste shes par bya'o //
translated: it says, “You should learn the service to the spiritual master.”

original: ji skad du 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las /
translated: As the noble Array of Stalks Sūtra says,

original: 'phags pa dpal 'byung gis bstan pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dpal 'byung gis bstan pa /
translated: Noble One, the teaching of Śrīsaṃbhava🔽says, ‘Bodhisattvas who are supported by a spiritual master do not fall into bad rebirths.’

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yang dag par zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ngan 'gror ma ltung ngo zhes bya ba nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni bya ba ma yin pa rnams khong du chud par byed pa'o //🔽bag med pa'i gnas las yang dag par bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yang dag par zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ngan 'gror ma ltung ngo zhes bya ba nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni bya ba ma yin pa rnams khong du chud par byed pa'o // bag med pa'i gnas las yang dag par bzlog pa'o //
translated: And so on up to: ‘The spiritual master causes you to understand what should not be done.🔽He turns you away from the state of heedlessness.

original: 'khor ba'i grong khyer nas 'don pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i grong khyer nas 'don pa'o //
translated: He takes you out of the city of cyclic existence.

original: rigs kyi bu de lta bas na de ltar yid la bya ba rgyun ma chad pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyi drung du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de lta bas na de ltar yid la bya ba rgyun ma chad pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyi drung du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, son of good family, you should go to the spiritual teachers with such an attitude, without interruption.

original: khur thams cad bkur bas yongs su mi skyo bas sa lta bu'i sems dang / bsam pa mi phyed pas rdo rje lta bu'i sems dang / sdug bsngal thams cad kyis mi bsgul ba'i phyir khor yug lta bu'i sems dang / las thams cad nyams su blang ba la mi smod pas 'jig rten gyi bran lta bu'i sems dang /
analyzed: khur thams cad bkur bas yongs su mi skyo bas sa lta bu'i sems dang / bsam pa mi phyed pas rdo rje lta bu'i sems dang / sdug bsngal thams cad kyis mi bsgul ba'i phyir khor yug lta bu'i sems dang / las thams cad nyams su blang ba la mi smod pas 'jig rten gyi bran lta bu'i sems dang /
translated: You should have an attitude like the earth, not getting tired from carrying all burdens. You should have an attitude like a diamond, with an unbreakable intention. You should have an attitude like a mountain range, not being shaken by any suffering. You should have an attitude like a servant of the world, not criticizing any action you are asked to do.

original: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal rnam par spong bas phyag dar ba lta bu'i sems dang / khur lci ba khur bas theg pa lta bu'i sems dang / mi khro bas khyi lta bu'i sems dang / 'gro zhing 'ong bas yongs su mi skyo ba'i gru lta bu'i sems dang /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal rnam par spong bas phyag dar ba lta bu'i sems dang / khur lci ba khur bas theg pa lta bu'i sems dang / mi khro bas khyi lta bu'i sems dang / 'gro zhing 'ong bas yongs su mi skyo ba'i gru lta bu'i sems dang /
translated: You should have an attitude like a sweeper, abandoning pride and great pride. You should have an attitude like a vehicle, carrying heavy loads. You should have an attitude like a dog, not getting angry. You should have an attitude like a boat, not getting tired from going and coming.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi ngor lta bas bu mdzangs pa lta bu'i sems kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi ngor lta bas bu mdzangs pa lta bu'i sems kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: You should serve and respect spiritual teachers with a mind like a good son, looking up at the face of the spiritual teacher.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyi bdag la ni nang par 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyi bdag la ni nang par 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Noble sir, you should think of yourself as a patient,🔽of the spiritual teacher as a doctor,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni sman pa'i 'du shes dang / rjes su bstan pa la ni sman gyi 'du shes des /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni sman pa'i 'du shes dang / rjes su bstan pa la ni sman gyi 'du shes des /
translated: of the teachings as medicine,

original: nan tan nyams su blang ba la ni nad 'tsho ba'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: nan tan nyams su blang ba la ni nad 'tsho ba'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
translated: and of the practice of the teachings as the cure for the disease.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis bdag la ni 'jigs pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis bdag la ni 'jigs pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Noble sir, you should think of yourself as a coward,🔽of the spiritual teacher as a hero,🔽of the teachings as weapons,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni dpa' bo'i 'du shes dang / rjes su bstan pa la ni mtshon cha'i 'du shes dang / nan tan la ni dgra sel ba'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni dpa' bo'i 'du shes dang / rjes su bstan pa la ni mtshon cha'i 'du shes dang / nan tan la ni dgra sel ba'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and of the practice of the teachings as the destruction of the enemy.

original: mdo sde dag la rtag lta bas //
analyzed: mdo sde dag la rtag lta bas //
translated: Always look at the scriptures.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pha /🔽'di dang zhes pa bstan bcos @108a * //
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pha / 'di dang zhes pa bstan bcos @108a * //
translated: In order to teach that, he says:

original: 'dir bstan pa 'di dang / gzhan yang ste gang 'dir ma bstan pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa bstan pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir bstan pa 'di dang / gzhan yang ste gang 'dir ma bstan pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa bstan pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Here and elsewhere, the Lord has taught the bodhisattvas’ training.

original: mdo sde sna tshogs pa'i don de dag 'dris par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde sna tshogs pa'i don de dag 'dris par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that the meaning of the various sūtras is familiar to you.

original: de nyid ni mdo sde rnams la ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni mdo sde rnams la ste /
translated: That very training is taught in the sūtras.

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde dkon mchog sprin la sogs pa rnams na'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde dkon mchog sprin la sogs pa rnams na'o //
translated: In the Mahāyāna sūtras such as the Cloud of Jewels.

original: bslab pa snang zhes pas ston pa yin te /
analyzed: bslab pa snang zhes pas ston pa yin te /
translated: The training is illuminated.

original: bslab pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bslab pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The training is the characteristic of what the bodhisattvas should adopt and what they should cast aside.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir khyad par 'di bstan pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir khyad par 'di bstan pa /
translated: Because it is so, this distinction is taught.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The sky, etc. is stated.

original: 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las /
translated: The noble Akashagarbha Sutra teaches

original: rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba lnga dang / de bzhin du spyi'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba gcig dang / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i las dang po pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba brgyad bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba lnga dang / de bzhin du spyi'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba gcig dang / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i las dang po pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba brgyad bstan pa yin no //
translated: five root downfalls for a king who has been consecrated, one general root downfall, and eight root downfalls for a beginner bodhisattva.

original: de ltar yang de nyid las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang de nyid las gsungs pa /
translated: As it says in that very sutra:

original: rigs kyi bu rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba lnga ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba lnga ste /
translated: Son of noble family, there are five root downfalls for a king who has been consecrated.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba de dag gis rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon bskyed pa thams cad thal bar brlag ste pham par gyur cing lha dang mi'i bde ba'i dngos po thams cad bcad nas ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba de dag gis rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon bskyed pa thams cad thal bar brlag ste pham par gyur cing lha dang mi'i bde ba'i dngos po thams cad bcad nas ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ro /
translated: By these root downfalls, a king who has been consecrated destroys all the roots of virtue he has previously created, and having been defeated, he is cut off from all the happiness of gods and humans and goes to the lower realms.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: rigs kyi bu rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur bas mchod rten gyi rdzas 'phrog gam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur bas mchod rten gyi rdzas 'phrog gam /
translated: Son of noble family, if a member of the ruling class who has been consecrated on the crown of the head steals the property of a stūpa,

original: dge 'dun gyi 'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi 'am /
translated: or of the Saṅgha,

original: phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la phul ba 'phrog gam ;
analyzed: phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la phul ba 'phrog gam ;
translated: or of the Saṅgha of the four directions,

original: 'phrog tu 'jug pa 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang po'o //
analyzed: 'phrog tu 'jug pa 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang po'o //
translated: or if he orders it to be stolen, this is the first root downfall.

original: de bzhin du theg pa gsum du bshad pa'i chos spong ba ni gnyis pa'o //🔽rab tu byung ba tshul khrims dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du theg pa gsum du bshad pa'i chos spong ba ni gnyis pa'o // rab tu byung ba tshul khrims dang ldan pa'am /
translated: Similarly, the second is to abandon the Dharma that is taught in the three vehicles.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i ngur smig 'phrog pa'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i ngur smig 'phrog pa'am /
translated: The third is to deprive a monk of his saffron robes, whether he is morally disciplined or not,

original: khyim na gnas par byed pa'am /
analyzed: khyim na gnas par byed pa'am /
translated: to force him to become a layman,

original: lus la brdeg pa'am /
analyzed: lus la brdeg pa'am /
translated: to beat his body,

original: btson rar 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: btson rar 'jug pa'am /
translated: to imprison him,

original: srog dang bral bar byed pa las ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: srog dang bral bar byed pa las ni gsum pa'o //
translated: or to deprive him of life.

original: mtshams med pa lnga las gang yang rung ba'i mtshams med pa byed pa las ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga las gang yang rung ba'i mtshams med pa byed pa las ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is to commit any of the five heinous acts.

original: log par lta ba dang / mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs pa'am /
analyzed: log par lta ba dang / mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs pa'am /
translated: The fifth is to adopt wrong views and the paths of the ten nonvirtuous actions,

original: @108b gzhan yang dag par len du 'jug pa las ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: @108b gzhan yang dag par len du 'jug pa las ni lnga pa'o //
translated: Also, from causing another to take up what is right, there is the fifth.

original: de bzhin du grong 'joms pa la sogs pa byed pa las ni thams cad kyi thun mong ba gcig go zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du grong 'joms pa la sogs pa byed pa las ni thams cad kyi thun mong ba gcig go zhes so //
translated: Similarly, from committing the destruction of a village, and so on, there is one that is common to all.

original: de nyid las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid las gsungs pa /
translated: The same text says,

original: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa las dang po ba rnams kyi rtsa ba'i ltung ba ni brgyad de /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa las dang po ba rnams kyi rtsa ba'i ltung ba ni brgyad de /
translated: “Son of noble family, there are eight root downfalls for beginners who have entered the Great Vehicle.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba de dag gis theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i las dang po ba rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon bskyed pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba de dag gis theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i las dang po ba rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon bskyed pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: By those root downfalls, beginners who have entered the Great Vehicle destroy all their previously generated roots of virtue, and so on, as before.”

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: sems can gang dag sngon nyes par spyad pa'i rgyas snyigs ma lnga pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nyon mongs pa can 'dir skyes pa de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba chung la zhes bya ba nas de dag gi nang na stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i mdo sde mchog
analyzed: sems can gang dag sngon nyes par spyad pa'i rgyas snyigs ma lnga pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nyon mongs pa can 'dir skyes pa de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba chung la zhes bya ba nas de dag gi nang na stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i mdo sde mchog
translated: Those sentient beings who were born in this afflicted world system of the five degenerations due to the expansion of previous misdeeds have little root of virtue...

original: tu zab pa 'di zhes pa'i bar dang mdun du rgyas par dran par byed cing ston la /
analyzed: tu zab pa 'di zhes pa'i bar dang mdun du rgyas par dran par byed cing ston la /
translated: ...among them, this most profound sūtra endowed with emptiness is...🔽...they are ordinary beings who have not trained in earnest, having heard it they are frightened...

original: de dag ni nan tan du ma sbyangs pa'i byas pa so so'i skye bo dag ste mnyan nas skrag cing zhes bya ba'i bar dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems las phyir ldog ste /
analyzed: de dag ni nan tan du ma sbyangs pa'i byas pa so so'i skye bo dag ste mnyan nas skrag cing zhes bya ba'i bar dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems las phyir ldog ste /
translated: ...and turn back from the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,🔽if they aspire to the enlightenment of the śrāvakas, this is the first root downfall of a beginner bodhisattva.

original: nyan thos kyi byang chub la smon na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' las dang po ba'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang po ste rtsa ba'i ltung ba des zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi byang chub la smon na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' las dang po ba'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang po ste rtsa ba'i ltung ba des zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: ...by that root downfall...and so on is the same as before.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpas sems can pha rol dang gang zag pha rol gyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang por shes par byas nas sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthar gyis chos bstan par bya ba yin pa las thabs dang bcas pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las bzlog ste /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpas sems can pha rol dang gang zag pha rol gyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang por shes par byas nas sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthar gyis chos bstan par bya ba yin pa las thabs dang bcas pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las bzlog ste /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva first understands the thoughts, proclivities, and dispositions of other sentient beings and other persons, and then he should gradually teach the Dharma to sentient beings in accordance with their thoughts.

original: theg pa dman pa la gzhan gyi sems skyed par byed pa 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa dman pa la gzhan gyi sems skyed par byed pa 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second [root downfall], which causes one to turn away from the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment that is accompanied by skillful means and to generate the thought of the inferior vehicle in others.

original: so sor thar pa'i bslab pa'i sdom pa spangs nas theg pa chen po la sems bskyed pa tsam dang de klog pas pha rol dag par bstan pa las ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i bslab pa'i sdom pa spangs nas theg pa chen po la sems bskyed pa tsam dang de klog pas pha rol dag par bstan pa las ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third [root downfall] is to abandon the vows of individual liberation and to teach others that the generation of the thought of the Great Vehicle and the mere recitation of its scriptures are pure.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa dag de'i 'bras bu gsungs te /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa dag de'i 'bras bu gsungs te /
translated: The vehicles of the śrāvaka and so on are said to be the results of that [Great Vehicle].

original: nyes pa rab tu ston pa dang / theg pa chen po la ni thams cad dag par rab tu ston pa dang / gzhan dag kyang de brjod du 'jug pa las ni bzhi pa'o //🔽grags pa dang rnyed pa la @109a * //
analyzed: nyes pa rab tu ston pa dang / theg pa chen po la ni thams cad dag par rab tu ston pa dang / gzhan dag kyang de brjod du 'jug pa las ni bzhi pa'o // grags pa dang rnyed pa la @109a * //
translated: The fourth is teaching the faults of the Mahayana and causing others to speak in that way.

original: sogs pa'i rgyus theg pa chen po klog pa la sogs pa byed cing /
analyzed: sogs pa'i rgyus theg pa chen po klog pa la sogs pa byed cing /
translated: The fifth is reading the Mahayana and so on for the sake of fame, gain, and so on,

original: de bzhin du de'i rkyen gyis pha rol la bshung zhing smod pa la sogs pa smra ba dang / bdag la bstod pa dang / mi'i chos bla ma khas len pa las ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rkyen gyis pha rol la bshung zhing smod pa la sogs pa smra ba dang / bdag la bstod pa dang / mi'i chos bla ma khas len pa las ni lnga pa'o //
translated: and likewise, for that reason, speaking of others' faults and disparaging them and so on, and praising oneself and claiming to have supramundane qualities.

original: bklags pa tsam gyis zab mo'i chos rtogs par ston pa dang / gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du yang dag par len du 'jug pa las ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: bklags pa tsam gyis zab mo'i chos rtogs par ston pa dang / gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du yang dag par len du 'jug pa las ni drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is teaching that the profound Dharma is understood merely through reading and causing others to take it up in that way.🔽The seventh is when the king, ministers, and so on punish monks with fines and so on,

original: rgyal rigs mdun na 'don dang / zhang blon gdol pa rnams kyis dge slong gang dag la nor gyi chad pas chad pa bcad cing /🔽dge 'dun gyi 'am /
analyzed: rgyal rigs mdun na 'don dang / zhang blon gdol pa rnams kyis dge slong gang dag la nor gyi chad pas chad pa bcad cing / dge 'dun gyi 'am /
translated: and they take the property of the Sangha,🔽or of stupas,

original: mchod rten gyi 'am ;
analyzed: mchod rten gyi 'am ;
translated: or of the Three Jewels,🔽and give it to others.

original: phyogs bcu'i dge 'dun gyi rdzas phrogs nas de dag la 'bul bar byed de /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i dge 'dun gyi rdzas phrogs nas de dag la 'bul bar byed de /
translated: and he offers it to them.

original: rgyal rigs dang gnyi ga la yang rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur te 'di ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal rigs dang gnyi ga la yang rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur te 'di ni bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh root downfall.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa bzlog nas sngar med pa'i bslab pa ston pa dang / rtsa ba des cho ga nyams pa rnams dang bkur sti nyams par byed pa rnams kyis nye bar spyod pa dang / yongs su spyod pa la yongs su bsngos pa ma gtogs par gnyi gar yang rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa bzlog nas sngar med pa'i bslab pa ston pa dang / rtsa ba des cho ga nyams pa rnams dang bkur sti nyams par byed pa rnams kyis nye bar spyod pa dang / yongs su spyod pa la yongs su bsngos pa ma gtogs par gnyi gar yang rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: If one turns away from Dharma and non-Dharma, teaches a training not previously existing, and if one uses the property of the Sangha of the four directions, this is a root downfall for both.

original: 'di ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth root downfall.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba 'di dag bde blag tu bzung bar bya ba'i don du bstan bcos mdzad pas bsdus pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas bstan pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba 'di dag bde blag tu bzung bar bya ba'i don du bstan bcos mdzad pas bsdus pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas bstan pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: In order to easily grasp these root downfalls, the author of the treatise states them in verse:

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor rku ba //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor rku ba //
translated: Stealing the property of the Three Jewels

original: phas pham pa yi ltung bar 'dod //
analyzed: phas pham pa yi ltung bar 'dod //
translated: is considered a root downfall.

original: dam pa'i chos ni spong byed pa //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ni spong byed pa //
translated: Rejecting the true Dharma,

translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks, this root of virtue is so great that

original: bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis gang du bsrabs pa dang / yongs su byang ba dang / yongs su bas par 'gyur ba las bka' stsal pa /🔽nye ba 'khor ji srid du tshangs par spyod pa dam pas tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la sdang ba'i sems ma bskyed pa de srid du zad pa dang nyams par dus yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis gang du bsrabs pa dang / yongs su byang ba dang / yongs su bas par 'gyur ba las bka' stsal pa / nye ba 'khor ji srid du tshangs par spyod pa dam pas tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la sdang ba'i sems ma bskyed pa de srid du zad pa dang nyams par dus yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
translated: if the Blessed One were to say that it has been diminished, purified, and exhausted,🔽Upāli, I would not see any exhaustion or diminution of this root of virtue until such time as he has not generated a hostile mind toward a fellow practitioner of pure conduct.”

original: nye ba 'khor der dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po 'di yang bsrabs pa dang / yongs su byang ba dang / yongs su zad par 'gyur ba de lta bas na mgal du ma la yang sems kyis khro bar mi bya na rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus la lta ci zhig smos zhes so //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor der dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po 'di yang bsrabs pa dang / yongs su byang ba dang / yongs su zad par 'gyur ba de lta bas na mgal du ma la yang sems kyis khro bar mi bya na rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus la lta ci zhig smos zhes so //
translated: Upāli, since this great root of virtue has been diminished, purified, and exhausted, therefore, one should not even mentally generate hostility toward a firebrand, let alone toward a body that is endowed with consciousness.

original: de'i phyir zhe sdang lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhe sdang lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “There is no evil like hatred,” and so on.

original: zhe sdang lta bu'i sdig pa med do /
analyzed: zhe sdang lta bu'i sdig pa med do /
translated: There is no evil like hatred.

original: mi dge bas bsod nams zil gyis non pa'i rgyu med de /
analyzed: mi dge bas bsod nams zil gyis non pa'i rgyu med de /
translated: There is no merit that surpasses patience.

original: bzod pa sran tshugs pa lta bu dang mnyam pa'i dka' thub med do //
analyzed: bzod pa sran tshugs pa lta bu dang mnyam pa'i dka' thub med do //
translated: There is no austerity equal to patience.

original: shin tu ngal ba cher byas pas bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir legs spyad do //🔽gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir bzod pa ni bzod pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu ngal ba cher byas pas bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir legs spyad do // gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir bzod pa ni bzod pa ste /
translated: Good conduct is to be accomplished by great exertion.

original: lhur blang ba thams cad kyis bsgom par bya ste goms par bya'o //
analyzed: lhur blang ba thams cad kyis bsgom par bya ste goms par bya'o //
translated: Since that is so, therefore patience is to be cultivated by all means, i.e., by all efforts.

original: sna tshogs ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs pas so //
analyzed: sna tshogs ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs pas so //
translated: It is various, i.e., by means of the various methods which will be explained below.

original: mthong ba'i chos kyi nyes pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bstan pa zhe sdang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kyi nyes pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bstan pa zhe sdang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The faults in this life are taught in three verses, beginning with “Hatred.”

original: zhi ba ni rab tu zhi ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni rab tu zhi ba'o //
translated: Peace is complete peace.

original: nyams mi myong ni rten pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyams mi myong ni rten pa med pa'o //
translated: Not experiencing is not having a basis.

original: nye bar ma zhi ba nyid ni rtag tu zhe sdang @111b gi me 'bar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar ma zhi ba nyid ni rtag tu zhe sdang @111b gi me 'bar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not peaceful because the fire of hatred always burns.

original: dga' dang bde ba ni yid bde ba dang bde ba mi 'thob la mi rnyed pa ste des mnan pa'i phyir ro //🔽gnyid mi 'ong zhing rten med na sems bde ba thob pa med pa ste /
analyzed: dga' dang bde ba ni yid bde ba dang bde ba mi 'thob la mi rnyed pa ste des mnan pa'i phyir ro // gnyid mi 'ong zhing rten med na sems bde ba thob pa med pa ste /
translated: One does not obtain or find joy and happiness, i.e., mental pleasure and bodily pleasure, because one is oppressed by hatred.

original: lus dang sems kyi rgyun gdung bar byed pa'i zhe sdang zug rngu snying la gnas 'cha' bas so //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi rgyun gdung bar byed pa'i zhe sdang zug rngu snying la gnas 'cha' bas so //
translated: One does not get sleep or rest, i.e., one does not obtain mental pleasure, because the dart of hatred, which torments the continuum of body and mind, is lodged in the heart.

original: mchod pa ni bkur sti ste gang dag rnyed pa dang bkur sti rnams kyis so //
analyzed: mchod pa ni bkur sti ste gang dag rnyed pa dang bkur sti rnams kyis so //
translated: One is not fit for worship, i.e., for honor and gain, because one is not fit to be honored by those who are worthy of honor.

original: gang yang rjes su 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: gang yang rjes su 'tsho ba ste /
translated: One is not fit to be a companion, i.e.,

original: rje dpon zhe sdang can de la gnod par bya bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rje dpon zhe sdang can de la gnod par bya bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: one is not fit to be a master, because one is not fit to be served by those who wish to serve.

original: ci ste zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zhe sdang skal ngan te mi sdug pas zhes bya ba ste 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi tshig go //
analyzed: zhe sdang skal ngan te mi sdug pas zhes bya ba ste 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi tshig go //
translated: Because hatred is a misfortune, i.e., an unpleasantness. This is a statement of the reason.

original: mdza' bshes ni bshes pa rnams kyang skyo bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mdza' bshes ni bshes pa rnams kyang skyo bar 'gyur te /
translated: One’s friends, i.e., one’s acquaintances, become discouraged,

original: zhe sdang can des skrag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang can des skrag par 'gyur ro //
translated: because they are afraid of the angry person.

original: sbyin pa la phyogs kyang bran gyi tshogs rnams kyis sten par mi byed rjes su 'gro bar mi byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa la phyogs kyang bran gyi tshogs rnams kyis sten par mi byed rjes su 'gro bar mi byed do //
translated: Even if you are generous, your retinue of servants will not serve you, will not follow you.

original: mang du smra ci dgos /
analyzed: mang du smra ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to say much?

original: 'dir mdor na zhes bya ba 'di ni nges par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir mdor na zhes bya ba 'di ni nges par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Here, in brief, is what is to be understood:

original: gang gis khro bar byed pa la bde ba thob pa nye bar zhi ba'i rgyu de ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis khro bar byed pa la bde ba thob pa nye bar zhi ba'i rgyu de ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is not the slightest cause for the attainment of happiness for one who is angry.

original: sems kyi rtsub pa'i gnas ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: sems kyi rtsub pa'i gnas ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Anger is the abode of the mind’s coarseness.

original: de las byung ba'i 'jug pa ni khro ba ste /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'jug pa ni khro ba ste /
translated: Its activity is anger,

original: gang gi dbang gis dbyug pa la sogs pa len par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis dbyug pa la sogs pa len par byed pa'o //
translated: by the power of which one takes up a stick, etc.

original: de ltar tha dad pa gnyi ga yang spang bar bya ba nyid kyis tha mi dad par bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar tha dad pa gnyi ga yang spang bar bya ba nyid kyis tha mi dad par bstan te /
translated: Thus, both of these, which are different, are taught to be undifferentiated by the fact that they are to be abandoned.

original: de bzhin du 'dir mthong ba'i chos la yang zhe sdang gi nyes pa rtogs par byas nas de spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'bad rtsol dang ldan par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir mthong ba'i chos la yang zhe sdang gi nyes pa rtogs par byas nas de spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'bad rtsol dang ldan par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: In the same way, here, having understood the fault of anger in this life, one should strive to abandon it.

original: khro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: khro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: “Anger” and so on.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa'i rnam pas gang gi phyir sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa'i rnam pas gang gi phyir sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa de'i phyir /
translated: In the manner stated, because it produces suffering,

original: gang zhig legs par spyad pa'i bdag nyid kyis bsgrims te drag tu mngon par zhen pas te /
analyzed: gang zhig legs par spyad pa'i bdag nyid kyis bsgrims te drag tu mngon par zhen pas te /
translated: “Whoever, by the nature of good conduct, is intent, is very attached,

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: has undertaken striving,” is the meaning.

original: de ni 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol du bde'o //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol du bde'o //
translated: He is happy in this world and the next.

original: da ni zhe sdang gzhom par bya ba'i ched du de la rgyu gzhom par bya ba'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa mdzad pa mi 'dod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni zhe sdang gzhom par bya ba'i ched du de la rgyu gzhom par bya ba'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa mdzad pa mi 'dod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to conquer hatred, he states the arrangement for the purpose of conquering its cause, “He does not wish to destroy it,” and so on.

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa las byung ba ste /
translated: Desire and aversion arise from the apprehension of “I” and “mine.”

original: bdag dang bdag gi la bde ba bsgrub pa ni 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi la bde ba bsgrub pa ni 'dod pa ste /
translated: The attainment of happiness in “I” and “mine” is desire.

original: de las bzlog pa ni mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is aversion.

original: @112a * // de ltar na de dag ni rtog pa byas su blad kyi /
analyzed: @112a * // de ltar na de dag ni rtog pa byas su blad kyi /
translated: Thus, they are mere conceptual superimpositions.

original: don dam par ni 'dod pa'am mi 'dod par srid pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: don dam par ni 'dod pa'am mi 'dod par srid pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: But in reality, there is not the slightest possibility of either desire or aversion.

original: de lta bas na log par mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis mi 'dod pa byas pa dang 'dod pa bshig pas yid mi bde ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na log par mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis mi 'dod pa byas pa dang 'dod pa bshig pas yid mi bde ba ste /
translated: Therefore, when one acts in a way that is not desired, or when one fails to get what is desired, one becomes unhappy,

original: yid la sdug bsngal 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yid la sdug bsngal 'byung ngo //
translated: and mental suffering arises.

original: de lta bas na de byed pa'am de dang 'gal bar byed pa la zhe sdang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na de byed pa'am de dang 'gal bar byed pa la zhe sdang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, hatred arises in regard to the one who does that, or in regard to the one who causes an obstacle to that.

original: de ltar na zas nus pa dang ldan pa yid mi bde ba nyid la brten nas stobs yod pa dang zhe sdang gis bdag 'joms so snyam du nges par byas nas de rgyas pa'i rgyu nyid dang por gzhom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zas nus pa dang ldan pa yid mi bde ba nyid la brten nas stobs yod pa dang zhe sdang gis bdag 'joms so snyam du nges par byas nas de rgyas pa'i rgyu nyid dang por gzhom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that one’s own self is destroyed by mental unhappiness and hatred, which are nourished by food and have strength. Having understood this, one should first destroy the cause of their growth.

original: de bcom pas ni bde ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bcom pas ni bde ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: By destroying that, one becomes happy,

original: de'i rtsa ba bcom pa'i phyir dang / rtsa ba dang bcas pa'i bcom pa ni slar ldang ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba bcom pa'i phyir dang / rtsa ba dang bcas pa'i bcom pa ni slar ldang ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the root is destroyed, and because it is not reasonable that what is destroyed along with its root should arise again.

original: 'o na khyed kyis shin tu mngon par zhen pa 'di ci lta bu yin zhe na /🔽de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: 'o na khyed kyis shin tu mngon par zhen pa 'di ci lta bu yin zhe na / de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: Well then, what is this extreme attachment of yours?🔽He says, “I have no other thought day or night than to harm myself.”

original: gang gi phyir bdag la gnod pa ma gtogs pa zhe sdang gi dgra 'di la nyin dang mtshan du gzhan cung zad kyang bya ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag la gnod pa ma gtogs pa zhe sdang gi dgra 'di la nyin dang mtshan du gzhan cung zad kyang bya ba med do //
translated: For this reason, this enemy of hatred has no other thought day or night than to harm me.

original: de ltar zhe sdang nyes pa dang ldan pa rnam par bsgoms la thabs thams cad kyis de'i gnyen por gyur pa bzod pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhe sdang nyes pa dang ldan pa rnam par bsgoms la thabs thams cad kyis de'i gnyen por gyur pa bzod pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Having thus contemplated the faults of hatred, one should generate patience toward it, as it is the antidote to hatred.

original: de la bzod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /🔽chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las bshad pa /
analyzed: de la bzod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste / chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las bshad pa /
translated: Patience is of three kinds:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: as explained in the Sūtra on Chanting the Dharma Together:🔽Patience in putting up with pain;🔽patience in accepting the Dharma;

original: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa dang / gzhan zhig gis gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'o zhes so /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa dang / gzhan zhig gis gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'o zhes so /
translated: and patience in not retaliating when another harms you.

original: de la re zhig sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de la re zhig sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: First, with regard to patience in putting up with pain, it says:

original: ci la bab kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci la bab kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Whatever happens, etc.

original: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mi 'dod pa byung ba la brten nas sdug bsngal bas 'jigs pa dang / 'dod pa'i gegs la brten nas bde ba la chags pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mi 'dod pa byung ba la brten nas sdug bsngal bas 'jigs pa dang / 'dod pa'i gegs la brten nas bde ba la chags pa ste /
translated: The resistances to the patience of accepting suffering are fear of suffering based on the occurrence of what is unwanted, and attachment to pleasure based on the prevention of what is unwanted.

original: de dag gis ni yid mi bde la /🔽de las sems zhe sdang ba'am /
analyzed: de dag gis ni yid mi bde la / de las sems zhe sdang ba'am /
translated: These cause mental dissatisfaction.🔽From that, the mind becomes hateful

original: zhum par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhum par 'gyur ro //
translated: or depressed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zla ba'i sgron ma'i mdo las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zla ba'i sgron ma'i mdo las /
translated: That is why the Candrapradīpa Sūtra says,

original: bde ba la mi chags pa dang / sdug bsngal la phyir mi phyogs par mi bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: bde ba la mi chags pa dang / sdug bsngal la phyir mi phyogs par mi bya'o zhes so //
translated: “Do not be attached to pleasure, and do not turn away from suffering.”

original: dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las @112b kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las @112b kyang gsungs te /
translated: The Ratnamegha Sūtra also says,

original: gang nang gi mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang 'khrugs pa de dag bzod cing dang du len to zhes so //
analyzed: gang nang gi mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang 'khrugs pa de dag bzod cing dang du len to zhes so //
translated: “Whatever internal grief, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and mental disturbance there is, that is endured and tolerated.”

original: de bas na gal te bdag gi mgo gcod na de lta na yang bdag gis dga' ba dkrug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gal te bdag gi mgo gcod na de lta na yang bdag gis dga' ba dkrug par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if my head is cut off, I will not disturb my joy.

original: khong nas ldang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: khong nas ldang bar mi bya'o //
translated: I will not rise up in anger.

original: dga' ba ni yid mi bde ba'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: dga' ba ni yid mi bde ba'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: Joy is the antidote to mental dissatisfaction.

original: sdug bsngal byung yang sems rab tu dga' ba la yid mi bde ba'i go skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal byung yang sems rab tu dga' ba la yid mi bde ba'i go skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When suffering occurs, if the mind is very joyful, there is no opportunity for mental dissatisfaction.

original: de ltar yid mi bde ba spang bar bya ba'i phyir dga' bas 'bad pas bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yid mi bde ba spang bar bya ba'i phyir dga' bas 'bad pas bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, in order to abandon mental dissatisfaction, one should protect the mind with effort through joy.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yid mi bde ba byas kyang 'dod pa'i gegs yod na 'dod pa mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba byas kyang 'dod pa'i gegs yod na 'dod pa mi 'grub ste /
translated: If mental dissatisfaction is produced, when there is an obstacle to desire, the desired goal is not accomplished.

original: mngon par 'dod pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The desired goal is not achieved.

original: 'di ni khyad par du yod de yang dge ba nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par du yod de yang dge ba nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is a special point: virtue is impaired.

original: yid dga' ba yang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las rab tu bsngags te /
analyzed: yid dga' ba yang 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las rab tu bsngags te /
translated: Moreover, joy is highly praised in the noble Aksayamatinirdesa:

original: de la dga' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dga' ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is joy?

original: gang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dran pa dang / rjes su dran pa la dga' ba dang / dad pa dang mchog tu dga' ba dang / sems mi 'gong zhing mi brdzi ba dang / 'dod pa'i dga' ba med pa dang / 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad btang bas chos kyi dga' ba thams cad kyi rten dang /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dran pa dang / rjes su dran pa la dga' ba dang / dad pa dang mchog tu dga' ba dang / sems mi 'gong zhing mi brdzi ba dang / 'dod pa'i dga' ba med pa dang / 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad btang bas chos kyi dga' ba thams cad kyi rten dang /
translated: It is to be delighted in the recollection of the Buddha’s qualities, to have faith in them, to have supreme delight in them, to have a mind that is not discouraged or overwhelmed by them, to be without the delight of desire, and to have given up all the delights of desire.

original: sems rab tu dga' ba dang / lus rab tu tshim pa dang / sangs rgyas la dga' zhing yid 'phar ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la dga' zhing mos pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher brjod do //
analyzed: sems rab tu dga' ba dang / lus rab tu tshim pa dang / sangs rgyas la dga' zhing yid 'phar ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la dga' zhing mos pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher brjod do //
translated: It is to have the support of all the delights of the Dharma, to have a mind that is delighted, a body that is satisfied, to have delight in the Buddha and to have a mind that is uplifted, and to have delight in and devotion to the body of the Tathāgata.

original: gzhan yang yid mi bde ba ni ma spyad pas skye ba yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang yid mi bde ba ni ma spyad pas skye ba yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that mental dissatisfaction arises from not having practiced.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: It is said:🔽“If one does not practice mental satisfaction, mental dissatisfaction arises.”

original: gal te 'dod pa'i gegs bzlog pa'i phyir dang mi 'dod pa byung ba phyir bcos pa'i thabs gzhan yod na de'i tshe de la mi dgar ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa'i gegs bzlog pa'i phyir dang mi 'dod pa byung ba phyir bcos pa'i thabs gzhan yod na de'i tshe de la mi dgar ci zhig yod /
translated: If there is another means to prevent the occurrence of what is undesirable and to remedy what has occurred, then what is the use of being displeased at that?🔽Strive at that very thing!

original: de nyid la nan tan du gyis shig / ci ste med na de'i tshe yang de la mi dga' byas ci phan /
analyzed: de nyid la nan tan du gyis shig / ci ste med na de'i tshe yang de la mi dga' byas ci phan /
translated: But if there is no such means, then what is the use of being displeased at that?

original: dgos pa cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: dgos pa cung zad kyang med de /
translated: There is not the slightest purpose.

original: de thabs med pa'i phyir de dag ni thams cad du 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: de thabs med pa'i phyir de dag ni thams cad du 'das pa yin no //
translated: Because there is no means, all of them are beyond your control.

original: de ltar rnam par dpyad nas yid mi bde ba bsal ba nyid mchog yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dpyad nas yid mi bde ba bsal ba nyid mchog yin no //
translated: Thus, having analyzed, it is best to dispel mental unhappiness.

original: goms pa sdug bsngal gnod pa med par 'gyur ba yin no zhes @113a * //🔽rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir brtson par byed pa /
analyzed: goms pa sdug bsngal gnod pa med par 'gyur ba yin no zhes @113a * // rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir brtson par byed pa /
translated: In order to establish that familiarity with suffering is harmless,

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: he says, “Suffering is like a dream,” and so on.

original: sdug bsngal ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Suffering is of two kinds:

original: lus la gnod pa byung ba dang sems la gnod pa byung ba'o //
analyzed: lus la gnod pa byung ba dang sems la gnod pa byung ba'o //
translated: that which arises from harm to the body and that which arises from harm to the mind.

original: de la lus la gnod pa byung ba ni dbyug pa la sogs pa bsnun pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la lus la gnod pa byung ba ni dbyug pa la sogs pa bsnun pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Bodily harm arises from being struck with a club, etc.

original: yid la gnod pa byung ba ni brnyas pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan las so //
analyzed: yid la gnod pa byung ba ni brnyas pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan las so //
translated: Mental harm arises from the occasion of contempt, etc.

original: de la brnyas pa ni ngan pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la brnyas pa ni ngan pa byed pa'o //
translated: Contempt is the doing of harm.

original: tshig rtsub ni gnad 'byed pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: tshig rtsub ni gnad 'byed pa'i tshig ste /
translated: Harsh speech is the speech that pierces the vital parts.

original: mi snyan pa ni grags pa ma yin pa dang / yon tan dang bral bar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mi snyan pa ni grags pa ma yin pa dang / yon tan dang bral bar brjod pa'o //
translated: Disparagement is the expression of disrepute and the absence of good qualities.

original: de dag thams cad ni mi 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni mi 'dod pa yin no //
translated: All of these are undesirable.

original: gal te gzhan las byung na legs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan las byung na legs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If they arise from others, is that not good?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: bshes rnams la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bshes rnams la zhes gsungs te /
translated: Even from friends.

original: gang la bdag nyid kyis khas blangs pa mdza' ba'i gnas de de dag dang bdag nyid la yang ngo //🔽sdug bsngal la sogs pa byed pa po dgra de las bzlog pa 'byung /
analyzed: gang la bdag nyid kyis khas blangs pa mdza' ba'i gnas de de dag dang bdag nyid la yang ngo // sdug bsngal la sogs pa byed pa po dgra de las bzlog pa 'byung /
translated: Even from those who are the abode of friends, who are accepted by oneself, and from oneself.🔽The opposite of that is the agent of suffering, etc.

original: de la ni sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ni sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The enemy is the one who manifestly desires suffering, etc.

original: de la sdug bsngal mi bzod pa de re zhig zlog par byed pa /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal mi bzod pa de re zhig zlog par byed pa /
translated: The first of these is the patience of accepting pain.🔽

original: bde ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The patience that is the remedy for that is taught in the verse beginning with “the cause of happiness.”

original: 'bad pa chen pos dge ba'i phyogs nye bar bsten pa res 'ga' 'am brgya la ste 'khor bar zag pa dang bcas pa'i bde ba shin tu rnyed par dka'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa chen pos dge ba'i phyogs nye bar bsten pa res 'ga' 'am brgya la ste 'khor bar zag pa dang bcas pa'i bde ba shin tu rnyed par dka'o //
translated: The cause of happiness, which is difficult to obtain in cyclic existence, is sometimes, by chance, the virtuous side that is attended with great effort.

original: sdug bsngal ni thams cad du rnyed par sla ste 'bad pa med par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni thams cad du rnyed par sla ste 'bad pa med par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Suffering is easy to obtain everywhere, because it is accomplished without effort.

original: de bas na de goms pa ni dka' ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de goms pa ni dka' ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, its cultivation is not difficult,

original: thams cad du 'dris pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ltar yang 'khor ba nas nges par 'byin pa'i thabs kyang sdug bsngal nyid yin te /
analyzed: thams cad du 'dris pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar yang 'khor ba nas nges par 'byin pa'i thabs kyang sdug bsngal nyid yin te /
translated: because it is familiar everywhere.🔽In this way, moreover, suffering itself is the means of deliverance from cyclic existence.

original: de lta na yang rgyags kyi tshul du de yongs su bzung bar rigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang rgyags kyi tshul du de yongs su bzung bar rigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Even so, it is proper to take it up as a method of self-discipline.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir kye sems sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar bya ba'i phyir brten par gyis la sdang ba la gnas brtan par ma byed cig //🔽/ bam po dgu pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir kye sems sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar bya ba'i phyir brten par gyis la sdang ba la gnas brtan par ma byed cig // / bam po dgu pa /
translated: Since that is so, therefore, O mind, be devoted to experiencing suffering, do not be devoted to being hostile.

original: 'on kyang sdug bsngal 'di don chen po bsgrub pa'i phyir bsten par rigs so snyam du yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni rdzob gtum mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sdug bsngal 'di don chen po bsgrub pa'i phyir bsten par rigs so snyam du yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni rdzob gtum mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: However, one should think, “It is appropriate to rely on this suffering in order to accomplish a great purpose.”

original: rdzong gtum @113b mo'i bu ni gtum mo'i bu ste /
analyzed: rdzong gtum @113b mo'i bu ni gtum mo'i bu ste /
translated: The son of Caṇḍa means the son of Caṇḍa.

original: ston zla 'bring po'i tshes dgu'i dus la sogs par zhag gsum mam zhag gcig tu gso sbyin byas nas lus sreg pa dang gcod pa dang 'bigs par byed pa'i sdug bsngal tshor ba 'bras bu med pa nyams su myong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ston zla 'bring po'i tshes dgu'i dus la sogs par zhag gsum mam zhag gcig tu gso sbyin byas nas lus sreg pa dang gcod pa dang 'bigs par byed pa'i sdug bsngal tshor ba 'bras bu med pa nyams su myong bar byed pa'o //
translated: Having performed the poṣadha for three days or one day at the time of the ninth day of the middle autumn month, etc., one should experience the suffering of burning, cutting, and piercing the body, which is fruitless.

original: de bzhin du yul kar na ta la sogs par byang ba lho phyogs kyi rgyud du gong ma'i ming 'bri ba tsam gyi nga rgyal gyis phan tshun du 'gran par byed pa'i byed pa du mas sdug bsngal nyams su myong zhing srog kyang 'dor bar byed na /
analyzed: de bzhin du yul kar na ta la sogs par byang ba lho phyogs kyi rgyud du gong ma'i ming 'bri ba tsam gyi nga rgyal gyis phan tshun du 'gran par byed pa'i byed pa du mas sdug bsngal nyams su myong zhing srog kyang 'dor bar byed na /
translated: In the same way, in the southern region, those who are skilled in the arts of Karnaṭa and so on, through the pride of merely writing the names of the masters, compete with each other in many ways, experience suffering, and even lose their lives.

original: bdag ni bdag dang gzhan mchog tu dkon pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir brtson par byas pa yin na ci'i phyir sdug bsngal rnams kyis bdar bar bya /
analyzed: bdag ni bdag dang gzhan mchog tu dkon pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir brtson par byas pa yin na ci'i phyir sdug bsngal rnams kyis bdar bar bya /
translated: If that is so, then why should I not be tormented by sufferings when I strive to attain buddhahood, which is supremely rare for myself and others?

original: 'o na de ltar gyur na gal te sdug bsngal shin tu chung ba ni bsten par nus kyis /🔽lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / mgo bo bcad pa la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar gyur na gal te sdug bsngal shin tu chung ba ni bsten par nus kyis / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / mgo bo bcad pa la sogs pa'am /
translated: Well then, if that is the case, one might wonder, “If it is possible to endure very slight suffering,🔽then how can one endure having one’s hands, feet, head, and so on cut off,

original: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las thar pa'i don du ji ltar na bsten par bya zhe na /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las thar pa'i don du ji ltar na bsten par bya zhe na /
translated: or the suffering of the hells and so on, for the sake of being liberated?”

original: 'dir goms na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir goms na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, Shantideva says that if one is accustomed to small sufferings,

original: bstan bcos goms par byed pa dang / sgyu rtsal la sogs pa la mkhas pa la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: bstan bcos goms par byed pa dang / sgyu rtsal la sogs pa la mkhas pa la sogs pa'am /
translated: There is nothing whatsoever that does not become the object of experience through habituation, whether it be the treatises, the arts, and so on, or the experience of small, medium, or great suffering.

original: sdug bsngal chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po tsam nyams su myong bar bya ba'i dngos po gang zhig goms pa'i spyod yul du mi 'gyur ba de cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te thams cad ni goms pas bdag gir bya ba nus so snyam du dgongs🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po tsam nyams su myong bar bya ba'i dngos po gang zhig goms pa'i spyod yul du mi 'gyur ba de cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te thams cad ni goms pas bdag gir bya ba nus so snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that everything can be mastered through habituation.

original: gang gi phyir gnod pa shin tu chung ngu la sogs pa goms par 'gyur ba de'i phyir sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa chen po'ang bsten par mi nus te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnod pa shin tu chung ngu la sogs pa goms par 'gyur ba de'i phyir sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa chen po'ang bsten par mi nus te /
translated: Because one becomes habituated to even the slightest harm, one is able to endure even the great harm of the hells and so on.

original: yun ring por shin tu goms par byas pas slar yang de nyid bde ba'i ngo bor yongs su 'gyur ba 'gro ba yin pas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bde ba nyid ni sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: yun ring por shin tu goms par byas pas slar yang de nyid bde ba'i ngo bor yongs su 'gyur ba 'gro ba yin pas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bde ba nyid ni sdug bsngal te /
translated: Because one becomes thoroughly habituated to it over a long time, it is transformed into the very nature of happiness. Therefore, for bodhisattvas, suffering is happiness.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it has been said:

original: de la sdug bsngal chung ngu la goms pa sngon du btang na dga' ba shin tu dka' ba yang goms par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal chung ngu la goms pa sngon du btang na dga' ba shin tu dka' ba yang goms par 'gyur te /
translated: If one has previously cultivated familiarity with small suffering, then it is not difficult to cultivate familiarity with great joy.🔽For example, through the power of familiarity, those who are stingy perceive suffering as happiness.

original: dper na goms pa'i dbang gis ser sna can rnams sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal 'byung ba thams cad bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas pa @114a * //🔽goms pas bde ba'i 'du shes nyid du nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: dper na goms pa'i dbang gis ser sna can rnams sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal 'byung ba thams cad bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas pa @114a * // goms pas bde ba'i 'du shes nyid du nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: In the same way, through familiarity, the perception of all suffering as happiness arises.

original: de ltar na rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang chos thams cad bde bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob po //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang chos thams cad bde bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob po //
translated: Thus, the result that resembles the cause is the attainment of the samadhi called “all dharmas lead to happiness.”

original: yab dang sras mjal ba las /
analyzed: yab dang sras mjal ba las /
translated: In the Meeting of Father and Son Sutra,🔽it says:
