original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad la bde bar 'gro ba zhes bgyi ba'i ting nge 'dzin mchis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad la bde bar 'gro ba zhes bgyi ba'i ting nge 'dzin mchis te /
translated: “Bhagavat, there is a samadhi called ‘all dharmas lead to happiness.’

original: ting nge 'dzin de gang gis thob pas byang chub sems dpa' dmigs pa'i dngos po thams cad la bde ba'i tshor ba sha stag myong bar 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba mi myong la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de gang gis thob pas byang chub sems dpa' dmigs pa'i dngos po thams cad la bde ba'i tshor ba sha stag myong bar 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba mi myong la /
translated: Through attaining this samādhi, the bodhisattva will experience only pleasant feelings toward all objects of observation and will not experience unpleasant feelings.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma lags /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma lags /
translated: He will not experience suffering.

original: bde ba yang ma lags pa mi myong ste /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma lags pa mi myong ste /
translated: He will not experience that which is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de la sems can dmyal ba'i gnod pas gnod pa bgyis kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba dang / mi'i gnod pas gnod pa bgyis kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas pa dang / lag pa bcad dam /
analyzed: de la sems can dmyal ba'i gnod pas gnod pa bgyis kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba dang / mi'i gnod pas gnod pa bgyis kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas pa dang / lag pa bcad dam /
translated: Even if he is harmed by the harm of the hells, the perception of pleasure will be present. Even if he is harmed by the harm of humans, the perception of pleasure will be present.🔽Even if his hands,

original: rkang pa'am / rna ba 'am /
analyzed: rkang pa'am / rna ba 'am /
translated: feet, ears,

original: sna gtubs kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba dang / rtsa lcag gis gzhus sam /
analyzed: sna gtubs kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba dang / rtsa lcag gis gzhus sam /
translated: or nose are cut off, the perception of pleasure will be present. Even if he is beaten with whips,

original: rtsa lcag phyed tshal lam /
analyzed: rtsa lcag phyed tshal lam /
translated: half-whips,

original: lcag gis gzhus kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas pa dang / btson rar bcug gam /
analyzed: lcag gis gzhus kyang bde ba'i 'du shes nye bar gnas pa dang / btson rar bcug gam /
translated: or lashes, the perception of pleasure will be present. Even if he is imprisoned,🔽suffocated in a poison-filled vessel,

original: dug gi snod ltar bdugs sam /
analyzed: dug gi snod ltar bdugs sam /
translated: Or like a poisonous vessel, it is to be avoided.🔽

original: bu ram shing brdungs pa ltar brdungs sam /
analyzed: bu ram shing brdungs pa ltar brdungs sam /
translated: Are you beaten like sugarcane?

original: 'dom bu gzhom pa ltar bcom mam /
analyzed: 'dom bu gzhom pa ltar bcom mam /
translated: Are you crushed like bamboo?

original: 'bru mar gyi mar me ltar 'bar bar byas sam zhes bya ba nas k'ara sh'a pa na tsam du gtubs sam /
analyzed: 'bru mar gyi mar me ltar 'bar bar byas sam zhes bya ba nas k'ara sh'a pa na tsam du gtubs sam /
translated: Are you burned like a butter lamp?

original: 'bras phye bco ba ltar btsos sam /
analyzed: 'bras phye bco ba ltar btsos sam /
translated: Are you cooked like rice being boiled?

original: glang po che rnams kyis ma nyes kyang bde ba'i 'du shes 'jug go zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: glang po che rnams kyis ma nyes kyang bde ba'i 'du shes 'jug go zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: Even though elephants do not commit offenses, the idea of pleasure arises.

original: gal te dang po gnod pa chung du goms par 'gyur ba de ltar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dang po gnod pa chung du goms par 'gyur ba de ltar 'gyur na /
translated: If it were the case that one would become accustomed to a small amount of harm at first,🔽then it would be so.

original: 'on kyang de nyid med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid med do zhe na /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: 'dir sbrul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir sbrul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, it is said, “What harm is there in being bitten by a snake?”

original: sbrul la sogs pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal don med pa ci ma mthong ste /
analyzed: sbrul la sogs pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal don med pa ci ma mthong ste /
translated: One does not see any meaningless suffering created by a snake, etc.

original: de ni 'bad pa med par grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'bad pa med par grub pa yin te /
translated: That is established without effort.

original: gnod pa chung du goms pa'i rgyu mtshan ni yod pa nyid do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa chung du goms pa'i rgyu mtshan ni yod pa nyid do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The reason is that one becomes accustomed to a small amount of harm.

original: yang gzhan du rang gi sems brtan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang gzhan du rang gi sems brtan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Again, elsewhere, in order to stabilize one’s mind,

original: tsha grang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tsha grang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The words hot and cold, etc. are stated.

original: sems pa ze re can la ni sdug bsngal shin tu ched gnod par @114b 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems pa ze re can la ni sdug bsngal shin tu ched gnod par @114b 'gyur te /
translated: For one who is timid, suffering becomes a great harm.

original: sems brtan pa la ni sdug bsngal yang bzlog nas so //
analyzed: sems brtan pa la ni sdug bsngal yang bzlog nas so //
translated: But for one who is firm, suffering is overcome.

original: sems brtan pa'i yang sdug bsngal mi bzod pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sems brtan pa'i yang sdug bsngal mi bzod pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn't it the case that one who is firm does not tolerate suffering?

original: 'dir la la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir la la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to this, the root text states, Some, etc.

original: sems brten pa la ni mi nus pa zhes bya ba cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: sems brten pa la ni mi nus pa zhes bya ba cung zad kyang med de /
translated: For one who is firm, there is nothing called an inability.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu dpa' bo la la g-yul ngo'i sar bdag gi khrag mthong yang lhag par dpa' ba brtan par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu dpa' bo la la g-yul ngo'i sar bdag gi khrag mthong yang lhag par dpa' ba brtan par byed do //
translated: Thus, some heroes in battle become even more courageous when they see their own blood.

original: yang sems kyi rgyud sngar ba la la ni gzhan gyi khrag mthong bas kyang shi la thug pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang sems kyi rgyud sngar ba la la ni gzhan gyi khrag mthong bas kyang shi la thug pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: But some, when they see the blood of others, experience suffering that is life-threatening.

original: de dag gnyi ga yang gcig la gcig sems goms pa dang bzlog pa las yin no //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga yang gcig la gcig sems goms pa dang bzlog pa las yin no //
translated: Both of these are due to the mind being habituated to one or the other.

original: de ltar shes par byas nas sdug bsngal rnams kyis mi tshugs byos te /
analyzed: de ltar shes par byas nas sdug bsngal rnams kyis mi tshugs byos te /
translated: Having understood it in this way, one should not be overcome by the sufferings.

original: sdug bsngal rnams kyis kyang zil gyis mi non par bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnams kyis kyang zil gyis mi non par bya ste /
translated: And one should not be overwhelmed by the sufferings,

original: sems mi bsgul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems mi bsgul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind is not to be disturbed.

original: de bas na gnod pa zil gyis non cing des ni zil gyis mi gnon no //
analyzed: de bas na gnod pa zil gyis non cing des ni zil gyis mi gnon no //
translated: Therefore, one should overcome the harm, and it should not overcome one.

original: de ltar na yang gnod pa khyad du gsad par bya'o zhes mkhas pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang gnod pa khyad du gsad par bya'o zhes mkhas pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, one should disregard the harm.

original: mkhas pas sngar bstan pa'i dang ba nyams par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pas sngar bstan pa'i dang ba nyams par mi bya'o //
translated: The wise one should not lose the faith that was previously taught.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams dang thabs cig tu g-yul 'gyed par rtsom pa na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams dang thabs cig tu g-yul 'gyed par rtsom pa na /
translated: Because when one begins to fight together with the enemy of the afflictions,

original: g-yul du yang gnod pa zhes bya ba mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dkon te /
analyzed: g-yul du yang gnod pa zhes bya ba mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dkon te /
translated: it is rare that there is no harm in the battle.

original: gnod pa ni mod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa ni mod pa nyid yin no //
translated: Harm is certain.

original: de lta mod kyi shin tu bya dka' ba 'di 'dra ba snang ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi shin tu bya dka' ba 'di 'dra ba snang ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not the case that this kind of extremely difficult thing appears?

original: 'dir gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, “someone” and so on is stated.

original: g-yul ngor dgra bo zil gyis gnon pa la mngon du phyogs pa ni des mtshon brdeg pa brang du phog na'ang phog phog tu dgra las rgyal bar byed pa gang yin pa de dang de dag ni skyes bu dpa' bo yin te /
analyzed: g-yul ngor dgra bo zil gyis gnon pa la mngon du phyogs pa ni des mtshon brdeg pa brang du phog na'ang phog phog tu dgra las rgyal bar byed pa gang yin pa de dang de dag ni skyes bu dpa' bo yin te /
translated: Those who are intent on overpowering the enemy in battle, even though struck by the weapons of the enemy, strike back and conquer the enemy. They are heroes.

original: mchog tu dgra las rnam par rgyal bar byed pas 'di rnam par rgyal ba thob par byas so zhes bsngags par byed do //
analyzed: mchog tu dgra las rnam par rgyal bar byed pas 'di rnam par rgyal ba thob par byas so zhes bsngags par byed do //
translated: Since they are supreme in conquering the enemy, they are praised as “those who have attained victory.”

original: yang gzhan gang zhig don gyis rma la sogs pas dgra zil gyis gnon pa de dag ni cung zad kyang byed pa min pas ro la gsod pa ltar dpa' bo rnams kyis smad par 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: yang gzhan gang zhig don gyis rma la sogs pas dgra zil gyis gnon pa de dag ni cung zad kyang byed pa min pas ro la gsod pa ltar dpa' bo rnams kyis smad par 'os pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, those who conquer the enemy with the wounds and so on of the battle are not doing anything at all. They are like those who kill the dead. They are to be despised by the heroes.

original: yon tan bstan pa 'dis kyang sdug bsngal dang du blang bar @115a * //🔽bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: yon tan bstan pa 'dis kyang sdug bsngal dang du blang bar @115a * // bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: By this teaching of the qualities, one should also accept suffering.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: This is stated by “Moreover” and so on.

original: gzhan yang sdug bsngal 'di'i yon tan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sdug bsngal 'di'i yon tan ni 'di yin te /
translated: Moreover, the good qualities of this suffering are as follows:

original: dge ba'i rgyu rdzogs pa'i lam dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rgyu rdzogs pa'i lam dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of virtue, in accordance with the path of completion.

original: sdug bsngal gang yin la zhugs na skyo ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang yin la zhugs na skyo ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one engages in suffering, one generates disgust.🔽Therefore, it removes the arrogance created by form, youth, wealth, and so on, because it causes one to decline.🔽It generates a compassionate attitude toward those who are oppressed by the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir na gzugs dang lang tsho dang nor la sogs pas byas pa'i dregs pa sel bar byed de nyams par 'gyur ba dang / 'khor ba la ste 'khor ba sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba rnams la snying rje ba'i sems dang / 'di ni sdig pa'i 'bras bu yin no snyam du rig nas sdig pas 'jigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na gzugs dang lang tsho dang nor la sogs pas byas pa'i dregs pa sel bar byed de nyams par 'gyur ba dang / 'khor ba la ste 'khor ba sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba rnams la snying rje ba'i sems dang / 'di ni sdig pa'i 'bras bu yin no snyam du rig nas sdig pas 'jigs te /
translated: It generates fear of misdeeds, thinking, “This is the result of misdeeds.”🔽It generates the attitude of not engaging in misdeeds.

original: mi bya ba'i sems dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis sdug bsngal zad par 'gro ba'i lam nye bar bstan pa'o snyam nas gus pa dang / dad pa dang / sems dang ba'o //
analyzed: mi bya ba'i sems dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis sdug bsngal zad par 'gro ba'i lam nye bar bstan pa'o snyam nas gus pa dang / dad pa dang / sems dang ba'o //
translated: It generates respect, faith, and clarity of mind, thinking, “The Bhagavān Buddha himself taught the path that leads to the end of suffering.”

original: sdug bsngal dang du len pa yang gzhan gyi rkyen gyis byung bar brtag pa mkhris pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang du len pa yang gzhan gyi rkyen gyis byung bar brtag pa mkhris pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The patience of accepting suffering is also examined in terms of its arising from other conditions.

original: lus 'di mkhris pa la sogs pa nyes pa gsum gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: lus 'di mkhris pa la sogs pa nyes pa gsum gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: This body is the nature of the three faults, bile and so forth.

original: de yang rnam pa de lta bu'i zas dang gnas pa dang bral bas ma snyoms pa'i gnas skabs su gyur nas nad skyed par byed de /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa de lta bu'i zas dang gnas pa dang bral bas ma snyoms pa'i gnas skabs su gyur nas nad skyed par byed de /
translated: Moreover, when it is in a state of imbalance due to the absence of food and lifestyle that is suitable, it generates disease.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyur 'gyur ro /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyur 'gyur ro /
translated: It becomes the cause of all suffering.

original: de lta mod kyi de dag la ni bdag mi khro ste sems pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi de dag la ni bdag mi khro ste sems pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, I do not get angry at them, because they are not conscious.

original: de dag bsams bzhin du sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa ni ma yin te //
analyzed: de dag bsams bzhin du sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa ni ma yin te //
translated: They do not generate suffering intentionally.

original: 'on kyang rang gi rgyu tshogs pa'i dbang gis rab tu 'khrug par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi rgyu tshogs pa'i dbang gis rab tu 'khrug par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: However, they are disturbed by the power of the assembly of their own causes.

original: gal te de ltar yin na sems yod rnams la ci ste khro ci ste ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na sems yod rnams la ci ste khro ci ste ma yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then why get angry at conscious beings?

original: de dag kyang ston gyi las la rag las pa'i phyir rang gi rgyu tshogs pa rab tu 'khrugs par gyur pas sdug bsngal bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang ston gyi las la rag las pa'i phyir rang gi rgyu tshogs pa rab tu 'khrugs par gyur pas sdug bsngal bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, since they are dependent on the karma of the teacher, they are generated by suffering due to the complete disturbance of the assemblage of their own causes.

original: de bas na mkhris pa la sogs pa bzhin du de dag la yang bdag khro bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na mkhris pa la sogs pa bzhin du de dag la yang bdag khro bar mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to be angry with them, as with bile, etc.

original: 'dir gnyi ga yang mtshungs par rgyu la rag las pa'i phyir ro zhes nye bar ston pa dper na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir gnyi ga yang mtshungs par rgyu la rag las pa'i phyir ro zhes nye bar ston pa dper na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Here, both are similar in being dependent on a cause. To illustrate this, he says, for example,

original: dper na rang gi rkyen gyis nye bar bskyed pa'i nus pa can mkhris pa la sogs pa 'dod pa med par yang nges par na tsha bskyed pa de bzhin du rang gi rgyu yongs su 'gyur ba la @115b brten pa'i nus pa yid mi bde ba la sogs
analyzed: dper na rang gi rkyen gyis nye bar bskyed pa'i nus pa can mkhris pa la sogs pa 'dod pa med par yang nges par na tsha bskyed pa de bzhin du rang gi rgyu yongs su 'gyur ba la @115b brten pa'i nus pa yid mi bde ba la sogs
translated: just as bile, etc., which are endowed with the potential generated by their own conditions, definitely generate fever without being desired, in the same way, mental dissatisfaction, etc., which are endowed with the potential based on the transformation of their own causes,

original: pas khro ba bskyed do //
analyzed: pas khro ba bskyed do //
translated: generate anger.

original: de ltar na 'di dag thun mong du rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di dag thun mong du rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa yin no //
translated: Thus, they are all in common dependent on causes and conditions.

original: ji ste de ltar na 'dir sems pa dang bcas pa rnams bsams nas rnam pa de ltar mi 'dod pa byed pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ste de ltar na 'dir sems pa dang bcas pa rnams bsams nas rnam pa de ltar mi 'dod pa byed pa yin la /
translated: If it is argued: In that case, here, those who are mindful, having reflected, do not do what is not desired in that way.

original: cig shos ni de ltar ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: cig shos ni de ltar ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The other is not like that.

original: khro bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khro bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “Anger, etc.,”

original: de ni rkyen tshogs pa med par khro bar bya'o zhes de ltar blo sngon du btang nas bsams bzhin du skye bo rnams rang dgar ni med /
analyzed: de ni rkyen tshogs pa med par khro bar bya'o zhes de ltar blo sngon du btang nas bsams bzhin du skye bo rnams rang dgar ni med /
translated: “Anger, etc.,” means that one does not generate anger, etc., without a collection of conditions. Thus, having reflected in advance, one does not generate anger, etc., at will.

original: khro bar mi byed do //
analyzed: khro bar mi byed do //
translated: One does not generate anger, etc., at will.

original: khro ba yang bskyed par bya'o snyam du dgongs nas rang dbang can du mi skye'o //
analyzed: khro ba yang bskyed par bya'o snyam du dgongs nas rang dbang can du mi skye'o //
translated: Having reflected, “I should generate anger,” one does not generate anger, etc., at will.🔽Therefore, here, this is established by valid cognition.

original: de lta bas na 'dir 'di nyid ni tshad mas grub po zhes nyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir 'di nyid ni tshad mas grub po zhes nyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “fault,” etc.

original: 'di dag thams cad ni rkyen 'di dag tsam nye bar gnas pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni rkyen 'di dag tsam nye bar gnas pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: All of these have the nature of being present merely as a collection of conditions.

original: rang dbang du 'jug pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang dbang du 'jug pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no one who engages at will.

original: rkyen rnams tshogs pa de dag kyang rang gi 'bras bu bskyed pa na legs par bsams nas mi skyed de /
analyzed: rkyen rnams tshogs pa de dag kyang rang gi 'bras bu bskyed pa na legs par bsams nas mi skyed de /
translated: When those conditions assemble, they do not produce their effect after careful consideration.

original: de ni rang gi rgyu yongs su 'gyur ba nye ba'i chos nyid kyis rnam pa de 'dra ba'i 'bras bu skyed pa yin te /🔽bsams nas ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni rang gi rgyu yongs su 'gyur ba nye ba'i chos nyid kyis rnam pa de 'dra ba'i 'bras bu skyed pa yin te / bsams nas ni ma yin la /
translated: Rather, they produce that kind of effect by the very nature of their transformation into their own effect.🔽They do not produce it after careful consideration.

original: des bskyed de yang ste 'bras bu yang tshogs pa 'di dag gis bskyed do zhes sems pa yid la byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des bskyed de yang ste 'bras bu yang tshogs pa 'di dag gis bskyed do zhes sems pa yid la byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor does the effect think, “I am produced by this assemblage.”

original: de lta bas na chos thams cad byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di yod pas 'di 'byung la /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos thams cad byed pa med pa'i phyir ro // 'di yod pas 'di 'byung la /
translated: Therefore, because all things are devoid of activity,🔽this exists because that exists.

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba yin pas /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba yin pas /
translated: This arises because that arises.

original: 'gro ba 'di ni rkyen las byung ba tsam ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di ni rkyen las byung ba tsam ste /
translated: This world is merely the occurrence of conditions.

original: 'dir 'ga' yang rang dbang can 'byung ba med de /
analyzed: 'dir 'ga' yang rang dbang can 'byung ba med de /
translated: Nothing whatsoever occurs here that is independent.

original: chos thams cad rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all things are dependent on causes and conditions.

original: 'o na de ltar yin na rang dbang can ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar yin na rang dbang can ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then nothing exists that is independent.

original: ji ltar grangs can pa'i gtso bo dang / bdag dang rigs pa can la sogs pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar grangs can pa'i gtso bo dang / bdag dang rigs pa can la sogs pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa'o //
translated: Just as the pradhāna of the Sāṃkhyas, the self of the Lokāyatas, and space, etc. of the Naiyāyikas, etc.

original: des na ci'i phyir 'di la rang dbang can ni 'ga' yang med do zhes brjod par byed ces dogs pa la /
analyzed: des na ci'i phyir 'di la rang dbang can ni 'ga' yang med do zhes brjod par byed ces dogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, why is it said that nothing is independent?

original: gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “pradhāna,” etc.

original: khyed kyis gang rdul dang mun pa dang snying stobs kyi cha nyam pa'i rang bzhin ni gtso bo zhes 'dod pa'o //🔽da zhes bya zhes pa ni de ni tshad mas grub pa med do zhes mi 'dod @116a * //
analyzed: khyed kyis gang rdul dang mun pa dang snying stobs kyi cha nyam pa'i rang bzhin ni gtso bo zhes 'dod pa'o // da zhes bya zhes pa ni de ni tshad mas grub pa med do zhes mi 'dod @116a * //
translated: What is accepted by you as the pradhāna, which has the nature of the predominance of the modes of passion, darkness, and goodness,🔽is not established by a means of valid knowledge.

original: pa ston par byed ba'o //
analyzed: pa ston par byed ba'o //
translated: This shows that it is not accepted.

original: dngos po 'ga' zhig la bdag ces brtags shing zhen pa gang yin pa de yang tshad ma dang mi ldan no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' zhig la bdag ces brtags shing zhen pa gang yin pa de yang tshad ma dang mi ldan no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Whatever is imagined and adhered to as a self in any entity, that also is not endowed with a means of valid knowledge.🔽This is what is said.

original: gang gi phyir de nyid ni rang nyi de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid ni rang nyi de /
translated: Because that itself is just that,

original: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir 'byung ngo skye'o zhes bsams nas skye ba med do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir 'byung ngo skye'o zhes bsams nas skye ba med do //
translated: it arises, it is born, thinking that it is without a cause other than itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir ma skyes par ni de ste gtso bo la sogs pa snga nas yod pa ma yin pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma skyes par ni de ste gtso bo la sogs pa snga nas yod pa ma yin pa nyid yin la /
translated: Because that which is not arisen, that is, the primal substance and so on, does not exist previously.

original: med pa yang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa lta bu yin na skye bar 'dod par gyur ba gang yin /
analyzed: med pa yang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa lta bu yin na skye bar 'dod par gyur ba gang yin /
translated: And if it does not exist, like the son of a barren woman, what is it that is asserted to arise?

original: ji ste med pa ni 'ga' yang mi skye ste /
analyzed: ji ste med pa ni 'ga' yang mi skye ste /
translated: But if it is said that nothing that does not exist arises,

original: 'on kyang mi gsal ba'i gnas skabs las gsal ba'i gnas skabs su yongs su 'gyur ba tsam yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang mi gsal ba'i gnas skabs las gsal ba'i gnas skabs su yongs su 'gyur ba tsam yin no zhe na /
translated: and that it is merely a transformation from an unclear state to a clear state.

original: gal te de lta yin na yongs su 'gyur ba dang / gsal ba'i gnas skabs kyang med na ji ltar skyed /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na yongs su 'gyur ba dang / gsal ba'i gnas skabs kyang med na ji ltar skyed /
translated: If that were so, then since the transformation and the clear state do not exist, how could they be produced?

original: yongs su 'gyur ba dang gsal ba'i gnas skabs de de'i rang bzhin yin na de yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba dang gsal ba'i gnas skabs de de'i rang bzhin yin na de yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the transformation and the clear state were its nature, then it would follow that it would arise.

original: tha dad pa yin na 'brel pa med pa dang / 'brel pa brtags pa yin na yang thug pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na 'brel pa med pa dang / 'brel pa brtags pa yin na yang thug pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: If they are different, they would be unrelated, and if they are related, the investigation would be endless.

original: 'og nas rgyas par gtso bo 'gegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'og nas rgyas par gtso bo 'gegs par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be extensively refuted below in the chapter on the primal substance.

original: 'o na de ltar na yang bdag la yang nyes pa 'di med pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar na yang bdag la yang nyes pa 'di med pa nyid de /
translated: But even so, this fault does not apply to us.

original: de la ni bdag cag skye bar mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de la ni bdag cag skye bar mi 'dod de /
translated: We do not maintain that the self arises.

original: de ni dul thams cad du rtag pa'i rang bzhin skye ba med pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de ni dul thams cad du rtag pa'i rang bzhin skye ba med pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: It is unborn, having a permanent nature in all circumstances.

original: de ltar 'dod du chug na yang 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du bong bu'i rva dang 'dra ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod du chug na yang 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du bong bu'i rva dang 'dra ba nyid yin te /
translated: Even if we allow this to be so, it is still just like the horn of a donkey.

original: skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unborn.

original: de bas na 'di la /
analyzed: de bas na 'di la /
translated: Therefore, this is said:

original: ma skyes par ni de med na //
analyzed: ma skyes par ni de med na //
translated: If it does not exist without arising,

original: de tshe skye bar 'dod pa gang //
analyzed: de tshe skye bar 'dod pa gang //
translated: then what is it that you assert arises?

original: zhes bya ba'i zhes pa ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i zhes pa ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This statement cannot be avoided.

original: yod na yang 'di la bdag nyid la yang rang dbang nyid med do //
analyzed: yod na yang 'di la bdag nyid la yang rang dbang nyid med do //
translated: Even if it exists, it is not independent with regard to itself.

original: de yang gtso bos gtad pa'i yul nyid la longs spyod pa yin na /
analyzed: de yang gtso bos gtad pa'i yul nyid la longs spyod pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, it experiences only those objects that are presented by the dominant condition.

original: de'i tshe yang lus la longs spyod pa las sngar 'di la longs spyod pa po nyid med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang lus la longs spyod pa las sngar 'di la longs spyod pa po nyid med do //
translated: In that case, prior to the experience of the body, there is no experiencer.

original: phyis skyes pa yang de'i rang bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: phyis skyes pa yang de'i rang bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: Even if it arises later, it has that very nature.

original: gzhan du na de'i longs spyod pa po nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de'i longs spyod pa po nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be reasonable that it is the experiencer of that.

original: de skye ba na yang de yang yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na bdag la skye bar mi 'dod /
analyzed: de skye ba na yang de yang yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na bdag la skye bar mi 'dod /
translated: And when it arises, it is that, so why do you not accept that it arises in the self?

original: yang de nyid /
analyzed: yang de nyid /
translated: Moreover, that very same text says:

original: ma skyes par ni de med na //
analyzed: ma skyes par ni de med na //
translated: If it does not exist without arising,

original: de tshe skye bar 'dod pa gang //
analyzed: de tshe skye bar 'dod pa gang //
translated: then what is it that you assert arises?

original: zhes bya ba 'di @116b 'thob bo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di @116b 'thob bo //
translated: This is obtained.

original: 'dir gzhan yang sun dbyung ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan yang sun dbyung ba gsungs pa /
translated: Here, moreover, it is said to be refuted:

original: yul la rtag tu g-yengs 'gyur bas //
analyzed: yul la rtag tu g-yengs 'gyur bas //
translated: It is always distracted toward objects.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gang gi tshe 'di gtso bos gtad ba'i yul la longs spyod pa'i phyir 'jug pa yin no zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di gtso bos gtad ba'i yul la longs spyod pa'i phyir 'jug pa yin no zhes 'dod na /
translated: if you assert that it engages in order to experience the object that is directed by the dominant condition,

original: de'i tshe sngar 'jug pa med pas phyis kyang 'jug par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe sngar 'jug pa med pas phyis kyang 'jug par mi rigs so //
translated: then since it does not engage previously, it is not reasonable that it engages later.

original: ji ste brgya la 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste brgya la 'jug go zhe na /
translated: But if it does engage,

original: de'i tshe yang yul la g-yengs pa las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang yul la g-yengs pa las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not turn away from being distracted toward objects.

original: de nyid na 'gag par 'gyur ba'ang ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid na 'gag par 'gyur ba'ang ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is said that it does not cease right then.

original: de'i tshe yul la longs spyod pa ldog par yang spro ma med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe yul la longs spyod pa ldog par yang spro ma med par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, the enjoyment of objects would also cease, since there would be no desire.

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, the enjoyment of objects would also not be possible, because it would not have a nature of being active.

original: de yang rtag pa'i phyir mi ldog ste /
analyzed: de yang rtag pa'i phyir mi ldog ste /
translated: And that is permanent, so it does not cease.

original: ldog na yang mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog na yang mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it did cease, it would follow that it is impermanent.

original: rigs pa can la sogs pa'i bdag tu brjod pa ni rtag pa'i phyir de'i khyad par gsungs pa ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rigs pa can la sogs pa'i bdag tu brjod pa ni rtag pa'i phyir de'i khyad par gsungs pa ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The statement of the self of the Naiyāyika and so on is permanent, so why is its distinction stated?

original: 'dir grangs can las bye brag ni sems pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can las bye brag ni sems pa med pa yin te /
translated: Here the difference from the Sāṃkhya is that it is not conscious.

original: gzhan ni mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan ni mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: The rest is the same.

original: de la rtag pa ni dus snga phyir rang bzhin gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de la rtag pa ni dus snga phyir rang bzhin gcig pa'o //
translated: There permanence is the same nature at all times.

original: sems pa med pa yang sems med pa'i rang bzhin te bems po zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: sems pa med pa yang sems med pa'i rang bzhin te bems po zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: And not conscious is the nature of being without mind, meaning it is matter.

original: sems can ni gzhan dang 'brel pas sems par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can ni gzhan dang 'brel pas sems par byed pa'o //
translated: A sentient being is conscious because it is related to something else.

original: mkha' bzhin ni khyab pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' bzhin ni khyab pa'o //
translated: Like space it is pervasive.

original: de'i phyir mngon te byed pa med par gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon te byed pa med par gsal ba'o //
translated: Therefore it is manifest, meaning it is active.

original: gang gzhan dag /
analyzed: gang gzhan dag /
translated: But others say:

original: 'dod pa la sogs rten pa dang // rang ni sems med ngo bo dang // rtags dang de bzhin kun khyab dang // dge dang mi dge'i las rnams kyis //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs rten pa dang // rang ni sems med ngo bo dang // rtags dang de bzhin kun khyab dang // dge dang mi dge'i las rnams kyis //
translated: It is the sign, and likewise the pervader,🔽And it is the experiencer of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: byed pa po dang de 'bras bu //
analyzed: byed pa po dang de 'bras bu //
translated: It is the agent and the experiencer of the results.

original: longs spyod pa dang sems pa dang // ldan phyir sems pa'i rang bzhin gyi //
analyzed: longs spyod pa dang sems pa dang // ldan phyir sems pa'i rang bzhin gyi //
translated: Because it possesses enjoyment and thought,

original: bdag tu 'di ni 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: bdag tu 'di ni 'dod pa yin //
translated: This is asserted to be the nature of the self.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: de ltar na 'di ni ci yang mi byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni ci yang mi byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus it does nothing at all,

original: bya ba 'ga' la yang mi mkho ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba 'ga' la yang mi mkho ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not required for any action.

original: 'on te byed pa med pa la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gzhan nye ba las de la yang byed pa khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'on te byed pa med pa la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gzhan nye ba las de la yang byed pa khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: But if you accept that it is an agent because it is the support of the conditions that are its auxiliaries,

original: gang shes pa dang rtsal ba dang 'brel pa de la byed pa nyid du bshad ces gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: gang shes pa dang rtsal ba dang 'brel pa de la byed pa nyid du bshad ces gsungs so zhe na /
translated: Then it is explained that it is an agent in virtue of being related to consciousness and effort.🔽Here Nāgārjuna explains:

original: 'dir rkyen gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir rkyen gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The so-called other conditions

original: shes pa dang rtsol ba la sogs pa rkyen gzhan rnams dang phrad na yang rtag pa'i phyir 'gyur ba @117a * //
analyzed: shes pa dang rtsol ba la sogs pa rkyen gzhan rnams dang phrad na yang rtag pa'i phyir 'gyur ba @117a * //
translated: If it were to meet with other conditions, such as consciousness and effort, it would be permanent and therefore unchanging.

original: med pa sngar gyi rang bzhin las 'pho ba med pa'i bdag la ci byar yod /
analyzed: med pa sngar gyi rang bzhin las 'pho ba med pa'i bdag la ci byar yod /
translated: What could be done to the self that is devoid of a nature that is different from the previous?

original: de la bya ba yod par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la bya ba yod par mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical for it to have activity.

original: byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With respect to “the agent and action,”

original: ji ltar gang zhig sngon byed pa med pa'i dus na yin pa de byed pa'i dus na yang yin na byed pa po'i rang bzhin dang bral ba de la byed pa pos ci zhig byas /
analyzed: ji ltar gang zhig sngon byed pa med pa'i dus na yin pa de byed pa'i dus na yang yin na byed pa po'i rang bzhin dang bral ba de la byed pa pos ci zhig byas /
translated: if something exists at the time when it is not an agent, then at the time when it is an agent, it would be devoid of the nature of an agent. What would an agent do?

original: gang gis na rkyen gzhan dang phrad pa de la bya ba rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin /
analyzed: gang gis na rkyen gzhan dang phrad pa de la bya ba rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin /
translated: By what would activity be posited in relation to it?

original: gzhan yang 'brel pa gnyi ga med pa'i phyir na bdag de'i byed pa 'di yin no zhes 'brel par 'gyur ba gang zhig yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'brel pa gnyi ga med pa'i phyir na bdag de'i byed pa 'di yin no zhes 'brel par 'gyur ba gang zhig yod de /
translated: Moreover, since neither relation exists, how could it be related to the self such that it is said, “This is the activity of the self”?

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan ci yod /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan ci yod /
translated: What is the reason?

original: ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no reason at all.

original: bdag dang dbang phyug kyang rgyas par 'gegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag dang dbang phyug kyang rgyas par 'gegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because the self and God are refuted in detail.

original: rang dbang can 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang dbang can 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: No one is independent.

original: de ltar thams cad du rang dbang can ma yin par bsgrubs nas mjug bsdu ba ni /🔽de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te//
analyzed: de ltar thams cad du rang dbang can ma yin par bsgrubs nas mjug bsdu ba ni / de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te//
translated: Having thus established that nothing is independent, the conclusion is stated:

original: de ltar bstan pa'i tshul gyis phyi dang nang gi dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad gzhan gyi dbang ste gzhan la rag las pa yin no //🔽de ltar na 'o na gang gi dbang yin pa de ni gzhan la rag las pa ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i tshul gyis phyi dang nang gi dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad gzhan gyi dbang ste gzhan la rag las pa yin no // de ltar na 'o na gang gi dbang yin pa de ni gzhan la rag las pa ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Thus, as taught, all aspects of external and internal things are dependent on another, are dependent on what is other.🔽If that is so, then what is dependent on another is not dependent on what is other? No, it is not so.

original: gang gi dbang gis de dbang med de /
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis de dbang med de /
translated: Because that which is dependent on another is not independent.

original: rang gi rgyu'i gzhan gyi dbang yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu'i gzhan gyi dbang yin no //
translated: It is dependent on its own cause.

original: de ltar na rgyu de yang rang gi rgyu las skye ba'i phyir thog ma med par 'khor ba'i brgyud pa la 'ga' yang rang dbang can du gyur pa mi srid do //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu de yang rang gi rgyu las skye ba'i phyir thog ma med par 'khor ba'i brgyud pa la 'ga' yang rang dbang can du gyur pa mi srid do //
translated: Thus, since that cause also arises from its own cause, it is impossible for anything to be independent in the beginningless cycle of existence.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad ni byed pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad ni byed pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are devoid of activity.

original: don dam par su zhig su la gnod pa byed /
analyzed: don dam par su zhig su la gnod pa byed /
translated: Ultimately, who harms whom?

original: de bas na gnod pa byed pa gang la gnod pa byas pa gang zhig gang zhe sdang 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na gnod pa byed pa gang la gnod pa byas pa gang zhig gang zhe sdang 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, what harm is done to what agent, that anger would arise?

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He says just that:

original: mya ngan 'das lta'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das lta'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “One should not be angry at nirvāṇa,” and so on.

original: byed pa'i rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin du sems pa med cing g-yo ba med pa'i chos thams cad de ltar gyur pa rnams pa su la khro bar byed de /
analyzed: byed pa'i rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin du sems pa med cing g-yo ba med pa'i chos thams cad de ltar gyur pa rnams pa su la khro bar byed de /
translated: Since all phenomena are devoid of all conceptual thought, like nirvāṇa, they are without mind and without movement. How could one be angry at those that are such?

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa dag 'ga' la yang khro bar mi rigs so snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa dag 'ga' la yang khro bar mi rigs so snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The thought is that it is not reasonable for those who have conceptual thought to be angry at anything.

original: 'o na de ltar yin na gcig bsgrub pa na gnyis pa nyams par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar yin na gcig bsgrub pa na gnyis pa nyams par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa /
translated: Well, if that is so, then when one is accomplished, the other will be lost.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says that with “By whom,” and so on.

original: bsgrub @117b pa'i rigs pa bzlog pa'ang ste phyir bzlog pa'ang myang 'das lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsgrub @117b pa'i rigs pa bzlog pa'ang ste phyir bzlog pa'ang myang 'das lta bu'o //
translated: And the reverse of the reasoning of proof is also the case, for example, with nirvana.

original: sems med dngos rnams la mi rigs so //
analyzed: sems med dngos rnams la mi rigs so //
translated: It is not logical for things without mind.
